classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned to mold and reshape the magic that curses you into spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the Witch spell list. {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} and {@spell Minor Illusion|XPHB} are recommended. You can choose {@filter Hexes|spells|level=0|class=witch (wc:vss)|subschool=hex} when you pick Witch cantrips.
Whenever you gain a Witch level, you can replace one of your cantrips with another cantrip of your choice from the Witch spell list.
When you reach Witch levels 4 and 10, you learn another cantrip of your choice from the Witch spell list, as shown in the Cantrips column of the Witch Features table

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Witch Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two level 1 spells from the Witch spell list. {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter} and {@spell Thunderwave|XPHB} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Witch levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Witch Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Witch spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

If another Witch feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Witch spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you gain a Witch level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Witch spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Witch spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item Arcane Focus|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Witch spells.

classFeature.name: Witch's Curse
entries: You are wracked by a terrible curse which infects your body and soul. Choose the form that this curse takes from the following options.

classFeature.name: Hexes
entries: You learn a number of powerful cantrips, known as {@filter Hexes|spells|level=0|class=witch (wc:vss)|subschool=hex}, derived from the same insidious magic that cursed you.

You know two Hexes of your choice from the Witch spell list, which don't count against your number of cantrips known. {@spell Hex: Misfortune|ValdaSpire24} and {@spell Hex: Ruin|ValdaSpire24} are recommended. Whenever you gain a Witch level, you can replace one of your Hexes with another Hex of your choice from the Witch spell list. When you gain certain Witch levels, you gain more Hexes of your choice, as shown in the Hexes column of the Witch Features table.

classFeature.name: Cackle
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to Cackle. When you do so, you extend the duration of one of your {@filter Hexes|spells|level=0|subschool=hex} by 1 round, provided the target of the Hex is within the spell's range.

Not all Witches laugh maniacally when they Cackle, but all Cackles require a Verbal component, as if casting a spell. These range from mundane curses and insults, to the murmuring of dead languages and speaking backwards.

classFeature.name: Familiar
entries: You always have the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell prepared, and you can cast it in 10 minutes without a spell slot or components. The spell is improved in the following ways when you cast it.

entries.name: Expanded Options
entries: You can choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: {@creature Death Snail|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Flying Book|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Homunculus|XMM}, {@creature Mock|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Moon Jelly|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Pet Rock|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Pseudodragon|XMM} (can't use its Sting), {@creature Rag Doll|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Tin Soldier|ValdaWitch}, and {@creature Winter Wolf Pup|ValdaWitch}. The statistics for creatures marked with an asterisk can be found in the Familiars section later in the class description.

entries.name: Witch Familiar
entries: The familiar's stat block is improved, as detailed in the Witch Familiar sidebar.

entries.name: Synchronized Turns
entries: Your familiar takes its turn immediately before or after your turn each round (your choice).

entries.name: Quick Attack
entries: Once per turn as an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can command your familiar to take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action (one attack only) on its turn.

entries.name: Spell Channeling
entries: When you cast a spell with a {@filter range other than Self|spells|class=witch (wc:vss)|range=!self;!self (area)} on your turn, you can cast it as if you were in your familiar's space. The familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to deliver the spell when you cast the spell as normal.

entries.name: Witch Familiar
entries: As a Witch, the stat block of a familiar you summon is improved in the following ways.

entries.name: Hit Points
entries: You add twice your Witch level to your familiar's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum.

entries.name: Your Spell Attack Modifier
entries: Your familiar can use your spell attack modifier for its attack rolls.

entries.name: Your Saving Throw
entries: If your familiar forces a creature to make a saving throw, it uses your spell save DC.

entries.name: Your Proficiency Bonus
entries: Your familiar adds your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to its AC, saving throws, and damage rolls.

classFeature.name: Witch Subclass
entries: You gain a Witch subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Witch levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Witch level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Insidious Spell
entries: When a creature fails its saving throw against one of your {@filter Hexes|spells|level=0|subschool=hex}, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saving throws it makes against your Witch spells before the end of your next turn. Similarly, if it fails its saving throw against one of your Witch spells, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saving throws it makes against your Hexes until the end of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Witch Subclass.

classFeature.name: Improved Familiar
entries: Your {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell improves in the following ways.

entries.name: Force Damage
entries: Whenever your familiar deals damage with an attack, it can deal your choice of Force or its normal damage type.

entries.name: Expanded Options
entries: You can choose one of the following forms for your familiar: {@creature Fright|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Grep|ValdaWitch}, {@creature Imp|XMM}, {@creature Quasit|XMM}, {@creature Sprite|XMM}, or {@creature Yarn Golem|ValdaWitch}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Hastened Hex
entries: Once per turn when you cast a {@filter Hex|spells|level=0|subschool=hex} as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cast a {@filter Witch cantrip that isn't a Hex|spells|level=0|class=witch (wc:vss)|subschool=!hex|cast time=action} and has a casting time of an action as a part of that casting.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Witch Subclass.

classFeature.name: Grand Hex
entries: You have perfected deeply malevolent forms of magic. You gain one {@filter Grand Hex|optionalfeatures|source=valdawitch|feature type=gh} of your choice. Whenever you gain a Witch level, you can replace one of your Grand Hexes with another one.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Grand Hex
entries: You have perfected deeply malevolent forms of magic. You gain one {@filter Grand Hex|optionalfeatures|source=valdawitch|feature type=gh} of your choice. Whenever you gain a Witch level, you can replace one of your Grand Hexes with another one.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Witch Subclass.

classFeature.name: Grand Hex
entries: You have perfected deeply malevolent forms of magic. You gain one {@filter Grand Hex|optionalfeatures|source=valdawitch|feature type=gh} of your choice. Whenever you gain a Witch level, you can replace one of your Grand Hexes with another one.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Grand Hex
entries: You have perfected deeply malevolent forms of magic. You gain one {@filter Grand Hex|optionalfeatures|source=valdawitch|feature type=gh} of your choice. Whenever you gain a Witch level, you can replace one of your Grand Hexes with another one.

classFeature.name: Vengeful Curse
entries: When an enemy you can see within 60 feet of yourself deals damage that causes you or an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} you can see within 60 feet of yourself to become {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to curse the enemy. Until the end of your next turn, the cursed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Hexmaster
entries: You have mastered your foul magic. When you cast a {@filter Hex that requires a saving throw|spells|level=0|class=witch (wc:vss)|subschool=hex|saving throw=strength;dexterity;constitution;intelligence;wisdom;charisma}, you can cause one target to automatically fail.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore one use of it by expending a spell slot (no action required).

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned the simple, yet potent brand of spellcasting for which Warmages are known.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know four Warmage cantrips of your choice. {@spell Force Dart|ValdaSpire24}, {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB}, {@spell Quickstep|ValdaSpire24}, and {@spell Shocking Grasp|XPHB} are recommended. Whenever you gain a Warmage level, you can replace one of your cantrips from this feature with another Warmage cantrip of your choice. You can't replace a cantrip that is a prerequisite for a {@filter Warmage trick|optionalfeatures|source=ValdaWarmage|feature type=wt}, unless you replace the trick at the same time.
You learn additional Warmage cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips column of the Warmage Features table.
If another Warmage feature gives you cantrips, those cantrips don't count against your number of cantrips known, but otherwise count as Warmage cantrips for you.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Warmage spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item Arcane Focus|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Warmage spells.

classFeature.name: Arcane Initiation
entries: Choose where you first learned the basics of magic.

entries.name: Making Your Own Initiation
entries: You can work with your GM to create an Arcane Initiation to suit your character's background. Choose two cantrips of your choice from any class's spell list; one cantrip should be suitable for combat, and the other for utility. Avoid choosing cantrips that are otherwise exclusive to another spellcaster. Also choose one skill.

classFeature.name: Warmage Edge
entries: Once per turn when you cast a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can improve the spell, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Intelligence to Damage
entries: Add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll of the spell if you don't already add it.

entries.name: Improved Cantrip Upgrade
entries: Starting at Warmage level 5, you improve one damage roll of the spell, adding extra dice to the damage roll as shown on the Cantrip Bonus Dice column of the Warmage Features table.

classFeature.name: Reliable Cantrip
entries: When you cast a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)} at a creature and you miss with the attack roll or the target succeeds on a saving throw against the cantrip, the target takes the cantrip's minimum amount of damage (if any) but suffers no additional effect from the cantrip. You can apply {@classFeature Warmage Edge|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|1} to this damage (which also deals minimum damage), but you can't use this damage to trigger {@classFeature Warmage Tricks|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|2}. For example, if you cast {@spell Force Dart|ValdaSpire24} and miss, you can apply {@classFeature Warmage Edge|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|1} to deal Force damage equal to 1 plus your Intelligence modifier.

classFeature.name: Warmage Tricks
entries: You learn to use Warmage tricks, special techniques that alter the way you fight, move, and cast your spells. You learn two tricks of your choice for which you meet the prerequisites. Warmage Tricks are described in the "Warmage Trick Options" section later on in the class's description.

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: If a trick has a prerequisite, you must meet it to learn that trick. For example, if a trick requires you to be a level 5+ Warmage, you can select the trick once you reach Warmage level 5.

entries.name: Replacing and Gaining Tricks
entries: Whenever you gain a Warmage level, you can replace one of your tricks with another one for which you qualify. When you gain certain Warmage levels, you gain more tricks of your choice, as shown in the Tricks column of the Warmage Features table. You can't pick the same trick more than once unless its description says otherwise.

classFeature.name: Warmage Subclass
entries: You gain a Warmage subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Warmage levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Warmage level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Arcane Surge
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you deal damage with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can double the number of damage dice dealt by the spell, as if you scored a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. If you use this feature to improve a spell that has already scored a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}, the cantrip deals triple the number of damage dice in total.

You can use this feature twice. You regain one of its expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You gain an additional use when you reach Warmage level 11.

classFeature.name: Tactical Insight
entries: You gain a bonus to saving throws against spells and other magical effects equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum bonus of +1). You don't gain this bonus to Intelligence saving throws.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Warmage Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Warmage Subclass.

classFeature.name: Arcane Surge Improvement
entries: You gain an additional use of {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|5}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Strategic Deflection
entries: When a creature casts a spell that forces you to make a saving throw to avoid damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to attempt to redirect some of the spell's energy to a new target. If you succeed on your saving throw against the spell, choose another creature you can see within the spell's range or up to 30 feet away from you, whichever is closer, to make a saving throw against the spell, using your spell save DC. The chosen creature can be the original spellcaster. On a failed save, the creature suffers the effects of the spell as if you had cast the spell and it had been the original target or been within the area of the spell.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Warmage Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Warmage Subclass.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Master Warmage
entries: Whenever you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} and have no uses of {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|5} left, you regain one expended use of it.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Though it steadily burns away your very soul, you can cast necromantic spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know three Necromancer cantrips of your choice. {@spell Dancing Lights|XPHB}, {@spell Mending|XPHB}, and {@spell Ray of Frost|XPHB} are recommended. Whenever you gain a Necromancer level, you can replace one of your cantrips from this feature with another Necromancer cantrip of your choice.
When you reach Necromancer levels 4 and 10, you learn another Necromancer cantrip of your choice, as shown in the Cantrips column of the Necromancer Features table.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Necromancer Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose four level 1 Necromancer spells. {@spell Exhume|ValdaSpire24}, {@spell Mage Armor|XPHB}, {@spell Ray of Sickness|XPHB}, and {@spell Silent Image|XPHB} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Necromancer levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Necromancer Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional Necromancer spells until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the Necromancer Features table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

If another Necromancer feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Necromancer spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you gain a Necromancer level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Necromancer spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Necromancer spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an Arcane Focus as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Necromancer spells.

classFeature.name: Charnel Touch
entries: You can draw upon an inner nexus of necromantic power. You have a pool of Charnel Touch points equal to 5 x your Necromancer level that replenishes when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can channel this negative energy through your touch. Choose a number of Charnel Touch points to expend, up to a maximum of 5 x your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and make a melee spell attack against one creature within reach. On a hit, the target takes Necrotic damage equal to the number of points expended. This damage is doubled without expending additional points if the attack roll scores a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. If the spell attack misses, the Charnel Touch points aren't expended.

classFeature.name: Thralls
entries: Unlike other spellcasters, you animate Undead creatures with a portion of your own life force, ensuring obedience.

entries.name: Animate Thralls
entries: You can animate Undead thralls by performing a ritual over the course of 10 minutes, which can be done during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}. The remains of one or more Medium or Small Humanoids within 30 feet of yourself rise as Undead creatures. These Undead become your thralls, and you maintain control over them indefinitely.

entries.name: Combat
entries: You can mentally control all your thralls without an action. If you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, your thralls will move to protect your body from harm, but won't attack.

In combat, your thralls take their turns immediately before or after your turn each round (your choice). All thralls collectively share one {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, which a single thrall can use each round.

entries.name: Attacks and Save DCs
entries: Thralls use your spell attack modifier for their attacks. If one of your thralls forces a creature to make a saving throw, it uses your spell save DC.

entries.name: Healing your Thralls
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} on Undead under your control without making an attack roll. Instead of dealing Necrotic damage, the Undead regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the number of Charnel Touch points expended.

entries.name: Maximum Thralls
entries: You can animate and control one thrall that has a {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} of 1/4. As you gain Necromancer levels, you can animate more thralls. The combined CR of all your thralls can't exceed the number shown in the CR Total column of the Necromancer Features table, and the total number of thralls under your control can't exceed the number shown in the Thralls column of the Necromancer Features table.
At any time, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to sever your connection to one or more thralls. Corporeal Undead crumple into a heap and incorporeal Undead flee to the Ethereal Plane.

entries.name: Other Undead
entries: When you cast {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB}, {@spell Create Undead|XPHB}, or another spell that lets you create or control Undead, the Undead count as your thralls and can be commanded as such. If these thralls exceed your total {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} or number of thralls, you can immediately sever your connection to any of your existing thralls to stay within these limits. Your thralls can never command or create other Undead.

As always, you can't reanimate Undead that have been reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Your Animate Thralls ritual, the {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} spell, and similar magic only affects Humanoid corpses, whereas your thralls are Undead creatures.

entries.name: Necromancer Variant Rules
entries: Use the following variant rules to tailor this class to your table and preferred playstyle.

entries.name: Necromancy Unleashed
entries: In order to ensure timely, balanced play, this class imposes limitations on the number of Undead a player can command, including with spells such as {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB}. Use this variant rule if you want to throw caution to the wind and embrace the undead horde experience.

Ignore the "Other Undead" section in the {@classFeature Thralls|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|2} feature. Undead animated with spells are separate from your thralls for the purposes of your class features, and have no other class-based limitations.

entries.name: Alternate Necromancers
entries: Necromancers may fuel their spellcasting through ambition or zeal, rather than intellect. When you become a Necromancer, you can choose Wisdom or Charisma for the Primary Ability in the Core Necromancer Traits table. The chosen ability becomes your spellcasting ability, and replaces any Necromancer feature which uses Intelligence.
A Necromancer that uses Wisdom is called a "Resurrectionist" and one that uses Charisma is called a "Ghoul."

classFeature.name: Dead Space
entries: You gain an extradimensional space that can hold up to 12 Medium or smaller corpses, piles of bones, or Undead creatures. The extradimensional space is linked to an item of your choice, such as a bag, a cloak, or a backpack. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can use the linked item to place a corpse, pile of bones, or willing Undead creature in the extradimensional space, or to dump out contents of your choice from the extradimensional space. {@classFeature Thralls|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|2} stored in your Dead Space count toward the total number of thralls under your control. The contents land in spaces of your choice within 5 feet of you, or as near to you as possible if those spaces are occupied.

You can link any item you can carry to the extradimensional space by performing a ritual over the course of 1 hour which can be done during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}. The previous item linked to the space becomes disconnected when you link a new one.

classFeature.name: Necromancer Subclass
entries: You gain a Necromancer subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Necromancer levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Necromancer level or lower.

classFeature.name: Dark Arcana
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend a spell slot to replenish your {@classFeature Charnel Touch|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|1} pool. The pool regains points equal to your Intelligence modifier plus {@dice 1d8} for each level of the spell slot expended, up to a maximum of your pool's total.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Animate Dead
entries: You always have the {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} spell prepared. When you cast this spell, its casting time is an action instead of 1 minute. You can also create a {@creature Spirit|ValdaNecromancer} using the spell. Additionally, you can animate the corpse of any Medium or Small creature that isn't Undead, instead of only Humanoids. The resulting Undead always uses the statistics of a {@creature Skeleton|ValdaNecromancer}, {@creature Spirit|ValdaNecromancer}, or {@creature Zombie|ValdaNecromancer}.

classFeature.name: Critical Spellcasting
entries: Your potent Necromancy grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Critical Failures
entries: When a creature rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20} for a saving throw against one of your spells, it suffers a Critical Failure. It fails the save regardless of its modifiers or the spell save DC. If the spell deals damage, you roll all of the spell's damage dice twice and add them together, then add any relevant modifiers. This additional damage applies only to the creature that rolled a 1.

entries.name: Improved Critical
entries: Your spell attacks can score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Necromancer Subclass.

classFeature.name: Improved Thralls
entries: Your {@classFeature Thralls|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|2} grow stronger under your control, granting the following benefits.

entries.name: Avoidance
entries: If one of your thralls is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

entries.name: Necrotic Damage
entries: Whenever one of your thralls deals Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage, you can make it deal Necrotic damage instead.

entries.name: Turn Immunity
entries: Your thralls have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions, and are immune to effects that turn Undead.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Necromancer Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Improved Critical Spellcasting
entries: Your {@classFeature Critical Spellcasting|Necromancer|ValdaNecromancer|5} improves in the following ways.

entries.name: Critical Failures
entries: A creature suffers a Critical Failure when it rolls a 1 or 2 on the {@dice d20} for a saving throw against one of your spells.

entries.name: Improved Critical
entries: Your spell attacks can now score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20 on the {@dice d20}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Undying Servitude
entries: When one of your thralls is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cause it to drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead and regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice your Necromancer level.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 3+ spell slot (no action required).

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Lichdom
entries: You unlock the pinnacle of necromantic prowess, through which you conquer death itself: The Rite of Lichdom.

entries.name: Becoming a Lich
entries: The Rite of Lichdom is a ritual that you can perform over the course of 30 days in an isolated location. Once completed, your soul is bound to a spirit jar and you become a lich, an Undead of incredible power. You gain the following benefits, as well as those granted by your Necromancer subclass.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are Undead. You are immune to any effect that turns Undead.

entries.name: Spirit Jar
entries: A spirit jar is an object that houses a lich's soul, safeguarding its immortality. If you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, your body crumbles to dust and you reform after {@dice 1d4 + 1} days, reviving with all of your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Your new body coalesces in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of your spirit jar. The new body is identical in every way to the one that was destroyed but has none of the original's equipment.

entries.name: Truesight
entries: You have {@sense Truesight|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet.

entries.name: Undead Immunities
entries: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Necrotic and Poison damage and to the {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} and {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} conditions.

entries.name: Spirit Jar
entries: A lich's spirit jar, or "phylactery," is as much a memento as it is their anchor to immortality, and as such, no two are alike. Spirit jars are often constructed from objects with sentimental value, such as family heirlooms or prized possessions, but can be fashioned from swords, pieces of armor, or even entire castles.

Furthermore, every spirit jar has a weakness, a critical flaw by which it can be destroyed, allowing its lich to be slain permanently. These weaknesses, too, are unique to each jar. One might require a ritual to be performed around it for 24 hours, while another might call for the jar to be dipped in the lava of an active volcano. Discuss with your GM the form your spirit jar takes and the weakness it possesses.

classFeature.name: Ritualist
entries: You have learned to cast {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB|Rituals} to overcome supernatural threats.

entries.name: Grimoire
entries: Your {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB|Rituals} are recorded in a grimoire, a Tiny object that weighs 3 pounds and contains 100 pages. You determine the grimoire's appearance and materials.

The grimoire starts with four level 1 {@filter Investigator spells|spells|class=investigator (ic:vss)} of your choice. {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB}, {@spell Heroism|XPHB}, {@spell Memorize|ValdaSpire24}, and {@spell Transient Bulwark|ValdaSpire24} are recommended.

Whenever you gain an Investigator level, you can add two Investigator spells of your choice to your grimoire. The {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB} Level column on the Investigator Feature table shows the maximum level of a spell you can add to your grimoire.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast any spell as a {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB} if that spell has the {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB} tag and the spell is in your grimoire. You must read from the book to cast a spell in this way. You can't cast spells that are in your grimoire except as {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB|Rituals}, unless you've learned them by other means.

entries.name: Bonus Rituals
entries: You can treat specific spells as if they have the {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB} tag, allowing you to add them to your grimoire and cast them as {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB|Rituals}. These spells are marked in the {@filter Investigator Spells list|spells|class=investigator (ic:vss)}.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Investigator spells.

entries.name: Expanding and Replacing a Grimoire
entries: The spells you add to your grimoire represent research into occult and supernatural threats, but you might find other spells during your adventures that you can add to your grimoire.

entries.name: Copying a Spell into the Grimoire
entries: When you find a level 1+ Investigator spell, you can copy it into your grimoire if it's of an eligible level and if you have time to copy it. For each level of the spell, the transcription takes 2 hours and costs 50 GP.

entries.name: Copying the Grimoire
entries: You can copy a spell from your grimoire into another book. This is like copying a new spell into your grimoire but faster, since you already know how to cast the spell. You need spend only 1 hour and 10 GP for each level of the copied spell.

If you lose your grimoire, you can recall from memory a number of spells equal to your Investigator level and use the same procedure to transcribe the spells into a new grimoire. Filling out the remainder of the new book requires you to find new spells to do so. For this reason, many Investigators keep a backup grimoire.

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the {@variantrule weapon mastery properties|XPHB|mastery properties} of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as Rapiers and Heavy Crossbows.
Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change the kinds of weapons you chose.

classFeature.name: Expertise
entries: You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in two of your skill proficiencies of your choice. {@skill Arcana|XPHB} and {@skill Investigation|XPHB} are recommended if you have proficiency in them.
At Investigator level 9, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in two more of your skill proficiencies of your choice.

classFeature.name: Finisher
entries: Once per turn when you deal damage with a weapon to a creature that is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d8} damage to the target. The damage is the same type as the damage dealt by the weapon.
This damage increases as you gain Investigator levels, as shown in the Finisher column of the Investigator Features table.

classFeature.name: Rushed Incantation
entries: You can hastily perform any spell in your grimoire that has a casting time of an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, casting the spell as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. You can cast it without Material components unless the components have a cost of 100+ GP specified by the spell.

You can use this feature three times. You regain one of its expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You gain additional uses when you reach certain Investigator levels, as shown in the Rushed Incantation column of the Investigator Features table.

classFeature.name: Investigator Subclass
entries: You gain a Investigator subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Investigator levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Investigator level or lower.

classFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: Your subclass grants you a number of supernatural trinkets to aid you in defeating supernatural threats and unraveling mysteries. You can use this feature twice, activating one of your trinket options each time you use it. You regain one of its expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You gain additional uses when you reach certain Investigator levels, as shown in the Trinkets column of the Investigator Features table.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Exploit Weakness
entries: Once per turn when you deal damage to a creature with an attack using a weapon, you can target the creature where it is most vulnerable to gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Damage Vulnerability
entries: Choose one damage type dealt by the attack. The target has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to the chosen damage type for this attack. {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} from this feature doesn't double extra damage from spells (such as {@spell Hunter's Mark|XPHB}) or features from other classes (such as the Rogue's Sneak Attack). The {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} doesn't apply to this attack if the target has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the chosen damage type.

entries.name: Disrupt Resistance
entries: If the target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to one or more damage types, it loses these Resistances until the start of your next turn, including against the damage of the triggering attack.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Investigator Subclass.

classFeature.name: Holy Trinkets
entries: You keep a wide array of {@item Holy Symbol|XPHB|Holy Symbols} and blessed items on your person, even if you aren't particularly pious. You can use the following trinkets (expending a use of your {@classFeature Trinkets|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|3} to do so).

entries.name: Amulet of Warding
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you place a divine ward on a creature of your choice within 60 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn, the warded creature gains a bonus to AC and saving throws equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

entries.name: Restorative Ankh
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, a creature of your choice within 60 feet of you regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Investigator level plus your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Rune of Banishment
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or be banished to a harmless location in the Ethereal Plane. While banished, the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition and its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0. At the start of your next turn, the creature reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Expertise
entries: At Investigator level 9, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in two more of your skill proficiencies of your choice.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Investigator Subclass.

classFeature.name: Improved Finisher
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can use your Finisher on a creature that isn't {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, dealing only an extra {@damage 1d8} damage to the target.
At Investigator level 17, this damage increases to {@dice 2d8}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Enigma Arcane
entries: You learn a secret that unlocks potent arcane magic. You gain the ability to cast a level 7 spell, and discover additional secrets when you reach certain Investigator levels.

entries.name: Level 7 Spell
entries: You can cast one of the following spells without a spell slot and regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}: {@spell Mirage Arcane|XPHB}, {@spell Plane Shift|XPHB}, {@spell Reverse Gravity|XPHB}, {@spell Sequester|XPHB}, or {@spell Teleport|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Investigator Subclass.

entries.name: Level 8 Spell
entries: At Investigator level 15, you can also cast one of the following spells without a spell slot and regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}: {@spell Antimagic Field|XPHB}, {@spell Glibness|XPHB}, {@spell Maze|XPHB}, or {@spell Mind Blank|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

entries.name: Level 9 Spell
entries: At Investigator level 17, you can also cast one of the following spells without a spell slot and regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}: {@spell Astral Projection|XPHB}, {@spell Gate|XPHB}, or {@spell Weird|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Supernatural Resolve
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects unless you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Spellbinder
entries: Choose 5 Investigator spells in your grimoire of levels 1-3 that have a casting time of an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. You can use {@classFeature Rushed Incantation|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|2} to cast the chosen spells without expending a use of the feature, and you don't need to read from your grimoire to cast them.
Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can replace one of those spells with another spell in your grimoire.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You gain a {@filter Fighting Style feat|feats|category=FS} of your choice. {@feat Defense|XPHB} is recommended.
Whenever you gain a Warden level, you can replace the feat you chose with a different {@filter Fighting Style feat|feats|category=FS}.

classFeature.name: Sentinel's Stand
entries: You gain one of the following benefits of your choice. Whenever you gain a Warden level, you can replace the chosen benefit with another one.

entries.name: Stalwart Spirit
entries: You gain proficiency in one saving throw of your choice.

entries.name: Steadfast Toughness
entries: Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum is increased by your Constitution modifier plus your Warden level. If you later replace this choice, your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum no longer receives this increase.

entries.name: Tower Shield
entries: While you are holding a Shield, you have a +3 bonus to your AC instead of +2. At Warden level 10, this bonus increases to +4.

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the {@variantrule weapon mastery properties|XPHB|mastery properties} of two kinds of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice, such as Halberds and Longswords. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.

When you reach certain Warden levels, you gain the ability to use the {@variantrule weapon mastery properties|XPHB|mastery properties} of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the Warden Features table.

classFeature.name: Guardian Tactics
entries: Your resolute fortitude allows you to hinder your foes and protect your allies using the following tactics.

entries.name: Block
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can choose one ally you can see. Until the start of your next turn, the ally's AC equals your AC if it is lower than that while the ally is within 5 feet of you. This effect ends early if you or the ally have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Challenge
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can goad an enemy that can see or hear you into attacking you. Until the start of your next turn,  the enemy has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against creatures other than you while it is within 5 feet of you. This effect ends early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Grasp
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can block the retreat of foes within a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you until the start of your next turn. A creature within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} can't willingly move further away from you unless it first takes the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action. The {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} ends early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

classFeature.name: Unyielding Resolve
entries: While you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

classFeature.name: Warden Subclass
entries: You gain a Warden subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Warden levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Warden level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Interrupt
entries: When an enemy within 5 feet of you takes an action—such as Multiattack—that allows it to make multiple attacks or use additional abilities as a part of the same action, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to prevent one of its attacks or abilities. You take this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} before any {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} is rolled for the action.
The enemy makes one fewer attack or uses one fewer ability than normal. You learn what attacks and abilities the enemy uses and choose which one to interrupt.

entries.name: Number of Uses
entries: You can use this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} three times. You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you reach certain Warden levels, you gain more uses of this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, as shown in the Interrupt column of the Warden Features table.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Warden Subclass.

classFeature.name: Mettle
entries: Your determination allows you to shrug off effects that would otherwise harm you. When you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Constitution saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and only half damage if you fail. You can't use this feature if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Survive
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and not killed outright, you can drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead, and you regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice your Warden level.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Warden Subclass.

classFeature.name: Sentinel's Strike
entries: You gain one of the following benefits of your choice. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can replace the chosen benefit with another one.

entries.name: Interdict
entries: When you use Interrupt, you can make a melee attack against the enemy as a part of the same {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}. Additionally, you regain a use of Interrupt when you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}.

entries.name: Shield Slam
entries: Once per turn when you attack a creature within 5 feet of you as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action and hit with a Melee weapon, you can immediately bash the target with your Shield if it's equipped. The target takes Bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d8} plus the Shield's AC bonus.

entries.name: Sweep
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn using a Melee weapon, you can make an attack against each creature you choose within 5 feet of you, with a separate attack roll for each target, instead of attacking twice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Font of Life
entries: At the start of your turn, you can end one of the following conditions on yourself (no action required): {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, {@condition Stunned|XPHB}, or {@condition Restrained|XPHB}.
You can use this feature twice. You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Extended Tactics
entries: The range of your Guardian Tactics increases to 10 feet: your Block affects an ally within 10 feet of yourself, your Challenge affects an enemy within 10 feet of yourself, and your Grasp is a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}.

classFeature.name: Improved Resolve
entries: While you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to every damage type except Force, Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Warden Subclass.

classFeature.name: Sentinel's Soul
entries: You gain one of the following benefits of your choice. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can replace the chosen benefit with another one.

entries.name: All-Seeing
entries: You have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet. If you already have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB}, its range increases by 30 feet.

entries.name: Fortified
entries: No attack roll can have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} against you unless you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Unstoppable
entries: You can move through the space of any creature. Moving through its space doesn't cost you extra movement, but you can't stop in the same space. If the creature is your size or smaller, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition when you enter its space.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Legendary Resistance
entries: If you fail a saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead.
You can use this feature three times, and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Armor of Faith
entries: Your divine connection shields you from harm. You gain one of the following benefits of your choice.

entries.name: Anointed Armor
entries: You have training with Medium armor. While you are wearing armor, you can add your Wisdom modifier, instead of your Dexterity modifier, to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}.

entries.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While you aren't wearing any armor, your base {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 10 plus your Dexterity and Wisdom modifiers. You can use a Shield and still gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: The gods demand that you sacrifice {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to cast divine magic.

entries.name: Hit Point Spellcasting
entries: To cast one of your level 1+ Martyr spells, you take Radiant damage to create a spell slot for that spell, which is immediately expended to cast it. The amount of Radiant damage you take is listed in the {@variantrule Damage|XPHB} column on the {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Spellcasting table. This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} and bypasses {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.
When you cast a Martyr spell, you choose the level of spell slot that you create, whose level is no higher than what's shown in the Max Slot Level column of the Martyr Features table for your level.

entries.name: Spell Uses
entries: When you cast one of your level 1+ Martyr spells, you expend one use of your spell uses in addition to taking Radiant damage. You can cast a total number of spells up to the number listed in the Spell Uses column of the Martyr Features table. You regain all spell uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two level 1 Martyr spells. {@spell Command|XPHB} and {@spell Guiding Bolt|XPHB} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Martyr levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Martyr Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional Martyr spells until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the table. The chosen spells must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Max Slot Level column for your level.

If another Martyr feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Martyr spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can replace one spell on your list with another Martyr spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: When a Martyr feature causes you to take Radiant damage, you don't make Constitution saving throws to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} as a result of taking this damage.

entries.name: Healing Magic
entries: Because your power is derived from mortal suffering, you can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} from any spell you cast.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Martyr spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item Holy Symbol|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Martyr spells.

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the {@variantrule weapon mastery properties|XPHB|mastery properties} of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as Javelins and Longswords.
Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change the kinds of weapons you chose.

classFeature.name: Miraculous Healing
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can heal your own wounds. Roll one of your unexpended {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll's total plus your Constitution modifier. This die is then expended.

As you gain Martyr levels, you can expend more dice each time you use this feature, adding your Constitution modifier to each {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die} you roll. The number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} you can expend equals half your Martyr level, round down.

classFeature.name: Reprisal
entries: When you take damage from a creature you can see within 5 feet of yourself, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to halve the damage taken. The creature takes {@damage 1d6} Necrotic or Radiant damage (your choice).

entries.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach Martyr levels 5 ({@dice 2d6}), 11 ({@dice 3d6}), and 17 ({@dice 4d6}).

classFeature.name: Martyr Subclass
entries: You gain a Martyr subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Martyr levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Martyr level or lower.

classFeature.name: Sacrifice
entries: The gods demand that you undergo trials to curry their favor, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Sacrificial Strike
entries: When you deal damage to a creature with a Melee weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to enhance the strike. You take 5 Radiant damage and the target takes an extra 10 Radiant damage. This damage ignores your {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}, and bypasses your {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Sacrificial Skill
entries: Once per turn when you fail a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can take 10 Radiant damage to gain a +5 bonus to that roll, potentially turning it into a success. This damage ignores your {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}, and bypasses your {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. If the test still fails, you don't take this Radiant damage.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Martyr Subclass.

classFeature.name: Sacrifice Foe
entries: When you make an attack or damage roll that is improved by your Sacrifice feature, and the attack reduces an enemy to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you don't take Radiant damage from using the feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Divine Respite
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can choose to regain up to 3 expended {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
The number of expended {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} you regain increases when you reach levels 13 (6 {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}) and 17 (10 {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}).

classFeature.name: Undying
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead and you can immediately use your Miraculous {@variantrule Healing|XPHB} (no action required).
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Improved Sacrificial Strike
entries: Your Sacrificial Strike improves. When you use this feature, you can choose to take 10 Radiant damage, and the target takes an extra 20 Radiant damage.
At Martyr level 17, the first time you use your Sacrificial Strike on each of your turns, you can do so without taking a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Divine Respite
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can choose to regain up to 6 expended {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Martyr Subclass.

classFeature.name: March Unto Destiny
entries: You don't need to eat or drink, and have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Petrified|XPHB}, and {@condition Stunned|XPHB} conditions.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Divine Respite
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can choose to regain up to 10 expended {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Improved Sacrificial Strike
entries: The first time you use your Sacrificial Strike on each of your turns, you can do so without taking a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Martyr Subclass.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Final Martyrdom
entries: You have at last reached your predestination: you will die in eternal glory. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can gain the following benefits for 10 minutes. At the end of the duration, you die. No force, short of a Cleric's Divine Intervention, can prevent your death, and you can't be returned to life by any means.

entries.name: Advantage
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on all {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}.

entries.name: Immunities
entries: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to all damage and to all conditions except for the {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Invisible|XPHB}, {@condition Prone|XPHB}, and {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} conditions.

entries.name: Wish
entries: You can cast {@spell Wish|XPHB} once without a spell slot. You suffer no stress from using effects other than duplicating another spell.

entries.name: Quiet Martyrdom
entries: Not all stories of martyrdom end in dramatic confrontations with implacable foes. Occasionally a Martyr's sacrifice achieves a peaceful conclusion and satisfies the gods without costing their life. Nevertheless, the stories of these Martyrs still come to a close—they don't continue adventuring once their ultimate goal has been fulfilled. Perhaps they might retire to a distant hermitage, wander into the desert, or simply disappear into a crowd, never to be seen again.

classFeature.name: Battle Tactics
entries: You learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called Battle Dice.

entries.name: Battle Dice
entries: You have two Battle Dice, which are d6s. A Battle Die is expended when you use it. You regain all expended Battle Dice when you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} or finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Your Battle Die changes and more Battle Dice become available as shown on the Battle Dice column of the Captain Features table.

entries.name: Maneuvers
entries: You can expend Battle Dice to perform maneuvers. Your maneuver options are detailed later in the class description.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: If a maneuver requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the {@variantrule weapon mastery properties|XPHB|mastery properties} of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as Lances and Longswords.
Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change the kinds of weapons you chose.

classFeature.name: Cohort
entries: You gain a loyal Cohort who carries your banner and follows your lead.

entries.name: Initiating a Cohort
entries: Choose your {@filter Cohort's stat block|bestiary|tag=cohort} from those listed later in the class description. Following an 8-hour initiation period, which can be done during a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, that creature becomes your Cohort until you initiate a new Cohort to replace it. You can have only one Cohort at a time.

entries.name: Cohort in Combat
entries: Your Cohort is {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you and your allies and obeys your commands. In combat, your Cohort takes its turn immediately before or after your turn each round (your choice). Your Cohort uses your Charisma for its attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Cohort Save DC
entries: If your Cohort forces a creature to make a saving throw, the DC is 8 plus your Charisma modifier and your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} bonus.

entries.name: Features
entries: Your Cohort improves and gains new features when you reach certain Captain levels, as shown on the Captain Features table.

entries.name: Proficiencies
entries: Your Cohort has proficiency in skills and saving throws listed in its statistics. Your Cohort uses your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} instead of its own. Because Cohort statistics already include a +2 {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, you need only adjust skill and saving throw proficiencies starting at level 5.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You gain a {@filter Fighting Style feat|feats|category=FS} of your choice.
Whenever you gain a Captain level, you can replace the feat you chose with a different Fighting Style feat.

classFeature.name: Captain Subclass
entries: You gain a Captain subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Captain levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Captain level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Blitz
entries: Once on each of your turns, you can direct your Cohort or an ally within 60 feet of yourself that can see or hear you. The chosen creature can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} or make one attack with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Cohort
entries: Your Cohort improves and gains a new feature.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Captain Subclass.

classFeature.name: Valiant Surge
entries: Whenever you or your Cohort score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} or reduce an enemy to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you regain an expended Battle Die.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Cohort
entries: Your Cohort improves and gains a new feature.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Captain Subclass.

classFeature.name: Coordinated Strike
entries: Once per turn when you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action and hit with a weapon, you can deal an extra {@damage 2d8} damage to the target if your Cohort has dealt damage to that target since the end of your last turn. The extra damage is the same type dealt by the weapon.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Cohort
entries: Your Cohort improves and gains a new feature.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Captain Subclass.

classFeature.name: Lead by Example
entries: Whenever you or your Cohort score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}, each ally you choose within 30 feet of you gains {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Cohort
entries: Your Cohort improves and gains a new feature.

classFeature.name: Teamwork Maneuvers
entries: When you use a maneuver that targets an ally, you can target a second ally within range without expending an additional Battle Die.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Legendary Commander
entries: Immediately after another creature's turn, you can choose yourself or an ally within 60 feet of yourself that can see or hear you to take a Legendary Action. This action is one of the following: {@action Attack|XPHB} (one attack only), {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, {@action Dodge|XPHB}, {@action Hide|XPHB}, {@action Magic|XPHB} (cast one cantrip only), or {@action Utilize|XPHB}. A creature can only take one Legendary Action each round. When a creature takes the Dash or Disengage action in this way, the benefits of that action last until the end of the creature's next turn.
You can use this feature to take three Legendary Actions and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Bombs
entries: You can create volatile alchemical {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bombs} using the statistics shown in the Bomb sidebar.

entries.name: Bomb Mastery
entries: You have proficiency with {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bombs} and you can use the {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger|Bomb's mastery property}.

entries.name: Priming Bombs
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can prime a {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} to increase its potency. Make one attack using a {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} or use the Bomb's {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property; you can't make any other attacks using this {@action Attack|XPHB} action. Add your Intelligence modifier to the damage roll.

When you prime your {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} and deal damage with it, its damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach Alchemist levels 5 ({@dice 2d10}), 11 ({@dice 3d10}), and 17 ({@dice 4d10}).

entries.name: Alchemist Save DC
entries: Some of your Alchemist features require your target to make a saving throw. The save DC equals 8 plus your Intelligence modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. You can use this saving throw for your {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bombs} instead of the DC specified in the {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property.

classFeature.name: Reagents
entries: You have a collection of powerful reagents that you use to brew potions and empower your {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bombs}. You have 2 Reagents. You regain one expended Reagent when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended Reagents when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You gain additional Reagents when you reach certain Alchemist levels, as shown in the Reagents column of the Alchemist Features table.

entries.name: Empowered Bomb
entries: When you deal damage with a {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist}, you can expend a number of Reagents up to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and add {@dice 1d10} to the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} damage roll for each expended Reagent. Additionally, if you use the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property, you can increase the radius of the explosion by 5 feet. You can do so once for each expended Reagent. For example, if you expend 2 Reagents, you can choose for the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} to be a 5, 10 or 15-foot radius.

classFeature.name: Potion Brewing
entries: You can spend 10 minutes and expend any number of Reagents to brew potions, which can be done during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}. You can have a total number of potions at one time up to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). These potions retain potency until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, after which they become inert.

When you brew potions, you can also distill potions you have already brewed, destroying them and recovering the Reagents expended to brew them, up to a maximum of the number of Reagents listed on the Alchemist Features table. You can expend these Reagents immediately to brew new potions.
The number of Reagents and the Alchemist level required to brew a potion are given on the Potions table.

classFeature.name: Bomb Formulae
entries: Your research has uncovered new formulations for your {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bombs} that you can apply just before throwing them. Choose three Bomb Formulae from the "{@filter Bomb Formulae Options|optionalfeatures|feature type=bf}" section later in this class's description.

entries.name: Replacing and Gaining Formulae
entries: When you reach certain Alchemist levels, you learn additional formulae of your choice, as shown in the Bomb Formulae column of the Alchemist Features table. Additionally, whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can replace one of your Bomb Formulae with another formula of your choice.
If another Alchemist feature gives you a Bomb Formula, it doesn't count against your number of formulae.

entries.name: Applying Bomb Formulae
entries: Once per turn when you prime a {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist}, you can apply a Bomb Formula to it, granting it special effects and potentially changing its damage dice.

entries.name: How Many Bombs Do I Have?
entries: As an Alchemist, you can use {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB} to effectively make as many {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bombs} as you need for the adventuring day at no cost. If you prefer to track your inventory of {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bombs} manually, you can create a number of {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bombs} equal to 10 + twice your Alchemist level when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. After 24 hours, an unused {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} becomes inert.

classFeature.name: Reagent Synthesis
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can regain an additional number of expended Reagents up to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Alchemist Subclass
entries: You gain an Alchemist subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Alchemist levels. For the rest of your career, you gain eachof your subclass's features that are of your Alchemist level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Discoveries
entries: In the course of your research, you have made a number of discoveries regarding the nature of alchemy. You gain one discovery of your choice from the "{@filter Discovery Options|optionalfeatures|source=|feature type=do}" section later in this class's description

Whenever you gain an Alchemist level, you can replace one of your discoveries with another one for which you qualify. When you gain certain Alchemist levels, you gain more discoveries of your choice, as shown in the Discoveries column of the Alchemist Features table. You can't pick the same discovery more than once.

classFeature.name: Potion Brewing
entries: Your Potion Brewing feature gains new potions for you to brew.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Alchemist Subclass.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: When you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and only half damage if you fail.
You don't benefit from this feature if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Potion Brewing
