entries: Your Potion Brewing feature gains new potions for you to brew.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Alchemist Subclass.

classFeature.name: Blast Coating
entries: You automatically succeed on saving throws against your own {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bombs} and never take damage from them.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Potion Brewing
entries: Your Potion Brewing feature gains new potions for you to brew.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Alchemist Subclass.

classFeature.name: Potion Mixologist
entries: You can mix two potions together and drink them as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, gaining the effects of both. You suffer no unexpected effects from mixing potions.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Potion Brewing
entries: Your Potion Brewing feature gains new potions for you to brew.

classFeature.name: Experimentalist
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can replace any of your Bomb Formulae with other formulae of your choice, and you can replace one of your discoveries with another one for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Philosopher's Stone
entries: You gain the crowning achievement of alchemy: a Philosopher's Stone, a dynamo of alchemical energy in a fist-sized, glowing jewel.

entries.name: Constructing a New Philosopher's Stone
entries: If your Philosopher's Stone is destroyed, you can construct a new one using {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}, materials worth 1,000+ GP, and 7 days of work. You can only have one Philosopher's Stone at a time.

entries.name: Philosopher's Stone Benefits
entries: As long as you possess the stone, you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Regenerating Reagents
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you regain expended Reagents until you have 6 if you have 5 or fewer.

entries.name: Quick Brewing
entries: You can brew potions as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action, instead of over the course of 10 minutes.

entries.name: Longevity
entries: For every ten years that pass, your body ages only one year.

classFeature.name: Nuclear Bomb
entries: You can utilize the most devastating Bomb Formula imaginable. By replacing your {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} explosive contents with your Philosopher's Stone, you can change it into a Nuclear Bomb. You must use the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} Explosive property. This Bomb deals {@damage 10d10 + 100} Force damage instead of its normal Fire damage, and its explosion is a {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} with a radius of 1 mile. A creature within 60 feet of the center of the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} gains no benefit from Evasion or similar features.
This {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} completely destroys your Philosopher's Stone.

entries.name: Witch
entries: Three old crones stoop over a boiling cauldron filled with all manner of bizarre filth, churning and bubbling with a noxious fume. In the smoke and vapor above the pot, the trio can make out shapes and figures of great import, and one cackles loudly at what she sees.

Witches are stricken by magic so dark it imprints a lasting shadow upon their essence. Through force of personality alone, they can spin this darkness outward, hexing creatures, casting manipulative spells, and even commanding a familiar with their thoughts.

entries.name: Cursed
entries: While others are blessed with magic, Witches are cursed by it. Afflicted by some hateful arcana, whether accidentally or intentionally, Witches are twisted inside and out by its daily tortures. With grueling effort, they can warp this power into spells to wrack others with the same magic that plagues them.

entries.name: Pariahs and Outcasts
entries: Almost without exception, Witches are feared and hated. They are victims of a number of misconceptions relating them to hags and other evil creatures of the night. As a result, known Witches are in great personal danger and can usually be found dwelling on the outskirts of civilization where townsfolk seldom tread. This does little to stop Witch hunting and burnings, but provides some measure of safety from them.

In reality, very few choose to become Witches, and many of them can hide adeptly in society, using their magic to fill a number of roles, from seer, to healer, to apothecary. Being accused as a Witch carries grave consequences, no matter the validity of the claim, so wise Witches relocate frequently, never residing in one place for too long.

entries.name: Warmage
entries: Waving a black-and-red checkered banner, a dragonborn king charges into the fore. At his sides are Warmages of all houses, a chessboard of elite arcanists, poised to turn the tide of battle.
The undisputed masters of cantrips, Warmages turn the most fundamental types of magic into a deadly and precise art.

entries.name: Cantrip Masters
entries: While other spellcasters aspire to grander and more complex spells, Warmages refine and master the most fundamental magic: cantrips. Warmages wield their magic in the same way that a warrior uses a sword, bow, or axe—as weapons to be perfected, not as an unknowable force to be feared. In contrast to sorcerers and wizards, their magic is a trainable skill, one that can be mastered by almost anyone with discipline and aptitude. Therefore, Warmages stand among the most fearsome of spellcasters, with only the most rudimentary of spells.

entries.name: Strategic Geniuses
entries: Warmages have a long and storied history as masterful strategists and tacticians, both in grand battles and personal skirmishes. If a Warmage is outgunned or outmanned, they'll try to outthink their foes, which works more often than not. Warmages demonstrate an efficient kind of pragmatism, owing perhaps to their ability to solve many problems with just a few magical tools.

entries.name: Aligned Free Agents
entries: While some Warmages are fully self-taught, the majority join a house: a loose confederation of Warmages who practice together and share secrets of the trade. Houses teach invaluable battlefield strategy, but each individual house also touts their own brands of tactics and styles of magical tricks. The House of Knights, for example, emphasizes armor and martial prowess, whereas the House of Kings emphasizes battlefield strategy.

By way of metaphor, houses that value honor and teamwork above all else brand themselves after games of strategy, whereas those who epitomize self-reliance name themselves for games of chance. This division in the Warmage houses is representative of a schism that dates back to the earliest Warmage masters. Legend has it that the first two masters separated when one decided to found a college. The other, out of spite, built a casino outside its grounds.

entries.name: Necromancer
entries: Necromancers hold sway over the the forces of life and death, twisting them to serve their ambitions and commanding small armies of lifeless, animated thralls.

entries.name: Dark Souls
entries: Necromancers aren't gifted with the spark of magic. Rather, they turn to the most potent and dire source to fuel their powers: their souls. Each necromantic spell and enthralled Undead shaves away a miniscule part of their soul until only a spiritual husk remains, destined for no afterlife. This is a bargain they strike willingly—sometimes eagerly—in pursuit of an ambitious and terrible future.

entries.name: Grave Ambition
entries: Necromancers must match their grand intellects with an equal lack of scruples—the willingness to turn to forbidden knowledge and unquestionably evil methods. They are almost always driven by a deeper, darker impulse, a goal that pushes them to the utter brink. This might be the distorted ideal of a "greater good" or a goal to fix morality itself; in every case, Necromancy is a grim implement for their life's work.

entries.name: Masters of Undeath
entries: Trial and error teaches a Necromancer to puppet flesh, bone, and the spirits of the dead, binding them to their will. Unlike the Undead commanded by other spellcasters, a Necromancer's thralls are bound by the Necromancer's soul, leading to a small army of perfectly obedient minions that serve their master indefinitely.

entries.name: Investigator
entries: Supernatural detectives and monster slayers, Investigators are always on the hunt for malevolent outsiders. Whenever evil seeps into the world—be it Fiends, Undead, or strange Aberrations from beyond the stars—Investigators will be the first to locate them and banish their foul corruption from the mortal plane.

entries.name: Paranormal Investigators
entries: There are forces more ancient than time, foes more sinister than the foulest men, and beings more titanic than gods. Investigators risk their lives and psyches to protect the world from supernatural threats, unraveling the mysteries of one werewolf or demonic cult at a time. Their investigations are never ending, for victory only delays doomsday another night.

entries.name: Exorcists and Occultists
entries: To give themselves an edge against supernatural threats, Investigators dabble in forbidden magic themselves. Prepared Investigators keep a well-stocked grimoire of rituals, incantations, and notes on the powers and weaknesses of monsters—everything needed to level the playing field. Even so, an Investigator's occupation is perilous. A grimoire might spell out a vampire's fear of sunlight and aversion to silver, but it does little to hinder their fangs.

entries.name: Warden
entries: Armed with a shield and stubborn resolve, Wardens stand in defense of their allies and the innocent wherever they travel.

entries.name: Guardian's Call
entries: Every Warden hears a call to defend the helpless. Sometimes, they are directly called, such as when a village selects their mightiest member to defend them. Other times, they are compelled by more subtle means, such as witnessing uncontested injustice or feeling the weight of responsibility when tragedy occurs. The result is the same: Wardens who pick up their Shields and dedicate themselves to a charge.

entries.name: Strength of Champions
entries: A Warden's source of strength is their bottomless tolerance for punishment. Once they have adopted a group of creatures as their charge, a Warden might also reflect those particular strengths: a Beastblood Guardian learns to hunt and roar with Beasts, and a Verdant Protector commands plants as a treant does.

entries.name: Martyr
entries: Martyrs are implements of the gods, handpicked to die in service of a divine cause. Such an end is inevitable, for once a martyr is chosen, their fate is fixed in the heavens.

entries.name: Fated to Die
entries: Martyrs are chosen by the gods, predestined to die for a great cause. They are prophets and oracles, great priests and liberators. Some Martyrs struggle against their destiny, but from the moment they are chosen, invisible strings of fate pull them onward. The gods may settle for a lesser Martyr if the one chosen is unwilling, but they always prefer to uplift their Martyr to the heights of sainthood before their inevitable demise.

entries.name: Sacrifice
entries: The gods invest their Martyr with deep wellsprings of power, but this power demands sacrifice. Drawing upon divine magic scorches a Martyr with radiance and wracks their body with pain. But the gods will never kill their charge early, and so offer healing in equal measure. Their Martyr shall meet their fate at the preordained time, and not a moment sooner.

entries.name: Captain
entries: Decisive leaders and brilliant strategists, Captains inspire their allies to greatness. They stand alongside their Cohorts—their devoted lieutenants—whom they entrust with their lives. Captains out- strategize their enemies, ensuring that, while they rarely deal the killing blow, they're always on the winning side.

entries.name: Fearless Leaders
entries: A Captain thinks a little bigger than their compatriots, planning one step further and fitting their allies like puzzle pieces to the challenges ahead. To their eyes, there are few defeats; only setbacks, diversions, and detours. Success is always on the path ahead.

Moreover, Captains lead by example. They stand shoulder-to-shoulder with knights, creep through the night alongside rogues, and study arcane texts with mages, even when they barely understand what they're reading.

entries.name: Cohort and Commander
entries: A Captain is only as good as their second in command, their Cohort, who stands by them at every step and safeguards their plan's success. Far more than an ally, a Captain's Cohort is a confidant, an advisor, and a trusted friend. Cohorts see their Captain as a wellspring of information, and will follow them to the ends of the earth.

entries.name: Alchemist
entries: Whether their methods are explosive, transformative, or restorative, Alchemists transmute the world around them to their liking.

entries.name: Explosive Reactions
entries: One of the first things an Alchemist learns is which chemicals react explosively with one other. Ostensibly, this is to prevent deadly accidents, but adventuring Alchemists regularly apply this knowledge to create {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bombs}.

An alchemical bomb is a one-pound, apple-sized, spherical glass or clay flask filled with a reactive chemical. A smaller vial of thin glass containing a reagent is suspended in the liquid, and the whole thing is sealed with a cork or wax seal. When the inner vial breaks, usually on impact, the chemicals react with a violent explosion. With experimentation, an Alchemist can even infuse these explosions with elemental fire, lightning, or frost.

entries.name: Serums and Tinctures
entries: Experienced Alchemists learn to brew potions, alchemical concoctions that replicate magical effects. These range from the medicinal, such as {@item Potions of Healing|XDMG}, to the transformative, such as {@item Potion of Gaseous Form|XDMG|Potions of Gaseous Form}. Undisputed masters of potion-brewing, an adventuring Alchemist should have a surplus of potions to distribute among their allies.

entries.name: Elemental Sciences
entries: The source of alchemy's power is the Elemental Planes. Therefore, it is no surprise that Alchemists strive to tap deeper into that power, researching and discovering new elemental compounds. The pinnacle of alchemy is the Philosopher's Stone, which is rumored to grant its bearer supreme command of the elements. Few Alchemists have succeeded in creating a Philosopher's Stone, and fewer still remain alive to divulge its secrets.

optionalfeature.name: Burned
entries: Your body has been scorched by arcane flames, leaving you with striking scars and embers burning under your skin. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage, and you know the {@spell Produce Flame|XPHB} cantrip, which doesn't count against your number of cantrips known.

optionalfeature.name: Drowned
entries: Water fills your lungs, and yet you live. You can breathe underwater and have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Feral
entries: Through your curse, you have forgotten the manners and customs of civilization. You have proficiency in the {@skill Survival|XPHB} skill. Additionally, while you aren't wearing armor, your base {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 13 plus your Dexterity modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Hideous
entries: Your appearance is ghastly to behold. You have proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation|XPHB} skill. When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself to scare. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of its turn.

optionalfeature.name: Hollow
entries: Your soul has been divorced from your body, trapping you in a limbo between life and death. Whenever you or your familiar reduces an enemy to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Charisma modifier + your Witch level (minimum of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Infested
entries: You are constantly followed by vermin, like insects and rats, which crawl on your skin and swarm in your wake. Beasts have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attacks against you. Additionally, you can command these pests as your own. At Witch level 2, you can choose the form of a Swarm of Insects or a Swarm of Rats for your familiar.

optionalfeature.name: Loveless
entries: You are cursed to never find true love. You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Possessed
entries: Your soul is occupied by a foreign spirit that whispers magical secrets to you and sometimes tries to wrest away your consciousness. You can prepare an extra Witch spell. You can prepare another extra Witch spell when you reach Witch levels 3 (2 spells) and 5 (3 spells).

optionalfeature.name: Starving
entries: No matter how much you eat, food turns to ash in your mouth. Your curse nourishes you at the edge of starvation, and you are constantly wracked by pangs of hunger. Forgoing food and drink doesn't give you levels of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Visions
entries: You are cursed to have grimly accurate visions of the future, presaging the death of your friends, your family, and yourself. You gain a bonus to {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

optionalfeature.name: Whispers
entries: Unseen voices murmur in your ears at all times. You have {@variantrule Telepathy|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Abominable Familiar
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can shape-shift your familiar into an abominable monster. This transformation lasts for 1 hour or until your {@status Concentration|XPHB} ends. Your familiar uses the {@creature Abominable Familiar|ValdaWitch} stat block and retains none of the benefits of the {@classFeature Familiar|Witch|ValdaWitch|2|ValdaWitch|Familiar feature}, except for Spell Channeling and Synchronized Turns. On its turn, the familiar can use Multiattack.
Once you use this Grand Hex, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5+ spell slot (no action required).

optionalfeature.name: Cauldron
entries: You can brew potions in a bubbling cauldron using ingredients scavenged from nature.

entries.name: Alchemy Points
entries: You have a pool of alchemy points equal to your Witch level which you use to brew potions. You regain all expended alchemy points when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Brewing Potions
entries: You can spend 10 minutes and expend any number of Reagents to brew potions, which can be done during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}. Potion options are detailed on the Cauldron Potions table. You can have a total number of potions at one time up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). These potions retain potency until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, after which they become inert.

When you brew potions, you can also distill potions you have already brewed, destroying them and recovering the Reagents expended to brew them, up to a maximum of your Witch level. You can expend these Reagents immediately to brew new potions.

optionalfeature.name: Coven
entries: You can induct others into your insidious coven. Forming a Coven. By performing a special ritual over the course of 8 hours, which can be done during a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can intermingle your cursed magic with a willing creature which then enters into your coven. Your coven can have up to three members, including yourself.

entries.name: Coven Range
entries: A member of your coven only gains access to this feature's benefits if it is within 30 feet of another coven member.

entries.name: Prepared Coven Spells
entries: Coven members temporarily prepare the spells of the Coven Spells table, which don't count against the number of spells they can prepare. These spells must be a level for which a coven member has spell slots. A coven member that lacks the Spellcasting and Pact Magic features only prepares level 1 spells.

entries.name: Shared Spell Slots
entries: Coven members gain access to a shared pool of five spell slots—one of each level, from 1 to 5—which they can use to cast spells as normal. Expended spell slots are regained when all members of the coven finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: A coven member uses its own spellcasting ability for Coven Spells. A coven member that lacks the Spellcasting and Pact Magic features chooses Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma for its spellcasting ability when it enters the coven.

entries.name: Male and Female Witches
entries: Witches are commonly considered to be only female, but in reality, Witches can be any gender. This misconception stems from the fact that masculine Witches are often called "Hexers" or incorrectly deemed Warlocks by common folk.

optionalfeature.name: Dual Hex
entries: When you cast a Hex as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cast a second Hex or cast the original Hex a second time targeting a different creature as a part of the same action. Both Hexes must have a casting time of an action. When you {@classFeature Cackle|Witch|ValdaWitch|2}, you extend the duration of both Hexes by 1 round.
Each target affected by your Hexes counts as being the sole target of your Hex for {@classFeature Insidious Spell|Witch|ValdaWitch|5} and other Witch features.

optionalfeature.name: Forceful Personality
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases to 22.

optionalfeature.name: Hybrid
entries: While your familiar is within 5 feet of yourself, you can meld with it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, shape-shifting into a magical hybrid and gaining the following benefits. You remain shape-shifted for 1 minute or until you dismiss the transformation (no action required). When your transformation ends, your familiar reappears within 5 feet of yourself or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. Once you use this Grand Hex, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5+ spell slot (no action required).

entries.name: Temporary Hit Points
entries: You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your familiar's current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Armor Class
entries: Your AC equals 10 plus your Dexterity and Charisma modifiers.

entries.name: Natural Weapons
entries: You can use your Charisma modifier instead of your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}. When you deal damage with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, it deals {@damage 1d10} Force damage instead of the normal damage for your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

entries.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once when you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

entries.name: Movement
entries: You can use any {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} your familiar possesses.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Apple
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can produce a magical apple out of thin air. You determine the apple's appearance, such as a ruby-red color or a crystalline skin. The apple shrivels and becomes nonmagical if it isn't eaten within 24 hours. Once you produce an apple, you can't produce another one until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Eating the Apple
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to eat the apple, granting the following benefits.

items: {@b Hit Points.} You regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice your Witch level plus your Charisma modifier.
{@b Regain a Spell Slot.} You regain an expended spell slot of level 5 or lower.

{@b End Condition.} You can remove one of the following conditions from yourself: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} (if the apple is fed to you as an action), or {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}.

entries.name: Another Creature Eating the Apple
entries: If a creature other than yourself eats the apple, it doesn't gain any benefits. Instead, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} or suffer the following effects.

items: {@b Poisoned.}The creature has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 24 hours.

{@b Hit Point Loss.} At the end of each hour while the creature has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition, it takes {@damage 4d8} Necrotic damage and its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken. This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}. If this reduction causes the creature to drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the creature instead drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} and has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition, falling into a catatonic sleep for 1 year. A {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell or similar magic can awaken this creature early.

optionalfeature.name: Possession
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, your body becomes immaterial, and your spirit attempts to possess a Large or smaller creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or be possessed for 1 hour. A creature that has a {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} greater than your Witch level automatically succeeds on its saving throw. A creature that succeeds its saving throw against your {@variantrule Possession|XPHB} is immune to your {@variantrule Possession|XPHB} for 24 hours.

When you possess a creature, you control it, but the target retains awareness. Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the creature, though you retain your alignment and your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You retain your own class features and feats. If the target has any class levels, you can't use any of its class features.

When the {@variantrule Possession|XPHB} ends, you are ejected from the body and rematerialize within 5 feet of the target. The {@variantrule Possession|XPHB} ends early if the creature drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or you choose to end it as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action.
Once you use this Grand Hex, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 6+ spell slot (no action required).

optionalfeature.name: Witch's Broom
entries: You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to enchant a mundane object—such as a broom, cauldron, or rug—with the power of flight. While holding this item, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet. This object remains enchanted until you use this Grand Hex to enchant a different object.

optionalfeature.name: Witch's Hut
entries: You can perform a ritual over the course of 8 hours, which can be done during a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, to enchant a structure that fits within a 15-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube}, animating it as a Huge object, as per the {@spell Animate Objects|XPHB} spell. The structure walks using a pair of magical legs.

The entrance to the structure is linked to an extradimensional dwelling, as per the {@spell Demiplane|XPHB} spell. You can command the structure from inside this dwelling. If the structure is destroyed, the extradimensional dwelling is unharmed, but any creatures inside it are expelled into the unoccupied spaces nearest to the entrance.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can teleport the structure to an unoccupied space you can see within 60 feet of you. Once you teleport the structure, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
You can repeat the ritual to end the enchantment on your previous structure and enchant a new one.

optionalfeature.name: Adventurer
entries: You picked up your magic informally by traveling with a dozen different mages over the years. You learn the {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB} and {@spell Ray of Frost|XPHB} cantrips and you gain proficiency in the {@skill Perception|XPHB} skill.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Event
entries: An influx of insidious magic left an imprint on you. You learn the {@spell Message|XPHB} and {@spell Sorcerous Burst|XPHB} cantrips and you gain proficiency in the {@skill Insight|XPHB} skill.

optionalfeature.name: Circus Performer
entries: You learned a few simple tricks to participate in a sideshow or circus act. You learn the {@spell Minor Illusion|XPHB} and {@spell Starry Wisp|XPHB} cantrips and you gain proficiency in the {@skill Acrobatics|XPHB} skill.

optionalfeature.name: Mercenary
entries: You mastered the fundamentals of war magic to engage in battle with similarly armed arcanists. You learn the {@spell Mending|XPHB} and {@spell True Strike|XPHB} cantrips and you gain proficiency in the {@skill Athletics|XPHB} skill.

optionalfeature.name: Temple Initiate
entries: A monastery or temple educated you in the ways of gentle healing magic. You learn the {@spell Sacred Flame|XPHB} and {@spell Spare the Dying|XPHB} cantrips and you gain proficiency in the {@skill Religion|XPHB} skill.

optionalfeature.name: Tower Apprentice
entries: You apprenticed under a spellcaster for some time, who taught you the fundamentals of arcana. You learn the {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB} and {@spell Shocking Grasp|XPHB} cantrips and you gain proficiency in the {@skill Arcana|XPHB} skill.

optionalfeature.name: Self-Taught
entries: You taught yourself all the fundamentals of magic from a dusty old tome or abandoned scroll. You learn the {@spell Fire Bolt|XPHB} and {@spell Light|XPHB} cantrips and you gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Survivalist
entries: To survive in the wild, you taught yourself to cast simple spells. You learn the {@spell Druidcraft|XPHB} and {@spell Shillelagh|XPHB} cantrips and you gain proficiency in the {@skill Survival|XPHB} skill.

optionalfeature.name: Blackjack

prerequisite.other: House of Cards, House of Darts, House of Dice, or House of Roulette

entries: When you cast a cantrip that requires a single spell attack roll and you don't have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the roll, you can choose to roll with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}. The attack automatically misses if the sum of the two rolled dice exceeds 21, and it scores a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} if the sum equals 21.

optionalfeature.name: Blasting Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you deal Force damage to a creature with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can push the creature up to 10 feet away from you in a straight line.

optionalfeature.name: Blinding Cantrip
entries: When you cast the {@spell Light|XPHB} cantrip on an object you are holding, you can direct a flare at a creature you can see within 10 feet of yourself, which must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. A creature that fails its save against this effect is immune to it for 1 minute, after which it can be affected again.

optionalfeature.name: Contingent Cantrip
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can spend 10 minutes performing a ritual to create a Contingent {@variantrule Cantrip|XPHB}. Cast a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)} that has a casting time of an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} and doesn't deal damage. The cantrip doesn't take effect immediately, but instead it takes effect the next time you speak a specified command word (no action required). When you perform this ritual, choose whether the cantrip targets you, the nearest {@variantrule Ally|XPHB}, or the nearest {@variantrule Enemy|XPHB}. You can't use Warmage tricks on the cantrip when it comes into effect. You can only have one Contingent {@variantrule Cantrip|XPHB} at a time. If you perform this ritual again, the previous Contingent {@variantrule Cantrip|XPHB} ends.

optionalfeature.name: Corrosive Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you deal Acid damage to a creature with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can cause the acid to erode the target's defenses. The next time a creature makes an attack roll against the target before the start of your next turn, the target takes a penalty to its AC equal to half your Warmage level (up to a maximum of -5) for that attack.

optionalfeature.name: Draining Cantrip
entries: Whenever you deal Necrotic or Poison damage to an enemy with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can siphon some of its life force. You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your Warmage level, which last for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Encryptogram
entries: Your knowledge of ciphers has improved your magically clandestine communications. When you cast the {@spell Cryptogram|ValdaSpire24} cantrip, its limit is 20 characters, instead of 8, and you can choose to magically encrypt the message such that only the specified recipient can read it.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you deal Fire damage to a creature with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can create an explosion in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the target. Each creature other than the target and yourself within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} makes a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking half the Fire damage rolled on a failed save, or no damage on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Range
entries: When you cast a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)} that has a range of 5 feet or greater, you can double its range. You can also double the length of {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Lines}, the size of {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cones} and {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cubes}, and the radii of {@variantrule Cylinder [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cylinders}, {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanations}, and {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Spheres} created by your Warmage cantrips.

optionalfeature.name: Field Medic
entries: You learn the {@spell Spare the Dying|XPHB} cantrip. You can cast this cantrip as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. Additionally, when you cast it on a creature that has 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the target regains 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} and gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Warmage level, which last for 1 minute.
Once a creature regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} from this trick, it can't do so again until it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Flexible Range
entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your ranged attack rolls with Warmage cantrips. Additionally, when you cast a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)} that requires a melee spell attack, you can increase its range to 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Gamble

prerequisite.other: House of Cards, House of Darts, House of Dice, or House of Roulette

entries: You are always under the effects of the {@spell Cheat|ValdaSpire24} cantrip. Additionally, when you fail a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can reroll the die, and you must use the new roll.
You can use this trick twice. You regain one of its expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Infinite Variation
entries: You have become exceptionally skilled at using the {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB} cantrip to mimic other spells. When you cast {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB}, you can attempt to emulate the effects of another cantrip that doesn't deal damage, even one that is not on the Warmage spell list. To do so, you must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB}) check, otherwise the spell fails. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for a cantrip cast using this trick, and it counts as a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)} for you.

optionalfeature.name: Icy Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you deal Cold damage to a creature with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can numb the target with a frigid blast. The first time the target makes an attack roll before the end of its next turn, subtract half your Warmage level from the attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Leading Edge Tactics

prerequisite.other: Coalition Warmage or House of Lancers

entries: You always have a plan when engaging the enemy. Attacks against you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} during the first round of combat. You can't use this trick if you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll.

optionalfeature.name: Mage Hand Knack
entries: Your skill with the {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB} cantrip allows you to use it as an extension of yourself. You can cast the spell as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} instead of an action. You can also control the hand as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on each of your turns, and can use one of the following abilities when you control the hand.

entries.name: Press
entries: The hand pushes against a Large or smaller creature within 5 feet of it until the start of your next turn. Choose a direction away from that creature. Every foot of movement in that direction while the hand is pressing against it costs the creature 1 extra foot of movement.

entries.name: Punch
entries: The hand strikes one creature or object within 5 feet of it. Make a melee spell attack for the hand. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Force damage.

entries.name: Seize
entries: The hand attempts to grapple a Small or smaller creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC (it chooses which), or it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition. The escape DC equals your spell save DC. The hand continues grappling the target until the spell ends or you take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to control the hand.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Moment
entries: When you cast {@spell Moment to Think|ValdaSpire24}, you can choose to also stop time for a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The creature can take one of the actions permitted by the spell during your turn, and you can interact with one another while time is stopped. During this time you can take the {@action Influence|XPHB} action, exchange items, swap locations with a willing creature within 5 feet of you, take the {@action Help|XPHB} action for tasks while time is stopped, attempt to stabilize an {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} creature that has 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, or have a short conversation without eavesdropping or interruption.

optionalfeature.name: Minor Shadow Illusion
entries: When you create the image of an object in an unoccupied space using the {@spell Minor Illusion|XPHB} cantrip, you can fill it with fibers of shadowstuff, causing it to become partially real. No matter what form the semi-real object takes, it still must be no larger than a 5-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube}. It has AC 10 and 5 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and it weighs 5 pounds. You can only have one semi-real illusion at a time. While this semi-real object exists, the cantrip requires {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

The illusion can't replicate a creature, but it can deal damage to a creature within its 5-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} if the illusion is of an object that can deal damage. A creature that enters the illusion's area or begins its turn there must make an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} damage of a type appropriate to the illusion. This damage can't trigger {@classFeature Warmage Edge|Warmage|ValdaWarmage|1} or any {@filter Warmage tricks|optionalfeatures|source=ValdaWarmage|feature type=wt}. This damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach Warmage level 5 ({@dice 2d6}), 11 ({@dice 3d6}), and 17 ({@dice 4d6}).

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Armor
entries: You can cast {@spell Mage Armor|XPHB} on yourself without expending a spell slot. While under the effects of this spell, you can add your Intelligence modifier, instead of Dexterity, to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Athlete
entries: When you cast the {@spell Quickstep|ValdaSpire24} cantrip, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 20 feet instead of 10. When you cast the {@spell Springheel|ValdaSpire24} cantrip, the distance of your jumps increases by 20 feet instead of 10 feet. If you know both of these cantrips, you can cast both of them as part of the same {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Retort
entries: You learn the {@spell Vicious Mockery|XPHB} cantrip. Additionally, when a creature you can see makes an attack roll against you, you take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cast {@spell Vicious Mockery|XPHB} targeting the attacker. If the creature fails its saving throw, the attacker has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the triggering attack roll, instead of its next attack roll, potentially causing the attack to miss.
Once you cast this cantrip as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Vision
entries: You can cast the {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} spell without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Opening Move

prerequisite.other: House of Bishops, House of Go, House of Kings, House of Knights, House of Pawns, or House of Rooks

entries: During the first round of combat, the first spell attack you make has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}. You can't use this trick if you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll.

optionalfeature.name: Phantom Hookshot
entries: You can cast the {@spell Phantom Grapnel|ValdaSpire24} cantrip as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. If you do so, its range is reduced to 15 feet. When you cast the spell as an action, the target is pulled an additional 10 feet toward you by the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Prismatic Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you deal Force damage with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can roll a {@dice d6} on the following table to change the cantrip's damage type for this casting. You can apply tricks to the casting as normal using the new damage type. Additionally, you can apply the trick corresponding to the rolled damage type, even if you don't know the trick.
You can use this trick a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Radiant Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you cast a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)} that deals Acid, Cold, Fire, Force, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder damage, you can change the damage type to Radiant.

When you deal Radiant damage with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can reroll one of the cantrip's damage dice, and you must use the new roll. The number of damage dice you can reroll increases by 1 when you reach Warmage levels 11 (2 dice) and 17 (3 dice).

optionalfeature.name: Rapid Fortification
entries: You can cast the {@spell Mending|XPHB} cantrip as an action or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. If you cast it as an action, you can use one of the following effects.

entries.name: Repair
entries: You can restore a single nonmagical object, such as a door, Cart, or window, to pristine condition if at least half of its parts are present. This object can be no larger than 10 cubic feet, or 1 cubic foot if it is exceptionally complex (such as a clock).

entries.name: Fortify
entries: You can build simple fortifications, such as sealing a door shut, adding wooden planks to a window, or building a short stone wall (no larger than 10 cubic feet). You must have the materials present to use this ability.

optionalfeature.name: Severe Cantrip
entries: When a creature rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20} for a saving throw against one of your Warmage cantrips, it suffers a Critical Failure. It fails the save regardless of its modifiers or the spell save DC. If the spell deals damage, you roll all of the spell's damage dice twice and add them together, then add any relevant modifiers. This additional damage applies only to the creature that rolled a 1.

optionalfeature.name: Silent Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns immediately after you deal Thunder damage to an enemy with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can create a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of magical silence originating from the target, which lasts until the start of your next turn. Any creature or object entirely inside the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Thunder damage, and creatures have the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a Verbal component is impossible there.

optionalfeature.name: Static Cantrip
entries: Whenever you deal Lightning damage to an enemy with a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)}, you can sap part of the energy into a charge, which clings to your body until the start of your next turn. While charged, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} in response to taking damage from a creature you can see within 5 feet of you to deal Lightning damage equal to half your Warmage level to the creature.

optionalfeature.name: Force Aegis
entries: When you cast the {@spell Force Buckler|ValdaSpire24} cantrip, you can {@condition Concentration|XPHB|Concentrate} on it for up to 1 minute. The spell doesn't end early if you are hit by an attack.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Weaponmaster
entries: When you cast {@spell Force Weapon|ValdaSpire24} or {@spell Magic Daggers|ValdaSpire24}, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make one additional spell attack with that cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Split Fire
entries: When you cast a {@filter Warmage cantrip|spells|level=0|class=warmage (wmc:vss)} that requires a single spell attack roll, you can select multiple creatures and make a spell attack roll against each one. You can target a number of creatures equal to the number of damage dice the cantrip deals, and split your damage dice up amongst your targets, to a minimum of 1 die of damage per target. Each attack must target a different creature. For example, Fire Bolt deals {@damage 3d10} damage at level 5. You can choose to target three creatures and deal {@damage 1d10} damage to each creature, or you can target two creatures, dealing {@damage 1d10} damage to one creature and {@damage 2d10} damage to the other creature, or you can target one creature and deal {@damage 3d10} damage.

optionalfeature.name: Bishop's Maneuver
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend spell slot to teleport to an unoccupied space you can see. The number of feet you can teleport equals 15 feet times the level of the spell slot expended.

optionalfeature.name: Capture
entries: You gain the following formation:

entries.name: Capture
entries: You can use this formation when you and three or more {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} that don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition are adjacent to an enemy and surround it. You can determine this by placing an imaginary cube around the enemy. If you and your {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} are adjacent to each side of the cube, the creature is surrounded.

When you activate this formation, the enemy must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or be enveloped by chains of magical force and have the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. The {@condition Stunned|XPHB} target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on itself and this formation on a success.
Once you use this trick, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Castle
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can choose a willing Small or Medium creature you can see within 120 feet of you. You both teleport, swapping places.
Once you use this trick, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Chips are Down
entries: When you expend one or more Chips of Fate to bet and lose at least one bet, you regain one expended Chip of Fate.

optionalfeature.name: Commander's Steed
entries: You can cast the spell {@spell Find Steed|XPHB} without expending a spell slot and regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. When you cast the spell using this trick, its spell slot level is your Wamage level divided by four, rounded up.

optionalfeature.name: Dartmaster
entries: When you cast a cantrip that allows you to make multiple ranged spell attacks, such as {@spell Magic Daggers|ValdaSpire24} or {@spell Force Dart|ValdaSpire24} using the {@optfeature Split Fire|ValdaWarmage} trick, and you miss with one or more attacks, you can reroll all of your misses.
Once you use this trick, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Directed Momentum
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you reduce a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} with a melee attack using a weapon or score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with one, you can make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against a second target. On a hit, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} Force damage.

optionalfeature.name: Fold
entries: You have learned to graciously accept defeat using your Deck of Fate. As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you are hit by an attack, you can play your entire hand to cast {@spell Shield|XPHB} without expending a spell slot.
Once you use this trick, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Force Breastplate
entries: While you have all of your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage.

optionalfeature.name: Snake Eyes
entries: If you roll a 1 or 2 on a Die of Fate, you keep the die instead of giving it to the GM.

optionalfeature.name: Spellstrike
entries: Whenever you cast {@spell Arc Blade|ValdaSpire24}, {@spell Burning Blade|ValdaSpire24}, {@spell Frigid Blade|ValdaSpire24}, or {@spell True Strike|XPHB}, you can make two attacks as a part of the spell instead of one. You can only apply the cantrip's bonus damage to one of the attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Blitz
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can expend one Battle Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to maneuver one of your {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies}. Add the Battle Die to the attack's damage roll. Choose an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} within 60 feet of yourself that can see or hear you. That {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

optionalfeature.name: Check
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can expend one Battle Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to threaten the target. Add the Battle Dice to the attack's damage roll. The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Flash of Brilliance
entries: When you fail an Intelligence or Wisdom check, you can expend one Battle Die to add it to the roll, potentially turning it into a success. You can only use this maneuver once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Gambit
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can expend one Battle Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to give your {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} an opening. Add the Battle Die to the attack's damage roll. The next creature other than yourself to make an attack roll against the target adds the Battle Die to the attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Morale Boost
entries: When an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} you can see within 60 feet of yourself fails a saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend one Battle Die and add it to the roll, potentially turning it into a success.

optionalfeature.name: Stalemate
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can expend one Battle Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to hold that creature in place. Add the Battle Die to the attack's damage roll. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Bolster
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one Battle Die to motivate an ally within 60 feet of yourself. The next time your ally makes an attack before the start of your next turn, it adds the Battle Die to the attack and damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Born Leader
entries: When you fail a Wisdom or Charisma check, you can expend one Battle Die to add it to the roll, potentially turning it into a success. You can only use this maneuver once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Morale Boost
entries: When an ally you can see within 60 feet of yourself fails a saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend one Battle Die and add it to the roll, potentially turning it into a success.

optionalfeature.name: Rally
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn, you can expend one Battle Die to choose one ally within 60 feet of yourself that can see or hear you. That creature regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the number rolled plus your Charisma modifier. You can't use this maneuver to heal a creature that has 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Staggering Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack using a Melee weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can expend one Battle Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to daze the target. Add the Battle Die to the attack's damage roll. The target subtracts the Battle Die from the next attack roll it makes before the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Acid Bomb
entries: By mixing your Bomb's explosive contents with a few drops of ardenflotic acid, a highly corrosive chemical, you can change it into an Acid Bomb. This Bomb deals Acid damage instead of Fire damage and all of its damage dice are d8s. A target hit by this Bomb or that fails its saving throw against it has a -3 penalty to its AC until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Bramble Bomb
entries: By adding a soil and a potent fertilizer to your Bomb's explosive contents, you can change it into a Bramble Bomb. This Bomb deals no damage. When you use the Bomb's Explode property, each creature within the explosion makes a Strength saving throw, instead of Dexterity. The area of the explosion is filled with thorny brambles and is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. A target on the ground hit by this Bomb or that fails its saving throw against it is entangled in the brambles and its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 and can't increase. An entangled creature can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your Bomb save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the brambles and its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is no longer 0. The brambles shrivel and die after 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Concussion Bomb
entries: By mixing your Bomb's explosive contents with a few drops of air elemental essence, you can change it into a Concussion Bomb. This Bomb deals Thunder damage instead of Fire damage When you use the Bomb's Explode property, each creature within the explosion makes a Constitution saving throw, instead of Dexterity. A Huge or smaller target hit by this Bomb is pushed 10 feet away from you. A Huge or smaller creature that fails its saving throw against this Bomb is pushed 10 feet away from the center of the explosion.

optionalfeature.name: Cryo Bomb
entries: By replacing your Bomb's explosive contents with a sliver of ice-nine, you can change it into a Cryo Bomb. This Bomb deals Cold damage instead of Fire damage and all of its damage dice are d8s. When you use the Bomb's Explode property, each creature within the explosion makes a Constitution saving throw, instead of Dexterity. A target hit by this Bomb or that fails its saving throw against it has a -3 penalty to its attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Fear Bomb
entries: By mixing your Bomb's explosive contents with concentrated adrenaline, you can change it into a Fear Bomb. This Bomb deals Psychic damage instead of Fire damage and all of its damage dice are d6s. When you use the Bomb's Explode property, each creature within the explosion makes a Wisdom saving throw, instead of Dexterity. A target hit by this Bomb or that fails its saving throw against it has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Holy Bomb
entries: By adding a few drops of holy water to your Bomb's explosive contents, you can change it into a Holy Bomb. This Bomb deals Radiant damage instead of Fire damage and all of its damage dice are d10s. If a creature that takes damage from the Bomb is a Fiend or Undead, the Bomb's damage dice against this creature become d12s.

optionalfeature.name: Impact Bomb
entries: By replacing your Bomb's explosive contents with a more reactive one, you can change it into an Impact Bomb. This Bomb deals Force damage instead of Fire damage and all of its damage dice are d8s. When you use the Bomb's Explode property, each creature within the explosion makes a Strength saving throw, instead of Dexterity. A Huge or smaller target hit by this Bomb or that fails its saving throw against it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Incendiary Bomb
entries: By adding a thickening agent to your Bomb's explosive contents, you can change it into an Incendiary Bomb. All of this Bomb's damage dice are d8s. When you use the Bomb's Explode property, the area of the explosion is filled with flames until the start of your next turn. Whenever a creature enters the area or ends its turn there, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take Fire damage equal to the Bomb's damage dice.

optionalfeature.name: Laughing Gas Bomb
entries: By mixing your Bomb's explosive contents with a drop of jesterate, a highly euphoric chemical, you can change it into a Laughing Gas Bomb. This Bomb deals Poison damage instead of Fire damage and all of its damage dice are d8s. When you use the Bomb's Explode property, each creature within the explosion makes a Constitution saving throw, instead of Dexterity. A target hit by this Bomb or that fails its saving throw against it laughs uncontrollably and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition and can't cast spells with a Verbal component until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Bomb
entries: By replacing your Bomb's explosive contents with a charged arcane capacitor, you can change it into a Lightning Bomb. This Bomb deals Lightning damage instead of Fire damage. A target hit by this Bomb or that fails its saving throw against it can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} until the start of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Oil Bomb
entries: By mixing your Bomb's explosive contents with a few drops of a super-surfactant, you can change it into an Oil Bomb. This Bomb deals no damage, but instead causes the target or each creature within the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of the Bomb's Explode property to become coated with a flammable oil. This oil lasts for 1 minute or until it or another creature takes the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to remove the oil. The next time a creature coated in oil takes Fire damage, you can treat a roll of 1-3 on any damage die as a 4. This destroys the oil on the creature.

optionalfeature.name: Paint Bomb
entries: You can replace your Bomb's contents with vibrant, magical pigment, changing it into a Paint Bomb. This Bomb deals no damage but instead splatters paint within the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of the Bomb's Explode property. A target hit by this Bomb or that fails its saving throw against it is coated in paint until the start of your next turn. A coated creature can't benefit from the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition and attacks against it have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Prismatic Bomb
entries: By adding an ounce of polyjuice, an unpredictable, multicolored chemical, to your Bomb's explosive contents, you can change it into a Prismatic Bomb. This Bomb deals a randomly-determined damage type instead of Fire damage, and the Bomb's Explode property requires a randomly-determined type of saving throw. Roll on each of the following tables.

optionalfeature.name: Quiet Bomb
entries: By replacing your Bomb's explosive contents with a pouch of rubber pellets, you can change it into a Quiet Bomb. This Bomb deals Bludgeoning damage instead of Fire damage. When this Bomb detonates, it makes only a low thud, audible out to 10 feet, and releases a puff of smoke to mask the light of the blast. Additionally, when you reduce a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} with this Bomb, you can instead knock it out.

The creature is instead reduced to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}. The creature remains {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} until it regains any {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or until someone uses an action to administer first aid to it, which requires a successful DC 10 Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|XPHB}) check.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Bomb
entries: By replacing your Bomb's explosive contents with a powerful lodestone, you can change it into a Seeking Bomb. Your ranged attack with this Bomb and its explosion ignores Half and {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Three-Quarters Cover}.

optionalfeature.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: By removing your bomb's explosive contents entirely, you can change it into a Smoke Bomb. This Bomb deals no damage, but creates a {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of smoke that is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB}. The radius of this {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} is twice that of the Bomb's Explode property. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until a strong wind (such as one created by Gust of Wind) disperses it.

optionalfeature.name: Teleportation Bomb
entries: By replacing your Bomb's explosive contents with a glowing etherite crystal, you can change it into a Teleportation Bomb. This Bomb deals no damage. Instead, you teleport to the Bomb's point of impact. This teleportation fails if the Bomb explodes more than 30 feet away from you.

optionalfeature.name: Withering Bomb
entries: By mixing your Bomb's explosive contents with a powerful desiccating agent, you can change it into a Withering Bomb. This Bomb deals Necrotic damage instead of Fire damage and all of its damage dice are d8s. When you use the Bomb's Explode property, each creature within the explosion makes a Constitution saving throw, instead of Dexterity. A target hit by this Bomb or that fails its saving throw against it has a -3 penalty on saving throws it makes before the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Alchemy of Alteration
entries: Your research has revealed how to warp the body and mind. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Batch Brewing
entries: The number of potions you can have at one time increases by 2.

entries.name: Potion Ingredients
entries: You gain 4 additional Reagents which you can only use to brew potions.

entries.name: Expanded Potions
entries: You can brew the following potions at the Alchemist levels given.

optionalfeature.name: Alchemy of Poison
entries: Your research has taught you how to concoct poisonous compounds. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Batch Brewing
entries: The number of potions you can have at one time increases by 2.

entries.name: Poisoner's Kit
entries: You gain proficiency in the

entries.name: Potent Poison
entries: When you make a damage roll that deals Poison damage, it ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage.

entries.name: Poison Crafting
entries: You can brew the following poisons, which use your Alchemist save DC, when you brew potions. These poisons are included in the 5th Edition rules.

optionalfeature.name: Alchemy of Restoration
entries: Your research has unveiled a plethora of medicines and remedies. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Batch Brewing
entries: The number of potions you can have at one time increases by 2.

entries.name: Double Dose
entries: Whenever you brew a {@item Potion of Healing|XDMG}, it has twice the normal potency. Each potion has two uses. Drinking the potion expends one use. The potion gains another use when you reach level 9 (3 uses) and level 13 (4 uses).

entries.name: Expanded Potions
entries: You can brew the following potions.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Studies
entries: Dabbling in arcana has granted you limited magic. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this discovery's spells.

entries.name: Level 1 and 2 Spells
entries: Choose a level 1 spell and a level 2 spell from the Wizard spell list. You always have these spells prepared. You can cast each once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of a spell by taking the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action and expending a number of Reagents equal to the level of the spell. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: Whenever you gain a new level, you can replace one of the spells you chose for this discovery with a different spell of the same level from the Wizard spell list.

optionalfeature.name: Combat Studies
entries: Your research extends into the strategy and tactics of warfare. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Martial Training
entries: You gain proficiency with Martial weapons and training with Medium armor and Shields.

entries.name: Breacher
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make an attack with a weapon that isn't a Bomb and doesn't have {@itemProperty H|XPHB|Heavy}.

entries.name: Fire Brand
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack using a Melee weapon, you can expend 1 Reagent to deal an extra {@damage 1d10} Fire damage to the target.

optionalfeature.name: Fundamental Alchemy
entries: Your research has revealed the finer points of brewing basic alchemical substances. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Quadruple Flasks
entries: When you brew potions, you can brew a batch of four vials of Acid, Alchemist's Fire, Holy Water, or Oil for 1 Reagent die. Each batch counts as one potion for the number of potions you can have at once. These batches can be all of one substance or a mix of them.
These substances use your Alchemist save DC and retain potency until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, after which they become inert.

entries.name: Quick Flask
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action to prime a bomb, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to throw a flask of Alchemist's Fire, Holy Water, Oil, or Acid, or to use an Oil flask to douse a space.

entries.name: Potent Flasks
entries: Acid, Alchemist's Fire, and Holy Water that you brew deal an additional die of damage. Alchemist's Fire also deals this extra dice of damage to burning creatures. {@hazard Burning|XPHB} Oil adds your Intelligence modifier to the extra Fire damage it deals.

optionalfeature.name: Guided Explosives
entries: You've learned how to magnify the explosive potential of your Bombs. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Improved Bombs
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls you make using your Bombs.

entries.name: Aerodynamic Bombs
entries: The normal and long ranges of your Bombs double.

entries.name: Seeking Charge
entries: When you miss with an attack roll using a Bomb, you can expend a Regent to roll {@dice 1d8} and add the number rolled to the attack roll, potentially causing the attack to hit.

optionalfeature.name: Homunculus
entries: Your research has taught you how to create an alchemical familiar: a {@creature Homunculus|XMM}.

entries.name: Creating a Homunculus
entries: By expending 3 Reagents and spending materials worth 10+ GP in a 1-hour long alchemical process, which can be done over a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can create a homunculus. You can only have one homunculus at a time; if you create another one, your existing one dies.

entries.name: Hit Points
entries: Your homunculus has {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to five times your Alchemist level.

entries.name: Bomb Immunity
entries: Your homunculus automatically succeeds on its saving throws against your Bombs and never takes damage from them.

entries.name: Combat
entries: The homunculus is an ally to you and your allies. It takes its turn immediately before or after your turn each round (your choice). Your homunculus can't attack on its turn, but it can take other actions and Bonus Actions as normal. Additionally, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to allow your homunculus to make one attack with its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}. Your homunculus's attack bonus equals your Intelligence modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

entries.name: Elemental Infusion
entries: As a Magic action, you can expend 2 Reagents to infuse your homunculus with elemental essence for the next hour. Choose Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage. While infused, your homunculus has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to this damage and deals {@damage 2d8} extra damage of that type on its damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Necrobiology
entries: Your explorations into necromancy have borne scientific fruit. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Hemoreagent
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to extract a measure of your own blood and convert it into Reagents. Expend any number of Hit Dice. You regain a number of expended Reagents equal to half the number of Hit Dice expended (round down).

entries.name: Lazarus Bolt
entries: As a Magic action, you can drive a bolt into the torso of a creature within 5 feet of you that has died within the last minute and shock it back to life. That creature revives with 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}. This discovery can't return to life a creature that lacks a heart, a creature that has died of old age, or a creature that is missing vital organs. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending 5 Reagents (no action required).

optionalfeature.name: Precision Explosives
entries: Your Bombs are extremely precise. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Improved Bombs
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to your Alchemist save DC. This bonus increases to +2 when you reach Alchemist level 11.

entries.name: Sculpt Explosion
entries: When you use the Bomb's Explode property, you can choose a number of creatures within the explosion up to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). Each chosen creature automatically succeeds on its saving throws against the Bomb and takes no damage from it.

optionalfeature.name: Unconventional Explosives
entries: You've discovered new ways to utilize your Bombs. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Explosive Missile
entries: When you prime a Bomb, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to load the Bomb onto a crossbow and launch it. The Bomb uses the crossbow's range, but you can't use its Explode property for this attack. You can apply a formula to this Bomb as normal.

entries.name: Fire Eater
entries: When you prime a Bomb, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to drink the Bomb's contents and spit them out in a 15-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. This {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} acts as the area of the Bomb's explosion, which you can expand by expending Reagent dice as normal. You can apply a formula to this Bomb as normal.

optionalfeature.name: Unconventional Potions
entries: Your research has chiefly revealed how to deliver potions quickly. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Potion Toss
entries: You can take a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to hurl a potion at an ally within 30 feet of you. The target gains the potion's benefits as if it had consumed the potion normally.

entries.name: Reactionary Gulp
entries: Immediately after you take damage from a creature you can see, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to drink a potion. You can use this ability to drink a potion that restores your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, even if the triggering damage reduces you to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Gingerbread Magic
entries: {@i Live in a Candyland}

Witches that learn the fine details of Gingerbread Magic become masters in all things confectionery. Some Witches, particularly those with a sweet tooth, use their magic to delight others. Evil gingerbread Witches, by contrast, have a penchant for cruelty, and use their delectable powers to tempt others into traps or transform valuables into sweet treats.

subclassFeature.name: Gingerbread Spells
entries: When you reach a Witch level specified in the Gingerbread Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Gingerbread Spells
rows: {@spell Arcane Lock|XPHB}, {@spell Enhance Ability|XPHB}, {@spell Hex: Sweet Tooth|ValdaWitch}, {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter}, {@spell Sleep|XPHB}
{@spell Create Food and Water|XPHB}, {@spell Leomund's Tiny Hut|XPHB|Tiny Hut}

subclassFeature.name: Sweet Tooth
entries: You gain the {@spell Hex: Sweet Tooth|ValdaWitch} cantrip. This cantrip is exclusive to this subclass.

subclassFeature.name: Gingerbread Familiar
entries: When you summon your familiar, you can conjure a version of it made from gingerbread. It gains the following benefits:

items.name: Blindsight
entries: Your familiar has {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 10 feet.

items.name: Distracting Aroma
entries: An enemy within 5 feet of the familiar that can see and smell it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against creatures other than it.

items.name: Fragile
entries: Your familiar only adds your Witch level, instead of twice your Witch level, to its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum.

subclassFeature.name: Sugar Rush
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can give an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} you touch a burst of quickly-fading energy. The {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} can take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action or {@action Disengage|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Sugar-Coat
entries: When a creature that you can see hits you with an attack roll using a weapon, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to transform its weapon into a harmless duplicate made of candy. You choose the type of candy it is made out of, whether it be marshmallow, cotton candy, or gingerbread. You take no damage from the attack. The weapon remains transformed and unable to deal damage until the end of the attacker's turn. The attacker can make attacks using other weapons or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} as normal.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 3+ spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Candy Land
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can transform an area into a field of confectionary delights. Choose a point you can see within 120 feet. For 1 minute, a 30-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of magic centered on that point transforms every nonmagical object entirely within the area that isn't being worn or carried into an edible candy replica. Structures become gingerbread houses, trees are made of chocolate, and so on. The GM decides the type of candy into which objects are transformed. Candy objects have no damage threshold and {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to all damage. A candy object reverts to its original material at the end of the duration or if it leaves the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}, unless it is eaten.

The {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} lasts for 1 minute, until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, or if you dismiss it (no action required). Additionally, everything inside the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} appears to be joyous and colorful. Whenever you or an {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} starts its turn inside the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}, it regains 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. A creature doesn't gain this benefit if it has 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Green Magic
entries: {@i Wield Nature and an Empowered Familiar}
