subclassFeature.name: Containment Specialist
entries: {@i Contain and Conceal Anomalous Magic Artifacts}

Though the study of magic is diverse and wonderous, it contains mysteries better left unexplored. Such topics in magic are seldom studied, for their very existence poses an existential threat to the multiverse itself: chronomancy, protomancy, and quantumancy are among the few graced with names at all. When a sinister (or merely curious) arcanist pulls on one of these threads of knowledge, they open a Pandora's box of unpredictable effects. The results are usually catastrophic. Such dangerous arcana leaves lasting scars on people and objects, metaphysical reverberations of the terrible secrets at their source.

As their title implies, Containment Specialists are tasked with tracking, isolating, and containing exotic magic and its artifacts. Their job is hazardous and challenging, but is of critical importance to the multiverse at large. Containment Specialists often coordinate in clandestine groups to triangulate new threats and ensure isolated ones remain indefinitely contained. With some luck, these organizations can remain obscure footnotes for generations, further sheltering their secrets from curious eyes.

subclassFeature.name: Cover Story
entries: When you fail a Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB}) check or a creature catches you in a lie, you can reattempt the check to reassure the listener with another quick lie. On a success, the listener believes you. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Antibell
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Silence|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Black Bag
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can activate your Black Bag, an item linked to numerous extradimensional spaces, for 1 minute. While the bag is active, you can take a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to place an item in the bag or retrieve one from the bag. Any item placed within the bag is stored in its own extradimensional space, which is suffused by an {@spell Antimagic Field|XPHB}. The bag's mouth is 2 feet in diameter. It can hold up to 12 items, each weighing no more than 50 pounds, and weighs as much as the heaviest object stored within it. When you retrieve an item from the bag, you always grab the item you intended.

entries.name: Cinnabar Compass
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Locate Object|XPHB} without using a spell slot or components.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Disruption
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Exploit Weakness|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|5} and the target has the Magic Resistance trait, that trait doesn't function until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Nothing to See Here
entries: With a blinding flash, you can overwrite the memories of those around you. You can cast {@spell Modify Memory|XPHB} as an action targeting up to 3 creatures within range without a spell slot or components. You must modify the memories of each creature affected by the spell in the same way.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Containment Dimension
entries: You can leverage a powerful quarantine procedure to keep others safe from dangerous artifacts. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can create a pocket dimension that is an exact duplicate of your surroundings at the moment you use this feature—complete with duplicates of all the structures and nonmagical items therein—and transport creatures you choose within its area to the dimension. You decide the exact area of the duplicate dimension, as long as its total space fits within a 150-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube}.

While in the pocket dimension, you can only affect and be affected by other creatures in that dimension. You can't see creatures and objects outside the pocket dimension. Objects taken from the pocket dimension vanish upon leaving it.

If a creature leaves the bounds of the pocket dimension it appears in the corresponding space on the plane it left. If it appears in an occupied space, it is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and takes {@damage 4d6} Force damage.

The pocket dimension lasts for 10 minutes, and ends early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, the pocket dimension contains no creatures, or you dismiss it (no action required). When the pocket dimension ends, all creatures and objects are returned to the plane they left in their corresponding locations.
Once you use this feature to create a pocket dimension, you can't do so until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Detective
entries: {@i Chase Down Clues and Crack the Mystery}

Prowling at the edge of darkness, Detectives chase down clues and pull on threads to unravel conspiracies that bring darkness into the world. Sometimes, this requires that you infiltrate a cult's secret meetings, other times it calls on you to reconstruct a person's last moments at a murder scene. No matter what the mystery, however, you know that there is always an explanation.

subclassFeature.name: Uncanny Hunch
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence check or a Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check, you can gain a bonus to the check equal to your Investigator level.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Fogstone Periapt
entries: You can cast {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Glass Medallion
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Invisibility|XPHB} on yourself without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Skeleton's Key
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Knock|XPHB} without a spell slot or components. When you cast the spell using this trinket, its casting is silent.

subclassFeature.name: Predictive Intuition
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can examine the movements of a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. Until the start of your next turn, you can add {@dice 1d6} to attack rolls you make against the target, and the target subtracts {@dice 1d6} from all its attack rolls against you. Once you use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on a target, you can't use it on that target again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Interrogator's Instinct
entries: Your sleuthing experience grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Enchantment Detection
entries: You discern if a creature is cursed, possessed, or has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} or {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.

entries.name: Illusion Detection
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any ability check you make to discern an illusion.

entries.name: Lie Detection
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any ability check you make to determine if you hear a deliberate lie.

subclassFeature.name: Power of Deduction
entries: You can use your {@subclassFeature Predictive Intuition|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|Detective|ValdaInvestigator|6} on a target an unlimited number of times.

subclassFeature.name: Exterminator
entries: {@i Slay Vampires, Werewolves, and Other Terrible Creatures}

An Exterminator suffers no monster to live. Trained in the art of slaying Aberrations, Fiends, and Undead, you stand against evil where others falter, and draw your blade before others recognize a threat. Grand schemes and plots are less important than retribution against monsters which stalk the night, and your thirst for such retribution is unquenchable. There is always another werewolf to be slain, another vampire to be staked, another demon to be banished; people rarely thank you, but you find satisfaction enough in your work.

subclassFeature.name: Silvered Shield
entries: Your monster hunting experience grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Armor Training
entries: You have training with Medium armor and Shields.

entries.name: Intelligent Defense
entries: While wearing Medium armor, you can add your Intelligence, instead of Dexterity, to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Consecrated Whetstone
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Magic Weapon|XPHB} once without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Gilded Dragon Scale
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose Acid, Cold, Fire, Force, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder damage. You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the chosen damage type for 1 minute.

entries.name: Mimic-Tooth Necklace
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack using a weapon, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to deal an extra {@damage 2d8} Acid damage to the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Monster Slayer
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can make one attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Silvered Edge
entries: Your monster-killing expertise grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Flexible Mastery
entries: When you attack with a weapon whose mastery property you can use, you can replace that property with the {@itemMastery Sap|XPHB} or {@itemMastery Vex|XPHB} property for that attack.

entries.name: Supernatural Strikes
entries: Whenever you deal damage with a weapon, it can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Killer Instinct
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Exploit Weakness|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|5} twice on your turn, but can't use it against the same target more than once.

subclassFeature.name: Infernum
entries: {@i Bargain with Fiends for Infernal Powers}

The Infernum are Investigators in league with Fiends, either willingly to pursue nefarious ends or unwillingly as the result of an infernal bargain. Each is given a set of enigmatic goals and a fiendish overseer (often an Imp), then left entirely to their own devices. Many search and scrounge for a solution to their fiendish bargain or opt for malicious compliance, delivering upon their infernal directives while undermining their broader schemes. Others, however, revel in their dark alliance, gleefully hoping to climb the fiendish ranks.

subclassFeature.name: Fiendish Familiar
entries: Your infernal masters have assigned a lesser fiend to supervise and assist you. You add {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} to your grimoire for free. You can use {@classFeature Rushed Incantation|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|2} to cast the spell without expending a use of the feature, and you don't need to read from your grimoire to cast it. The spell is improved in the following ways when you cast it.

entries.name: Fiendish Options
entries: You can choose only the following options for your familiar: {@creature Imp|XMM}, {@creature Quasit|XMM}, or {@creature Pseudodragon|XMM}. A pseudodragon summoned with this spell knows Common and is a Fiend.

entries.name: Spiteful Distraction
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can command the familiar to disrupt an enemy within 5 feet of it. The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll it makes before the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Demon's Eye
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain the ability to see normally in {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} and {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}—both magical and nonmagical—within 120 feet of yourself for 1 minute.

entries.name: Diabolical Barb
entries: You can cast {@spell Hellish Rebuke|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Hexagram Pendant
entries: You can cast {@spell Hex|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

subclassFeature.name: Infernal Bargain
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can strike one of the following bargains with your infernal masters. You can also discuss new bargains with your GM. The bargain lasts until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Blindsight and Blindness
entries: You have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet. Beyond this range, you have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Damage and Actions
entries: Once on each of your turns, you can choose to take Necrotic damage equal to twice your Investigator level to take an additional action. This action can only be used to take only the {@action Attack|XPHB} (one attack only), {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, {@action Hide|XPHB}, or {@action Utilize|XPHB} action.

entries.name: Resistance and Vulnerability
entries: Choose two of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, Psychic, and Thunder. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the chosen damage types. The GM chooses another type from the list; you have {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to that damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Binding Contract
entries: You add Geas to your grimoire for free. When you cast the spell using this feature, you can modify its casting to draft a binding contract. Instead of giving a verbal command, you write a legal contract that can contain up to 10 commands and conditions. You can include clauses that end the spell early or extend its duration to a maximum of 90 days. Instead of targeting a creature that you can see within range, the spell targets any creature that signs the contract within the duration.

A creature that willingly signs the contract as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action automatically fails its saving throw against the spell, whether or not the creature understands the nature of the contract.

subclassFeature.name: Fiendish Transformation
entries: You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to shape-shift your {@subclassFeature Fiendish Familiar|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|Infernum|ValdaInvestigator|3} into one of the following forms: {@creature Barbed Devil|XMM}, {@creature Incubus|XMM}, {@creature Succubus|XMM}, or {@creature Vrock|XMM}. It remains transformed for 1 minute or until you end it (no action required). While transformed, your familiar can attack.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Inquisitor
entries: {@i Drive Out Fiends and Root out Heresy}

The church has long been the first line of defense against the tide of impending darkness. Yet, the clergy's stubborn devotion to righteousness impedes them where it counts: you must sometimes be willing to do evil to counter evil. That's where the inquisition comes in.

As a righteous Inquisitor, you are tasked with rooting out heresy, exorcising demons, and stamping out any sign of the occult, and you are offered clemency for any action you take in the defense of the greater good. You may investigate anyone or anything you deem to be in line with the forces of evil, for you alone are a holy blade in the dark, the arbiter of your church.

subclassFeature.name: Exorcist's Doctrines
entries: Your training as an inquisitor grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Consecrated Armor
entries: You add {@spell Consecrated Armor|ValdaSpire24} to your grimoire for free. When you cast it, your base AC becomes 13 plus your Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Dogma
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill Religion|XPHB}) check, you can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Alabaster Balm
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Hallowed Chalice
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can enchant a container, such as a cup, that you touch to produce a flask of {@item Holy Water|XPHB}. You can produce one such flask when you use this trinket. For the next hour, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to produce another flask of {@item Holy Water|XPHB}, until you have created a total of five flasks. Once created, these flasks and {@item Holy Water|XPHB} vanish after 1 hour.

entries.name: Reliquary of Doubt
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB} without a spell slot or components. When you cast the spell using this trinket, you can only detect thoughts associated with negative emotions, such as guilt, apprehension, regret, or melancholy.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Strike
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an attack roll using a weapon, you can cause the target to take an extra {@damage 1d8} Necrotic or Radiant damage (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Rote Piety
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Holy Trinkets|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|7} three times without expending a use of your {@classFeature Trinkets|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|3}. You regain these uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Excommunication
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can emblazon a mark of condemnation upon a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be marked for 1 minute. While marked, the target takes {@damage 6d6} Radiant damage at the start of each of its turns, can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and can't have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}. A marked target can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Once you mark a creature using this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a use of your {@classFeature Rushed Incantation|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|2} (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Kid Sleuth
entries: {@i Solve Mysteries with Your Talking Animal Sidekick}

Though Kid Sleuths are not all literally youths, they are all amateur detectives with a knack for solving tricky crimes. Assisted by their ubiquitous animal sidekicks, Kid Sleuths will happily dive into the details of a grim crime scene to emerge with a handful of clues and a lead on the bad guy. These sleuths generally prefer to run away from trouble, rather than engage head-on, since mysteries only get harder to solve with more dead bodies, but they are more than capable of defending themselves if backed into a corner.

subclassFeature.name: Animal Sidekick
entries: You gain a Kid Sleuth's constant companion: a talking animal sidekick. You add {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} to your grimoire for free. You can use {@classFeature Rushed Incantation|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|2} to cast the spell without expending a use of the feature, and you don't need to read from your grimoire to cast it. The spell is improved in the following ways when you cast it.

entries.name: Expanded Options
entries: You can choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: {@creature Goat|XMM}, {@creature Mastiff|XMM}, or {@creature Weasel|XMM}.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: The animal gains an Intelligence of 10 and the ability to speak one language you know.

entries.name: Skillful
entries: Your familiar gains proficiency in any combination of two skills or tools of your choice. You can change this selection when you summon your familiar.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Bag of Traps
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can magically produce and take the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to use one of the following items: {@item Ball Bearings|XPHB}, {@item Caltrops|XPHB}, {@item Chain|XPHB}, {@item Hunting Trap|XPHB}, {@item Manacles|XPHB}, or {@item Oil|XPHB} (which you can only use to douse a space). If the item requires a saving throw, it uses your Investigator spell save DC. For the next minute, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to produce and use another such item, until you have created a total of five items. Once created, these items vanish after 1 hour.

entries.name: Dooby Snack
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you produce a tasty treat that lasts for 1 hour. A creature can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to eat this treat to gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). Until the start of its next turn, the creature has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} it makes.

entries.name: Magnifying Glass
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Clue|ValdaSpire24} without a spell slot or components. Additionally, when you cast this spell using this trinket, you can determine each type of creature that leaves footprints or fingerprints.

subclassFeature.name: Split Up, Gang
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Exploit Weakness|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|5}, you can immediately move up to half your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}. Alternatively, you can choose one ally you can see within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you. The ally can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

subclassFeature.name: Cunning Companion
entries: When your familiar takes the {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, or {@action Hide|XPHB} action, you gain the benefits of that action on your next turn. You must be {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB} or behind Three-Quarters {@variantrule Cover|XPHB} or Total cover, and you must be out of any enemy's line of sight to gain the benefits of the {@action Hide|XPHB} action.

subclassFeature.name: Meddling Kids
entries: Whenever an enemy within 30 feet of yourself makes an attack roll against one of your allies, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on that roll.

subclassFeature.name: Archivist
entries: {@i Expand Your Rituals Through Ancient Lore}

Though most Investigators fill their grimoires with hard- won knowledge borne from encounters with supernatural threats, some prefer to do bookkeeping instead. Such Archivists seek to accumulate knowledge, more so than trinkets, by spending untold hours digging through disparate tomes of occult secrets and compiling them into encyclopedic texts. Through their research, Archivists become academic masters of the arcane and priceless reservoirs of obscure knowledge.

subclassFeature.name: Thesis
entries: You gain access to certain spells associated with your thesis. Choose one of the following subject areas for your thesis: {@filter Corpus|spells|subclass=investigator: archivist (ic:vss), corpus}, {@filter Mentis|spells|subclass=investigator: archivist (ic:vss), mentis}, {@filter Mortis|spells|subclass=investigator: archivist (ic:vss), mortis}, or {@filter Oculus|spells|subclass=investigator: archivist (ic:vss), oculus}. Consult the table below that corresponds to the chosen thesis; you add the listed spells for your Investigator level to your grimoire for free. The listed spells count as Investigator spells for you and you treat them if they have the {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB} tag.

Whenever you gain an Investigator level, you can replace your thesis with another one. The spells in your grimoire corresponding to your thesis are magically replaced with those of the new thesis for your Investigator level.

subclassFeature.name: Trinkets
entries: You can use the following trinkets.

entries.name: Aura Lenses
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Mnemonic Script
entries: You can cast {@spell Memorize|ValdaSpire24} without a spell slot or components.

entries.name: Tongue Stone
entries: You can cast {@spell Comprehend Languages|XPHB} without a spell slot or components.

subclassFeature.name: Erudite Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw, you can give one target of the spell {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saves against the spell.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a use of your {@classFeature Rushed Incantation|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|2} (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Encyclopedic Expertise
entries: You can identify any arcane effect from memory. Whenever you see or hear a spell being cast or investigate a magical effect, you can identify the spell that was cast, the magic item responsible, or the creature that produced the effect without an ability check. This feature fails to {@spell identify|XPHB} spells, magic items, and creatures that are utterly unique or are otherwise not recorded in arcane texts.

subclassFeature.name: Eidetic Memory
entries: You can effortlessly duplicate spells you see or hear, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Ritual Recall
entries: If you see or hear an Investigator spell being cast, you can thereafter copy it into your grimoire.

entries.name: Spell Duplication
entries: When you see or hear a spell of level 5 or lower being cast, you can fix the spell in your mind. Within the next minute, you can expend a use of your {@classFeature Rushed Incantation|Investigator|ValdaInvestigator|2} to cast the spell without a spell slot. Once you use this benefit to cast a spell, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Beastblood Guardian
entries: {@i Command the Fury of Beasts}

You have formed a bond with Beasts and have taken up the task of defending them. Your time among them has taught you their ferocity, tenacity, and animal instincts, allowing you to become a primal predator of the wilds.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Warrior
entries: Your connection with Beasts of the wilds grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Animal Instincts
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Animal Handling|XPHB}, {@skill Nature|XPHB}, or {@skill Survival|XPHB} skill. Additionally, you gain a bonus to checks using the chosen skill equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

entries.name: Bloodied Fury
entries: At the start of your turn while you're {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you can gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls you make until the end of your turn. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} or finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Roar
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you release a bellowing roar in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. Each Large or smaller creature you choose within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} is pushed 5 feet away from you and it can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} until the start of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Hunting Grounds
entries: You can move through the wilds as a Beast does, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Ignore Difficult Terrain
entries: {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} doesn't cost you extra movement.

entries.name: Climb and Swim Speed
entries: You have a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} and a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Pounce
entries: Once per turn when you hit a Large or smaller creature with an attack roll using a Melee weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} Slashing damage and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Aspect of the Beast
entries: You can assume the bloodthirsty visage of the Primal Beast. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can gain the benefits below for 1 minute or until you choose to end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Bloodied Frenzy
entries: While you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls.

entries.name: Bleeding Wounds
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack using a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can deal the target a bleeding wound. A creature with a bleeding wound can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and takes {@damage 1d10} Necrotic damage for each of its wounds at the start of each of its turns. This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}. A creature can take an action to staunch all of its bleeding wounds. A creature can have a maximum of six bleeding wounds at once.

entries.name: Furious Speed
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} doubles.

subclassFeature.name: Carrion King
entries: {@i Command an Army of Vermin}

A champion of vermin, you are called to defend the lowliest creatures of all: insects, rats, spiders, and other pests. These creatures mean no harm; they're merely trying to survive in a world too large for them, and so they flock to your side. Unmistakably, your coming is signaled by the scrambling of little claws and the cawing of the crows. Legions of pests wait at your command to swarm, bite, and infest anyone who might thin their numbers.

subclassFeature.name: Infest
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can command your vermin to swarm a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The creature takes {@damage 1d6} Piercing damage and subtracts {@dice 1d6} from the next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} it makes before the start of your next turn.

entries.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases when you reach Warden levels 5 ({@dice 1d8}), 11 ({@dice 1d10}), and 17 ({@dice 1d12}).

subclassFeature.name: Versatile Vermin
entries: Once on each of your turns, you can command your vermin to manipulate an object within 30 feet of you (no action required). For example, the vermin can open an unlocked door or container, store or retrieve an item from an open container, carry a Tiny item up to 15 feet, or pour out the contents of a vial. The vermin can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

subclassFeature.name: Swarm Cloud
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you surround yourself with countless flying pests in an {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. You choose whether the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} extends 5 feet, 10 feet, or 15 feet. This area is {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB} and has one of the following effects of your choice, which lasts for 10 minutes or until you end it (no action required).

entries.name: Deafening
entries: Creatures you choose entirely within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} have the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Difficult Terrain
entries: The area of the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} for creatures other than yourself.

entries.name: Heavily Obscured
entries: The area of the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB} for creatures other than yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Plague Vector
entries: Whenever you use your Interrupt, the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of the current turn.

subclassFeature.name: Lord of the Flies
entries: You can call a colossal swarm of vermin to your aid.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can gain the benefits below for 1 minute or until you choose to end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Blinding Bites
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your attacks with commanding your vermin to blind a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or take {@damage 2d10} Piercing damage and have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, a {@condition Blinded|XPHB} target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Infesting Swarm
entries: When you use your Infest while your Swarm Cloud is active, you can target any creatures of your choice within your Swarm Cloud's {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}.

subclassFeature.name: Diabolist
entries: {@i Strike Contracts and Command the Powers of Hell}

Your call was a bellow from below, foul with brimstone and the cries of the damned. Diabolists are well-spoken advocates for demons, devils, and other Fiends, mediating their pacts and trading souls for their service. Often, Diabolists are called upon to defend portals to the underworld, safeguarding the innocent from wandering down below and trapping condemned souls within.

subclassFeature.name: Devil's Advocate
entries: Your fiendish allegiance grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Fiendish Empathy
entries: Whenever a Fiend attacks you, it makes a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save, its attack misses.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage.

entries.name: Silver-Tongued
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception|XPHB}, {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} skill. Additionally, you gain a bonus to checks using the chosen skill equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Infernal Command
entries: You can cast {@spell Command|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} without a spell slot. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.
You can use this feature twice. You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Soul Broker
entries: When you or an ally within 10 feet of you reduces an enemy to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can trade its soul to your fiendish patron for one of the following magical boons. The GM decides if a creature's soul can't be traded to a Fiend. The boon lasts for 10 minutes or until you use this feature to trade another soul.

entries.name: Energy Resistance
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Lightning, Necrotic, Poison, Psychic, Radiant, or Thunder.

entries.name: Fortitude
entries: You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Warden level.

entries.name: Truesight
entries: You have {@sense Truesight|XPHB} with a range of 10 feet.

entries.name: Skill
entries: You gain proficiency and {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in one skill of your choice.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 15 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Hellbent Survival
entries: When you use your Survive, you can immediately move up to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} and make two attacks with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Archdevil's Blessing
entries: Your infernal allies can grant you a boon. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can gain the benefits below for 1 minute or until you choose to end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Devil's Charm
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma checks and saving throws.

entries.name: Hellfire Aura
entries: At the end of each of your turns, each creature you choose in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you takes {@damage 2d6} Fire damage.

entries.name: Infernal Interruption
entries: Whenever you use your Interrupt, you can cast {@spell Hellish Rebuke|XPHB} without a spell slot as a part of the same {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, as if the creature damaged you with the interrupted attack. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

subclassFeature.name: Godsworn
entries: {@i Wield Divine Power to Protect the Weak}

The whispers of gods, the ringing of bells, and the meter of hymns called you, compelling you to swear an oath of protection. With your blade, you defend temples, holy sites, and other sacred ground, and with your shield, you protect pilgrims as they make their grand journeys. Your purpose is grander than just one life, and you look forward to seeing what designs the gods have set on your travels.

subclassFeature.name: Anointed Block
entries: When you use the Block option of your Guardian Tactics, the chosen ally adds {@dice 1d4} to attack rolls and saving throws it makes while within 5 feet of you until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Mandate
entries: Your oath of protection grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Cleric spell list. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Doctrine
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Religion|XPHB} skill. Additionally, you gain a bonus to checks using this skill equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

entries.name: Radiant Resistance
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Radiant damage.

subclassFeature.name: Benediction
entries: You can cast any of the following spells once without a spell slot: {@spell Daylight|XPHB}, {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB}, {@spell Sanctuary|XPHB}, and {@spell Zone of Truth|XPHB}. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this feature. Once you cast a spell using this feature, you regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Selfless Survival
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and not killed outright, you can expend the use of your Survive to prevent its demise.
The creature drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead and regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice your Warden level.

subclassFeature.name: Sainted Mantle
entries: You can wreathe yourself in divine protection. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can gain the benefits below for 1 minute or until you choose to end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Radiant Regeneration
entries: At the start of each of your turns, you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your Warden level plus your Constitution modifier.

entries.name: Spirit Guardians
entries: As a part of the {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you take to use this feature, you cast {@spell Spirit Guardians|XPHB} without a spell slot. When you cast it in this way, its duration is 1 minute and doesn't require {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Nightgaunt
entries: {@i Side With the Forces of Undeath}

Blood-drinkers, Undead, and other creatures of the night are often feared and hunted, and few stand in their defense; except, of course, the grim and terrible Nightgaunts. Tales of Nightgaunts cast them as hunters of clerics and goodly vampire slayers. Their appearances always presage long nights and great rises in hungry Undead.

You felt the calling of the moon bringing you to the graveside of living corpses. Though vampires, zombies, and skeletons are mighty, they are always outnumbered, hunted, and turned by Clerics—never given a chance to repose in peace. They require an ally among the living to continue their ceaseless lives, and you have risen by moonlight to the task.

subclassFeature.name: Death's Gambit
entries: When you deal damage to an enemy targeted by the Challenge option of your Guardian Tactics, it may die instantly. If the enemy has fewer {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} than twice your Warden level after taking damage, it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Grave Keeper
entries: Your affinity for the Undead grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You gain {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} when you gain this feature, its range increases by 60 feet.

entries.name: Necrotic Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Undead Empathy
entries: Whenever an Undead creature attacks you, it makes a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save, its attack misses.

subclassFeature.name: Innate Necromancy
entries: You can cast any of the following spells once without a spell slot: {@spell Darkness|XPHB}, {@spell False Life|XPHB}, {@spell Gentle Repose|XPHB}, and {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB}. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this feature (choose the ability when you cast the spell). Once you cast a spell using this feature, you regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Undying
entries: You can use your Survive three times and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Gravelord
entries: You can invite necromantic energies into your body. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can gain the benefits below for 1 minute or until you choose to end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Frightful Aura
entries: You emit an aura of terror in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from yourself. Whenever an enemy starts its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. {@action Attack|XPHB} rolls against the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} creature have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

entries.name: Vampiric Strike
entries: As a part of the {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you take to use this feature, you cast cast {@spell Vampiric Touch|XPHB} as a without a spell slot as a level 5 spell. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your attacks with making the spell's melee spell attack.

subclassFeature.name: Rimekeeper
entries: {@i Channel the Polar Winds}

Your call was the howling, icy winds of a remote arctic land. As a Rimekeeper, you defend the people of these frigid lands from colossal creatures that thrive in the frost and invaders that hail from warmer places. Wherever you travel, the north wind follows, summoned at your fingertips with hailstones and ice.

subclassFeature.name: North Wind
entries: When you use Block or Challenge on a Large or smaller creature, you can create a howling wind to either pull the target 10 feet in a straight line toward you or push the target up to 10 feet straight away from you.

subclassFeature.name: Polar Acclimation
entries: Your adaptation to arctic climates grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Cold Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold damage.

entries.name: Frozen Weapons
entries: When you deal damage with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, it can deal your choice of Cold damage or its normal damage type.

entries.name: Frigid Weapons
entries: When you attack with a Melee weapon whose mastery property you can use, you can replace that property with the Slow property for that attack.

subclassFeature.name: Ice Blast
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can unleash a burst of ice from your hands. You can use this ice to create one of the following magical effects of your choice within 5 feet of you. If an effect calls for a saving throw or ability check, the DC equals 8 plus your Constitution modifier and your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

entries.name: Black Ice
entries: You can create a slick area of ice covering the ground in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} centered on yourself. When the ice appears, each creature other than yourself standing in its area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. A creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there must also succeed on that save or fall {@condition Prone|XPHB}. This ice melts after 1 minute or if you create this effect again.

entries.name: Freeze Shut
entries: You freeze over a closed door, window, gate, container, or hatch, causing it to become stuck. A Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check can force the object open again. This ice melts after 10 minutes.

entries.name: Frostbite
entries: You bombard a creature you can see with frost. The target makes a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d12} Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. This damage increases by {@dice 1d12} at Warden levels 11 ({@dice 3d12}) and 17 ({@dice 4d12}).

entries.name: Snowbank
entries: You deposit enough snow and ice in a 10-foot-wide bank to provide {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} for two Medium creatures. This bank melts after 10 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Snowclad
entries: You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Constitution modifier at the start of each of your turns if you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Hoarfrost Herald
entries: You can embrace the bitter chill of hoarfrost. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can gain the benefits below for 1 minute or until you choose to end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Cold Immunity
entries: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Cold damage.

entries.name: Frostbite Strike
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your attacks with a use of the Frostbite option of your Ice Blast.

entries.name: Iceclad
entries: You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice your Constitution modifier at the start of each of your turns if you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Stoneheart Defender
entries: {@i Become an Unmovable Obstacle}

Your call was the steadfast rumble of mountains, a pull which dwarves and gnomes have felt for generations. As a Stoneheart Defender, you protect the stones from those who would despoil them, from within and without. You might protect old dwarven walls, patrol high mountain lookouts, or stand in defense of remote villages. You are unmovable wherever you plant your feet: a mountain in mortal form.

subclassFeature.name: Stonewall
entries: When you use the Block option of your Guardian Tactics while you are holding a Shield, you and the chosen ally are further protected from harm. Until the start of your next turn, any Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage dealt to you or the ally is reduced by an amount equal to the AC bonus of your Shield.

subclassFeature.name: Earthshatter
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your attacks with a downward slam that knocks others off their feet. Each Large or smaller creature you choose on the ground within 5 feet of yourself must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 plus your Strength modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.
At Warden level 14, this area increases to 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Roots of Rock
entries: Your attunement to the mountains grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Immovable
entries: You can't be pushed, pulled, or teleported against your will.

entries.name: Prone Immunity
entries: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition unless you choose to have it or have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Interruption
entries: When an enemy you can see takes a Legendary Action to make an attack, you can use Interrupt to prevent that attack.

subclassFeature.name: Stoneforged Champion
entries: You can encase yourself in rock to become a living mountain. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can gain the benefits below for 1 minute or until you choose to end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Earthshatter Stomp
entries: Once on each of your turns, you can use your Earthshatter without replacing one of your attacks.

entries.name: Giant Strength
entries: Your Strength increases by 4, to a maximum of 25.

entries.name: Immortal Resolve
entries: While you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Sentinel
entries: {@i Become Imbued with a Roaring Storm}

Your call sounded like furious storm clouds and the flash of lightning. As a Storm Sentinel, you protect wayward sailors and coastal villages from the wrath of the tempests and the arrival of pirates and other raiders. From your fingertips, you deliver the awe of lightning and the roar of thunder, and with practice, you can fly among the squalls and rain thunderbolts from above.

subclassFeature.name: Thunderblast
entries: When you use the Grasp option of your Guardian Tactics, each creature you choose within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} takes {@damage 1d8} Lightning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Seafarer
entries: Your time on oceanbound voyages and attunement with the storm grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Flash from Above
entries: Whenever you are outdoors, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to conjure a harmless, but impressive, bolt of lightning or peal of thunder.

entries.name: Storm Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to your choice of Lightning or Thunder damage.

entries.name: Swim Speed
entries: You have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Wings
entries: At the start of each of your turns, you can gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} until the end of the current turn (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Lightning Step
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can teleport inside a bolt of lightning to an unoccupied space you can see within 60 feet. Immediately before you teleport, each creature within 5 feet of the space you appear in makes a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}), taking {@damage 4d8} Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a use of your Interrupt (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Stormlord
entries: You can imbue yourself with the storm's fury. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can gain the benefits below for 1 minute or until you choose to end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Call Lightning
entries: As a part of the {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you take to use this feature, you cast {@spell Call Lightning|XPHB} without a spell slot. When you cast the spell in this way, its duration is 1 minute. On subsequent turns, you can replace one of your attacks with calling down lightning again.

entries.name: Fly Speed
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet.

entries.name: Improved Thunderblast
entries: The damage of your Thunderblast increases to {@dice 3d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Verdant Protector
entries: {@i Protect Nature with Interlopers}

You heard the call of the wind through the trees and the loam beneath your feet. As a Verdant Protector, you are the champion of the green things in nature, defending them against those who would despoil the wilds. Plants sprout at your command to assist you, entangling and ensnaring foes for you to dispatch.

subclassFeature.name: Grasping Vines
entries: Plants entangle your foes that try to escape. The {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of the Grasp option of your Guardian Tactics increases to 10 feet for creatures on the ground. At Warden level 14, it increases to 15 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Cultivator
entries: Your connection with all manner of plants grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Natural Connection
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Nature|XPHB}, {@skill Stealth|XPHB}, or {@skill Survival|XPHB} skill. Additionally, you gain a bonus to checks using the chosen skill equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

entries.name: Surefooted
entries: {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} doesn't cost you extra movement and you are immune to the effects of the {@spell Spike Growth|XPHB} and {@spell Plant Growth|XPHB} spells.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Emissary
entries: You can cast any of the following spells once without a spell slot: {@spell Goodberry|XPHB}, {@spell Plant Growth|XPHB}, {@spell Spike Growth|XPHB}, and {@spell Speak with Plants|XPHB}. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this feature (choose the ability when you cast the spell). Once you cast a spell using this feature, you regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Verdant Resilience
entries: When you use your Survive, you and allies within 10 feet of yourself gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice your Warden level.

subclassFeature.name: Oak Sentinel
entries: You can grow the gnarled oak of a treant. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can gain the benefits below for 1 minute or until you choose to end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Armor of Thorns
entries: You gain a +4 bonus to AC. Whenever you take damage from an enemy within 5 feet of you, the enemy takes {@damage 4d6} Piercing damage and the AC bonus decreases by 1, to a minimum of +0.

entries.name: Entangling Transformation
entries: When you use this feature, plants and vines sprout from the ground in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. Each creature you choose in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or have the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. A {@condition Restrained|XPHB} creature can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against this benefit's save DC, ending the condition on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Witchbane Hunter
entries: {@i Hunt Mages and Supernatural Foes}

Where there is magic, there is evil. Witches, warlocks, and hags lurk in the shadows, plying their myriad curses upon the innocent. But your ever-vigilant sword is ready for them, ready to defend the nonmagical folk from evil spellcasters the world-over. You slay vampires, hexers, devils, and fey with impunity, for anyone who might despoil the world with magic shall be hunted and put to the stake.

subclassFeature.name: Witchbane Arsenal
entries: Your experience in hunting supernatural foes has culminated in a collection of witch-hunting items, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Blessed Flask
entries: You have an enchanted container that produces a flask of Holy Water as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action. Once created, this Holy Water vanishes after 10 minutes. This container can produce Holy Water three times and regains all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Cerulean Medallion
entries: You have a magical medallion that glows faintly when supernatural threats are near. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you learn the location and creature type of Celestials, Fey, Fiends, and Undead within 30 feet of yourself. This medallion can be used three times and regains all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Grimoire Monstrum
entries: You have a tome of myths and monsters. While holding it, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence checks you make related to monsters, spells, or secret or ancient lore.

entries.name: Silvered Whetstone
entries: You have a magical whetstone that adds a thin layer of silver to a weapon as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action. For 10 minutes, when you deal damage with that weapon, it can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type. This whetstone can be used three times and regains all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Spiteful Challenge
entries: When you use the Challenge option of your Guardian Tactics, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against effects created by the target while you are within 30 feet of it.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Eye
entries: Your well-trained eye can detect the slightest hint of magic, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Detect Latent Magic
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can sense if a spell was cast within 30 feet of yourself within the last 24 hours and what spell was cast.

entries.name: See Invisibility
entries: You see creatures and objects that have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition. You can also see into the Ethereal Plane. Creatures and objects there appear ghostly.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Rebuke
entries: You can cast {@spell Counterspell|XPHB} without a spell slot. If the target fails its saving throw against this spell, it takes {@damage 4d8} Force damage. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell when you cast it with this feature (choose the ability when you cast the spell).

Once you use this feature to cast this spell, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a use of your Interrupt (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Anti-Mage
entries: You can imbue yourself with an antimagic aura. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can gain the benefits below for 1 minute or until you choose to end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Antimagic Field
entries: As a part of the {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you take to use this feature, you cast {@spell Antimagic Field|XPHB} without a spell slot. When you cast it in this way, its duration is 1 minute and the 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originates from you. Additionally, you choose which creatures and objects are affected by the {@spell Antimagic Field|XPHB}.

entries.name: Branding Challenge
entries: When you hit an enemy targeted by the Challenge option of your Guardian Tactics with a weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d8} Fire damage.

subclassFeature.name: Drake-Blooded
entries: {@i Channel Draconic Magic with Your Blood}

Your call was the booming roar of dragons. As such, you have struck a pact with an ancient wyrm to protect its hoard from enemies that might despoil it. In turn, the surged through your veins like fire and granted you a measure of draconic power. Fire alights at your fingertips and your eyes bear reptilian slits. As a Drake-Blooded wyrm granted you a few drops of its blood to drink, which Warden, you are a champion among half-dragons and a titan among kobolds.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned to cast spells. The information below details how you use those rules as a Drake-Blooded Warden.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the Sorcerer spell list (see that class's section for its list). {@spell Sorcerous Burst|XPHB} and {@spell True Strike|XPHB} are recommended. Whenever you gain a Warden level, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip of your choice from the Sorcerer spell list.
When you reach Warden level 10, you learn another Sorcerer cantrip of your choice.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Drake-Blooded Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose three level 1 spells from the Sorcerer spell list. {@spell Burning Hands|XPHB}, {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB}, and {@spell Shield|XPHB} are recommended.
The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Warden levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Drake-Blooded Spellcasting table.

Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Sorcerer spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 7 Warden, your list of prepared spells can include five Sorcerer spells of levels 1 and 2 in any combination.

entries.name: Changing your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you gain a Warden level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Sorcerer spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Sorcerer spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an Arcane Focus as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Sorcerer spells.

subclassFeature.name: Mortal Metamagic
entries: You use the following Metamagic options to temporarily modify spells you cast. To use an option, you must expend the number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} that it costs. You can use only one Metamagic option on a spell when you cast it unless otherwise noted in one of those options.

entries.name: Empowered Spell (Costs 1 Hit Point Die)
entries: When you roll damage for a spell, you can spend 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die to reroll a number of the damage dice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one), and you must use the new rolls.
You can use Empowered Spell even if you've already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

entries.name: Quickened Spell (Costs 2 Hit Point Dice)
entries: When you cast a spell that has a casting time of an action, you can expend 2 {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} to change the casting time to a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} for this casting. You can't modify a spell in this way if you've already cast a level 1+ spell on the current turn, nor can you cast a level 1+ spell on this turn after modifying a spell in this way.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Strike
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can replace one of the attacks with a casting of one of your Sorcerer cantrips that has a casting time of an action.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Vengeance
entries: When you take damage from a creature that is within 10 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and expend a {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die to unleash draconic energy in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. Each creature you choose in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} makes a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes damage equal to two rolls of your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die plus your Constitution modifier, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage is your choice of Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison.

subclassFeature.name: Aspect of the Greatwyrm
entries: You can wreathe yourself in a dragon's elemental might. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can gain the benefits below for 1 minute or until you choose to end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 6d6} damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage is your choice of Acid, Cold, FIre, Lightning, or Poison.

entries.name: Elemental Fury
entries: When you deal damage with a Melee weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage. The damage is your choice of Acid, Cold, FIre, Lightning, or Poison.

entries.name: Fly Speed
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Anonymity
entries: {@i Kill in the Shadows, Die in the Shadows}

Like other Martyrs, you were chosen to accomplish great things and die for a noble cause. However, you were not destined for glory; no one will ever know your name. Martyrs chosen for the Burden of Anonymity work in the shadows to influence the world for the greater good, and will inevitably die in the shadows, unknown to all. Your divinely-appointed task might be secret, such as assassination or infiltration, and your role as a Martyr might be incognito, even to your allies. Anonymous Martyrs might disguise themselves as Paladins, mercenaries, or Rogues with hidden agendas and abundant conspiracies.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Anonymity Spells
entries: Your mortal burden ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Martyr level specified in the Anonymity Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth|XPHB} skill and with {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Fade from View
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can give yourself the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. This condition ends early if you make an attack roll, deal damage, or cast a spell.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by taking 5 Radiant damage. This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}, and bypasses {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Silent Sacrifice
entries: When you make an attack or damage roll that is improved by your Sacrifice feature against a target that can't see you, you don't take Radiant damage from using the feature and the target is magically silenced on a hit. Until the start of your next turn, the target can't speak, has the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition, and can't cast any spell that includes a Verbal component.

subclassFeature.name: False Martyrdom
entries: When you take damage or use your Undying Conviction, you can convincingly fake your death. You teleport up to a known location within 10 miles of you at the same time that a duplicate corpse appears to take your place. The corpse is indistinguishable from you and wears nonmagical duplicates of your clothing and equipment. You can choose for the corpse to realistically bleed, mutter incoherently, and breathe shallowly for up to a minute. The corpse is unaffected by spells and other magical effects. The corpse and its clothing and equipment vanish after 10 days, or when you dismiss it as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action or use this feature again.

Furthermore, if you covertly notify the GM, you can also convince other players of your death. You can roll Death Saving Throws as normal, ignoring successes, temporarily prepare a new character sheet, and so on.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Cheating Death
entries: At the GM's discretion, Martyrs with the Burden of Anonymity can use their False Martyrdom to avoid their inevitable death detailed in the Final Martyrdom feature. This still concludes the character's story with a glorious sacrifice but leaves the potential for the character to retire or simply disappear into a crowd once their ultimate goal has been achieved.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Assassin
entries: Your skill at remaining unseen grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Elusive Invisibility
entries: While you have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws.

entries.name: Swift Disappearance
entries: You can cast {@spell Invisibility|XPHB} and {@spell Greater Invisibility|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. You take half the normal Radiant damage from casting these spells.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Ascension
entries: {@i Ascend to Godhood}

The gods have set an arduous path for your life, replete with labors, challenges, and trials designed to test your morality and resolve. You likely won't succeed. However, if you best the gods' trials and die in marvelous glory, you will ascend to the afterlife as a demigod.

Perhaps the gods envision you as a replacement for a recently-deceased god, or perhaps they raise dozens of demigods to do their bidding across the planes of existence. Regardless of your status, immortality after death awaits.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Ascension Spells
entries: Your mortal burden ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Martyr level specified in the Ascension Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Ascension Spells
rows: {@spell Beacon of Hope|XPHB}, {@spell Protection from Energy|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Herculean Surge
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can gain a bonus to your Strength and Dexterity scores for 1 minute. This bonus is +4 if the ability score is 14 or lower, or +2 otherwise, up to a maximum of 22.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by taking 5 Radiant damage. This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}, and bypasses {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Olympic Agility
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} and {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. Additionally, {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} doesn't cost you extra movement.

subclassFeature.name: Relics of Legend
entries: Your legendary deeds have imbued your most iconic equipment with supernatural blessings. You choose three pieces of equipment to be your Aegis, Oracle, and Xiphos. These items might have been at your side for years, have been used to accomplish one of your labors, or even be trophies taken from your mightiest foes. Once you use your Aegis, Oracle, or Xiphos, you can't use that relic again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Aegis
entries: Your Aegis is a Shield, an article of clothing, or a pelt that grants you divine protection. You can use your Aegis to cast {@spell Shield|XPHB} without taking Radiant damage or expending a spell use.

entries.name: Oracle
entries: Your Oracle is a stone, gemstone, or another accessory that allows you to communicate with the gods. You can use your Oracle to cast {@spell Commune|XPHB} without taking Radiant damage or expending a spell use.

entries.name: Xiphos
entries: Your Xiphos is a sword, spear, or other Melee weapon. Immediately after you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with your Xiphos or reduce a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} with it, you can move up your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and make another melee weapon roll using it.

subclassFeature.name: Demigod Ascendant
entries: The power of demigods flows through your veins, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Improved Herculean Surge
entries: Your Herculean Surge improves. When you use this feature, your Strength and Dexterity scores gain a +4 bonus, up to a maximum of 24, for 1 minute. You regain your use of Herculean Surge whenever you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance
entries: If you fail a saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Atonement
entries: {@i Seek Redemption Through Sacrifice}

For all the wrong you have done in your life, the gods have graced you with an undeserved second chance. Your burden is to atone, to undo all the evils you have done in your life, and to seek redemption before the gods. How you accomplish this is your choice, so long as you remove any dark marks you leave behind. Ultimately, your final martyrdom might be a grand act, averting a great disaster or banishing a force of evil, or it might be as humble as redirecting the life of an evil person and causing them to seek redemption, passing the torch to a new Martyr of Atonement.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Atonement Spells
entries: Your mortal burden ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Martyr level specified in the Atonement Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Redirection
entries: When a creature you can see hits an ally within 5 feet of you with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force the attack to hit you instead.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by taking 5 Radiant damage. This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}, and bypasses {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Sin Eater
entries: You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to transfer negative effects from any number of willing creatures within 60 feet of yourself to you.

If a chosen effect forced the original target to make a saving throw to avoid or end it, you make that saving throw against it with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}. On a success, the effect ends; on a failure, the effect ends for the original target and affects you instead as if you were the original target.
You can transfer multiple negative effects of the same type to yourself, affecting you only once each time you use this feature.
You can transfer the following negative effects.

items: A curse, including the target's {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} to a cursed magic item
Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores
Any reduction to the target's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum

The {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Petrified|XPHB}, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, or {@condition Stunned|XPHB} conditions

subclassFeature.name: Selfless Sacrifice
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Sacrificial Challenge
entries: When you use your Sacrificial Strike, you can choose for the target to have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls it makes against creatures other than you until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Sacrificial Luck
entries: When you use your Sacrificial {@variantrule Skill|XPHB} to turn a failure into a success, each ally that can see you within 30 feet of yourself adds {@dice 1d6} to the next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} it makes before the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Ever-Vigilant
entries: You gain a special {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} that you can only take to use Reprisal or Redirection. You can only take one {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} per turn. Once you take this special {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, you can't take it again until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Calamity
entries: {@i Leave Catastrophic Plagues and Disasters in Your Wake}

A grim task awaits those shouldering the Burden of Calamity. These Martyrs spark wars, conjure floods, raise plagues of locusts, call down fire and brimstone, and set apocalypses in motion. As benevolent as the gods might seem, their mercy is tempered with disasters such as these, events that the gods deem necessary to cleanse unjust societies or wipe the slate clean for new advancements. Martyrs of Calamity are therefore harbingers of doom, the first omen of terrible things to follow.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Calamity Spells
