entries: Your mortal burden ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Martyr level specified in the Calamity Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Calamity
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can summon an elemental storm around you in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. Choose Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder damage. The {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} lasts for 1 minute and ends early if you dismiss it (no action required) or have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

Whenever the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} enters the space of a creature you can see and whenever a creature you can see enters the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} or ends its turn there, you can force that creature to make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and takes {@damage 1d8} damage of the chosen damage type. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. A creature makes this save only once per turn.
The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach Martyr levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by taking 5 Radiant damage (no action required). This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}, and bypasses {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Apocalyptic Omen
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can manifest a harmless, temporary omen within a 1-mile radius of yourself for 1 hour. This might include creating an eclipse on command, forming the clouds into a terrible face, conjuring pests, transforming water into blood, or causing the earth to tremble. For the duration, you add {@dice 1d4} to {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} you make.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Denounce Arcana
entries: A creature with the Magic Resistance trait has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}, instead of {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}, on saving throws against your Martyr spells.

subclassFeature.name: Doom Foretold
entries: You can call upon the gods' malice to create a sweeping disaster. You can cast {@spell Control Weather|XPHB}, {@spell Earthquake|XPHB}, {@spell Fire Storm|XPHB}, or {@spell Storm of Vengeance|XPHB} without taking Radiant damage or expending a spell use.
Once you use this feature to cast one of these spells, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Fame
entries: {@i Get Famous}

You were destined to see your name in lights, to be the talk of the town, to be a superstar. Unfortunately, the gods also chose you to go out in a blaze of glory. The Burden of Fame entails a life of renown matched only by royalty, coupled with incredible duties undertaken in the public eye. Your flame burns brightly for half as long, but when your journey is complete, nobody will forget your name.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Fame Spells
entries: Your mortal burden ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Martyr level specified in the Fame Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Celebrity
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Performance|XPHB} skill. Additionally, you gain a bonus to checks using this skill equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Starstruck
entries: You can cast {@spell Charm Person|XPHB} as a level 1 spell without taking Radiant damage. When you cast it, the target doesn't have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on its saving throw as a result of you fighting it. Additionally, a creature that has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition due to one of your Martyr spells regards you as a celebrity and is awed by your presence.

subclassFeature.name: Entourage
entries: You gain a bonus to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equal to the number of creatures with the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition within 30 feet of you, to a maximum of your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Crowd Suggestion
entries: You can cast {@spell Mass Suggestion|XPHB} without taking Radiant damage or expending a spell use. Once you cast the spell with this feature, you can't do so in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

Whenever you start casting the spell, you can modify it so that it doesn't require {@status Concentration|XPHB}. If you do so, the spell's duration becomes 1 minute for that casting and the spell can target up to 100 creatures within range.

subclassFeature.name: Superstar Sanctitude
entries: Your unparalleled stardom grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Reactive Sanctuary
entries: When you use your Reprisal, you can cast {@spell Sanctuary|XPHB} on yourself without taking Radiant damage or expending a spell use as a part of the {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

entries.name: Superstar Aura
entries: Each Large or smaller enemy that ends its turn within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Levity
entries: {@i Pull Pranks and Crack Jokes}

When bacchanal and trickster deities believe that the mortal realm has gotten too self-serious, they call upon a Martyr of Levity to lighten the mood. These impish Martyrs are given license to joke, prank, and romp about the world with extraordinarily vague directives. Perhaps they have been commanded to pull a prank or tell a joke so ludicrous that history remembers it forever. Or perhaps the Martyr is themselves the butt of a larger joke, a walking parable about fate's blunders. Sadly, the Martyr's death usually serves as a punchline.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Levity Spells
entries: Your mortal burden ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Martyr level specified in the Levity Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Levity Spells
rows: {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB}, {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter}, {@spell Minor Illusion|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Ne'er-Do-Well
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception|XPHB} skill. Additionally, you gain a bonus to checks using this skill equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Sacrificial Shenanigans
entries: When you use your Sacrificial Strike, choose one of the following effects.

entries.name: Taunt
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next attack it makes before the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Trip
entries: The target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Just a Prank
entries: Once per turn when a creature you can see makes an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} against you, you can make a melee attack against the creature. Your attack precedes the triggering attack.

subclassFeature.name: Matador Backstab
entries: You can cast {@spell Mass Suggestion|XPHB} without taking Radiant damage or expending a spell use. Once you cast the spell with this feature, you can't do so in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

Whenever you start casting the spell, you can modify it so that it doesn't require {@status Concentration|XPHB}. If you do so, the spell's duration becomes 1 minute for that casting and the spell can target up to 100 creatures within range.

subclassFeature.name: Zany Misdirection
entries: When you use your Reprisal, instead of dealing Radiant or Necrotic damage to the attacker, you can force the attack to hit another creature other than the attacker within the attack's range.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Mercy
entries: {@i Heal the Sick and Wounded}

When the suffering of the world grows too heavy and the cries of the anguished grow too loud, the gods deliver a Martyr to ease the strife and bring peace to the masses. This burden, however, has no end. A Martyr may spend all their days healing the sick and driving demons out of the possessed, but they will scarcely impact the world at large. Indeed, the onus upon them is not to mend every wound or comfort every widow, but to provide hope in the darkest of times that the gods have not forsaken their people, that peace will soon reign, and that light will be victorious.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Mercy Spells
entries: Your mortal burden ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Martyr level specified in the Mercy Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Mercy Spells
rows: {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Balm
entries: When you use your Miraculous {@variantrule Healing|XPHB}, you can choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. The target regains {@dice 1d8} for each {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die you expend with Miraculous {@variantrule Healing|XPHB} and you can end one of the following conditions on the target: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, or {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Merciful Healing
entries: You don't take Radiant damage from casting spells listed on the Mercy Spells table.

subclassFeature.name: Virtuous Blessings
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, choose a number of creatures you can see up to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) to receive one of the following blessings of your choice. Each creature need not receive the same blessing. An unused blessing is expended when a blessed creature finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Blessing of Alacrity
entries: The creature can expend this blessing to increase its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} by 30 feet until the end of the current turn (no action required).

entries.name: Blessing of Eloquence
entries: The creature can expend this blessing to gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} using Wisdom or Charisma (no action required).

entries.name: Blessing of Vigilance
entries: The creature can expend this blessing to gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on an {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Censuring Light
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you emanate a radiant light in a 30-foot Emanantion that lasts for 1 minute or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. Choose Aberrations, Celestials, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, or Undead.

Whenever the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} enters the space of a creature of the chosen type and whenever such a creature enters the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} or ends its turn there, it takes {@damage 4d6} Radiant damage. A creature takes this damage only once per turn.

Additionally, while in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, creatures of your choice have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects created by creatures of the chosen type.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by taking 30 Radiant damage. This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}, and bypasses {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Anointed Healer
entries: Whenever you cast a spell that restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to a creature, that creature regains additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} on the turn you cast the spell equal to your Martyr level. If this healing exceeds the creature's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum, it gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to excess healing, up to a maximum of your Martyr level.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Odyssey
entries: {@i Undertake a Journey of Discovery}

The gods have tasked you with exploring the far reaches of the world, to venture where no soul has gone before, and bring back the discoveries waiting to be found there. You might be tasked to map an undiscovered continent, discover a straight between distant cities, or sail the edge of the oceans, but peril and adventure regardless await. You are unlikely to return from your journey, but your expedition will not have been in vain as long as your odyssey is remembered.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Odyssey Spells
entries: Your mortal burden ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Martyr level specified in the Odyssey Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Voyager's Agility
entries: The gods have blessed you with light feet and a confident stride, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Sacrificial Speed
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet. When you use either benefit of your Sacrifice, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by another 10 feet until the end of your turn.

entries.name: Swift Reprisal
entries: On your turn, you can use Reprisal without taking a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Misty Transposition
entries: You can cast {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} without taking Radiant damage. When you do so, you can choose to teleport to a space occupied by a willing creature within range that doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. You both teleport, swapping places.

subclassFeature.name: Zephyr's Stride
entries: Whenever you end your turn 30 feet or further away from where you began, you are enveloped in a blur of speed. Until the start of your next turn, attack rolls against you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} and you don't take Radiant damage from your Sacrificial Strike.

subclassFeature.name: Argonaut
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Haste|XPHB} on yourself without taking Radiant damage or expending a spell use. When you cast the spell, it doesn't require {@status Concentration|XPHB} and, when the spell ends, you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition and your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} isn't 0.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by taking 30 Radiant damage (no action required). This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}, and bypasses {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Rebirth
entries: {@i Regenerate and Regrow the Natural World}

When the natural world is threatened by the needs of growing industry, the ravages of war, or a catastrophic event, the gods may choose a Martyr to protect the wild places of the world. Martyrs with this burden don't seek to prevent the destruction of the world; that would be impossible given the number of factors that threaten it. Instead, those tasked with the Burden of Rebirth give their lives to regenerate what has been razed, ushering in new life in places devastated by death.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Rebirth Spells
entries: Your mortal burden ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Martyr level specified in the Rebirth Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Rebirth Spells
rows: {@spell Entangle|XPHB}, {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB}, {@spell Goodberry|XPHB}, {@spell Shillelagh|XPHB}, {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Natural Companion
entries: You can cast {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} and {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB} without taking Radiant damage or expending a spell use.

subclassFeature.name: Surefooted
entries: {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} doesn't cost you or allies within 30 feet of yourself extra movement. Additionally, you and allies within 30 feet of you are immune to the {@spell Entangle|XPHB}, {@spell Spike Growth|XPHB}, and {@spell Plant Growth|XPHB} spells.

subclassFeature.name: Verdant Resilience
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can enter a state of natural regeneration, granting your the following for 1 minute. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries: At the start of each of your turns, you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) if you have at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}.

entries.name: Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Turn of the Wheel
entries: Death is only the beginning for you. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Reincarnation
entries: You can cast {@spell Reincarnate|XPHB} without Material components or taking Radiant damage. When you cast this spell, you can choose the new body's species instead of rolling for it randomly.

entries.name: Reincarnated Return
entries: If you die without using your Final Martyrdom, you can return to life 24 hours after you die as if you were the target of the {@spell Reincarnate|XPHB} spell. You can choose your new body's species instead of rolling for it randomly. Once you return to life in this way, you can't do so again for 10 days.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Revolution
entries: {@i Liberate Others and Slay Tyrants}

Kings and leaders are bound by an unspoken covenant to the gods to govern their people justly and peacefully. When a monarch turns their back on the gods, embraces tyranny, or uses cruel measures against their own people, a Martyr is called to end their reign. Rarely does a Martyr of Revolution come with peaceful measures, for when a king must fall, only the sword can provide the necessary leverage.

Such Martyrs are not only called to battle kings; any person of influence that oppresses others and abuses their power might wrong the gods enough to earn the ire of a Martyr. In dark times, a Martyr might be tasked with clearing a continent of despots and oppressors, calling for a full-scale military campaign of liberation.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Revolution Spells
entries: Your mortal burden ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Martyr level specified in the Revolution Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Revolution Spells
rows: {@spell Hold Monster|XPHB}, {@spell Rary's Telepathic Bond|XPHB|Telepathic Bond}

subclassFeature.name: Revolutionary Spirit
entries: Your zeal for freedom grants you the following benefits. Ranged Reprisal. You can use your Reprisal when you take damage from a creature you can see within 60 feet of you.

entries.name: Sacrificial Inspiration
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can take 5 Radiant damage to give {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} to an ally within 60 feet of yourself who can see or hear you. This damage ignores your {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}, and bypasses your {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Tenacity
entries: You and your allies within a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} centered on you gain a bonus to {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum bonus of +1). The aura is inactive while you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Kingslayer
entries: Once per turn when you reduce an enemy to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, choose one of the following benefits.

entries.name: Assault
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can move up to 15 feet and make a melee attack.

entries.name: Break Spells
entries: All of the creature's spells and effects immediately end, including all spells with permanent effects. Additionally, Contingency, Clone, and other spells that occur in response to the target's death don't trigger.

entries.name: Shatter Morale
entries: Each ally of the creature within 120 feet of it that has a {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} less than the target's (or the target's level if it doesn't have a {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB}) has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} target makes a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC, ending the condition on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Rallying Strike
entries: When you use your Sacrificial Strike, choose one of your allies within 30 feet of yourself who can see or hear you. The ally can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make one attack using a weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Truth
entries: {@i Bring a Prophet's Message to the World}

Tasked with unveiling the world's deceptions and delivering to the people a profound truth, Martyrs carrying the Burden of Truth face an endless battle with disillusionment and lies. Such a Martyr must earn the people's hearts and minds, turning their favors away from evil influences and toward divine ones. It is an uphill battle, but one that rarely requires grievous violence except in the most dire of circumstances.

Martyrs of Truth are often deemed prophets, for their gods entrust them with knowledge of the future, insights into the past, and sagacious perspective on the present. Such information is proof of their messages' divine origin and is a necessary balm, for the truths such Martyrs are called to preach are often a bitter pill for listeners to swallow.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Truth Spells
entries: Your mortal burden ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Martyr level specified in the Truth Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Truth Spells
rows: {@spell Word of Terror|ValdaSpire24}, {@spell Zone of Truth|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Compelling Message
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} skill. Additionally, you gain a bonus to checks using this skill equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Forewarning
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can glimpse some future peril and warn yourself or an ally within 60 feet of yourself who can hear you. This warning lasts until the creature finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} and ends early if you use this feature to warn a different creature. When the warned creature is hit by an attack roll, it can use this warning to gain a +5 bonus to its AC against the attack, potentially causing it to miss. The warning then ends for it.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by taking 5 Radiant damage (no action required). This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}, and bypasses {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Seer
entries: You have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Word of Revelation
entries: You can cast {@spell Word of Force|ValdaSpire24}, {@spell Word of Terror|ValdaSpire24}, and {@spell Word of Transience|ValdaSpire24} once each without taking Radiant damage or expending a spell use.

Once you cast one of these spells without taking Radiant damage, you must finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can cast the spell in that way again.

subclassFeature.name: Sacrificial Foresight
entries: When you use your Sacrificial {@variantrule Skill|XPHB}, you gain a +5 bonus to all {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} you make until the end of the current turn.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Tyranny
entries: {@i Rule with an Iron Fist}

When malevolent gods find the world pacified and defenseless, they send a Martyr of Tyranny to conquer its kingdoms, subjugate the weak, and spread misery with their blade. Once unleashed, this Martyr stops at nothing to establish an empire to rule over with an iron fist. They demand submission from their foes and pledges of fealty from their allies, taking gleeful satisfaction with every power grab and malicious turn. It isn't enough to rule: they must be feared, and any resistance must cower in their shadows. Only then will the gods let them die, likely stabbed in the back by someone crueler or more pitiless.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Tyranny Spells
entries: Your mortal burden ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Martyr level specified in the Tyranny Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Diabolic Presence
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation|XPHB} skill. Additionally, you gain a bonus to checks using this skill equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Vengeful Reprisal
entries: When you deal Radiant damage to a creature with your Reprisal, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against the target until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Death Stare
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, or as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action on your turn, you can lay a chilling gaze upon a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Sacrificial Resilience
entries: Once on each of your turns, immediately after you use your Sacrificial Strike, you can gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the amount of Radiant damage you take.

subclassFeature.name: Totalitarian Control
entries: You can cast {@spell Dominate Beast|XPHB}, {@spell Dominate Monster|XPHB}, or {@spell Dominate Person|XPHB} once without taking Radiant damage or expending a spell use. When you cast one of these spells using this feature, you gain the following benefits. Once you cast one of these spells without taking Radiant damage, you must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can cast the spell in that way again.

entries.name: Overpowering Command
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on its saving throw against the spell.

entries.name: Psychic Recoil
entries: When the spell ends, you can choose to deal {@damage 6d8} Psychic damage to the target.

entries.name: Iron Grip
entries: If you cast {@spell Dominate Beast|XPHB} or Dominate Person, you can numb the target to pain. The target doesn't repeat its saving throw against the spell when it takes damage.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of the End
entries: {@i Prevent a Looming Disaster, or Die Trying}

The gods have seen a great cataclysm on the horizon and tasked you with protecting the world from catastrophe. The coming end may entail the collapse of a kingdom, the arrival of an evil entity, or the quiet vanishing of a village, temple, or way of life. However destructive or temperate, the coming cataclysm disrupts the gods' plans or threatens their hold on the mortal plane. To this end, the gods imbue you with ancient and powerful spells, tools once gifted only to prophets. The life of a Martyr is always forfeit, so long as the cataclysm can be forestalled or defeated.

entries.subclassFeature: Burden of the End Spells|Martyr|ValdaMartyr|The End|ValdaMartyr|3

subclassFeature.name: Burden of the End Spells
entries: Your mortal burden ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Martyr level specified in the End Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: End Spells
rows: {@spell Chromatic Orb|XPHB}, {@spell Protection From Evil and Good|XPHB}, {@spell Sacred Flame|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Mystical Wisdom
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Arcana|XPHB} skill. Additionally, you gain a bonus to checks using this skill equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Spell Recovery
entries: When you take a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can choose to regain a number expended spell uses equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Anointed Arcana
entries: The Radiant damage you take from casting spells listed on the End Spells table is reduced by 10, to a minimum of 5.

subclassFeature.name: Sacrificial Spell
entries: When you cast a level 1+ Martyr spell, you can take 10 Radiant damage to use one of the following benefits. This damage ignores your {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}, and bypasses your {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Heighten
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you cast a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw, you can give one target of the spell {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saves against the spell.

entries.name: Quicken
entries: When you cast a spell that has a casting time of an action, you can change the casting time to a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} for this casting. You can't modify a spell in this way if you've already cast a level 1+ spell on the current turn, nor can you cast a level 1+ spell on this turn after modifying a spell in this way.

subclassFeature.name: Vindictive Spell
entries: When you take damage from an enemy you can see within 30 feet of yourself, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cast a level 1-3 Martyr spell. The spell must deal damage, have a casting time of an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, and target that creature or include it in its area. The Radiant damage you take from casting the spell is decreased by the amount of triggering damage (minimum 0).

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Discord
entries: {@i Wreak Havoc and Disrupt the Status Quo}

Martyrs of Discord are chosen at random to sow chaos wherever they travel. They light things on fire, commit petty crimes, and even murder when the fancy strikes. Apt to follow their own predilections, Martyrs of Discord are unified only by their charge to disrupt the status quo as much as possible.

No one is certain why the gods make Martyrs of Discord in the first place. Perhaps it is at the whim of one capricious or evil god, or perhaps the gods desire a balance between chaos and law, and must sometimes stoke the fire to restore this balance.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Discord Spells
entries: Your mortal burden ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Martyr level specified in the Discord Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Discord Spells
rows: {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter}, {@spell Inflict Wounds|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Havoc
entries: When you hit an enemy with a melee attack roll using a weapon, you can roll on the Havoc! table to trigger an additional effect.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by taking 5 Radiant damage (no action required). This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}, and bypasses {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.caption: Havoc!
rows: Your weapon momentarily becomes a plush toy. The attack deals only 1 Bludgeoning damage.
Flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried within 5 feet of you start burning.
Immediately after dealing damage, an explosion of force pushes you and the target 20 feet apart.
One object the target is holding magically teleports up to 15 feet away from it.
The target comically trips and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.
The target takes an extra 1d6 Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (GM's choice).
Immediately after dealing damage, you teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of yourself.
Until the start of your next turn, the target has one of the following conditions of your choice: {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition FrightenedX|PHB}, or {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}.
Your weapon doubles in size causing the triggering attack to become a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Coin of Chaos
entries: You have a coin infused with the tides of chaos. Whenever you or an ally makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can flip a coin to add a bonus to the roll. The bonus equals +4 on heads, or +1 on tails.

Once you use the coin, the coin passes to the GM, who can use it to add a bonus to any {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} made by a creature under their control. Once the GM uses the coin, it passes back to you, and so on. When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you regain the coin, whether or not the GM has used it.

subclassFeature.name: Pandemonium
entries: You can use your Havoc! without taking Radiant damage and, whenever you roll on the Havoc! table, you can roll twice and use either number.

subclassFeature.name: Sacrificial Burst
entries: When you use your Sacrificial Strike, you can deal an extra {@damage 2d10} Radiant damage instead of 10 Radiant damage, or {@damage 4d10} damage instead of 20.

Additionally, if you roll the highest number of any damage die for this attack, you can roll another of that die and add it to the damage. You can add a maximum of 10 dice to the attack's damage roll in this way.

subclassFeature.name: Daggermark
entries: {@i Use Stealth and Subterfuge to Achieve Victory}

Captains that bear the Daggermark—a tattoo, scar, or insignia representing a blade—utilize stealth and clandestine tactics to defeat their foes. Though they prefer ambushes and assassinations, they may acquiesce to direct confrontation if they have an underhanded tactic up their sleeve to safeguard victory. These Captains might be leaders in a Thieves' Guild, career assassins, or bandit captains that mark their closest confidants with the Daggermark to induct them into their ranks.

subclassFeature.name: Covert Tactics
entries: Your experience in striking from the shadows grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Roguish Proficiencies
entries: You gain proficiency with the {@skill Sleight of Hand|XPHB} and {@skill Stealth|XPHB} skills.

entries.name: Charismatic Initiative
entries: You gain a bonus to {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

entries.name: Quick Hide
entries: You can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Effortless Dodge [Maneuver]
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one Battle Die to take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} or {@action Dodge|XPHB} action. You can't use this maneuver while wearing Medium or Heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Flanking Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack using a weapon, the next attack roll made by an ally against the target before the end of your next turn has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Evasion
entries: You can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain dangers. When you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and only half damage if you fail. You can't use this feature if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. Your Cohort also gains the benefits of this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Preemptive Strike
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet makes an attack against you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make one attack with a weapon against the attacker. Resolve your attack before the triggering attack.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you expend one Battle Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Eagle Banner
entries: {@i Deliver Shots with Pinpoint Accuracy}

With sharp eyes and even sharper arrows, Captains of the Eagle Banner seek to master bows, slings, and ballistae alike. Such Captains are just as dangerous in close range as they are perched on the horizon, for they can accurately deliver an arrow or a crossbow bolt at point blank range.

subclassFeature.name: Eagle Eye [Maneuver]
entries: Once per turn when you miss with a ranged attack roll, you can expend one Battle Die and add it to the attack roll, potentially causing the attack to hit.

subclassFeature.name: Close-Quarters Shooting
entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your ranged attack rolls with Ranged weapons. Your Cohort also gains the benefits of this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Vantage Point
entries: Your skill at scaling walls and gaining a perch above your foes grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Climb Speed
entries: You have a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: High Ground Shot
entries: When you make a ranged attack roll from an elevation of 15 feet or more above the target, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Counter-Shot [Maneuver]
entries: When an enemy you can see hits a creature with a ranged attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and expend one Battle Die to attempt to intercept the attack. You must be holding a Ranged weapon and the creature must be within your weapon's range to use this maneuver. Subtract the Battle Die from the attack roll, potentially causing it to miss.

subclassFeature.name: Hundred-Arrow Volley
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action with a Ranged weapon, you can replace one of your attacks with a flurry of projectiles in one of the following ways.

entries.name: Arrow Rain
entries: Choose a point within your weapon's range. You launch several projectiles that rain down in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high {@variantrule Cylinder [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cylinder} centered on that point. Make a separate ranged attack roll against each target in that {@variantrule Cylinder [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cylinder}.

entries.name: Scatter Shot
entries: You launch several projectiles in a 20- foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. Make a separate ranged attack roll against each target in that {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}.

subclassFeature.name: Jolly Roger
entries: {@i Command Your Crew on the High Seas}

The skull and crossbones of the Jolly Roger need no introduction: it means thieves, brigands, treasure, and adventure on the high seas. Moreover, it means the strong backs of a crew working in unison, piloting a ship from horizon to horizon under the command of a fierce captain and their first mate.

subclassFeature.name: Skirmish [Maneuver]
entries: When you make an attack using a weapon, you can expend one Battle Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make an attack using the same weapon or a different one later on the same turn. One attack must be a melee attack roll and the other must be a ranged attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Scallywag
entries: You have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and your Cohort has a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Fancy Footwork
entries: Your elegant swordplay puts enemies where you want them. Whenever you hit a creature of Large size or smaller with a Melee weapon, you can force the target to move to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it, and you can move 5 feet. This movement doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

subclassFeature.name: Dirty Tactics
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a Melee weapon, you can use one of the following effects.

entries.name: Flank
entries: Your Cohort has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next melee attack roll it makes against the target while you are within 5 feet of it before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Pocket Sand
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on its next attack roll before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Trip
entries: The target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition if it is Large or smaller.

subclassFeature.name: All Hands on Deck
entries: At your directive, your crew works in perfect unison. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can issue a series of directives to allies within 30 feet of yourself that can see or hear you. Each ally has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next {@dice D20} test it makes before the start of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Lion Banner
entries: {@i Lead with Heroism and Zeal}

Captains who fly the Lion Banner are consummate leaders with forceful personalities and a penchant for heroics. Such Captains lead from the front, flying their banner high in battles where valor and luck turn the tide in their favor.

subclassFeature.name: Commanding Presence
entries: If you use your Born Leader maneuver and the check still fails, you don't expend the Battle Die to use the maneuver.

subclassFeature.name: Challenge [Maneuver]
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack using a Melee weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can expend one Battle Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to goad the target into attacking you. Add the Battle Die to the attack's damage roll. Until the start of your next turn, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against creatures other than you while you are within 5 feet of the target.

subclassFeature.name: High Morale
entries: You can use your Morale Boost maneuver when two or more creatures, including yourself, simultaneously fail a saving throw against the same effect, such as a dragon's breath weapon. Each creature that failed its saving throw gains the benefit of Morale Boost, and you only expend one Battle Die.

subclassFeature.name: Vengeful Gambit
entries: When a creature under the effect of your Challenge maneuver hits you with an attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the attack's damage for that attack and make an attack against that creature using a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} as a part of the same {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Heroic Leadership
entries: When you use your Bolster or Rally maneuver, the target gains {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} if it doesn't already have it.

subclassFeature.name: Yellow Sign
entries: {@i Enthrall Your Friends and Foes with Eldritch Madness}

The Yellow Sign is a twisting symbol of eldritch chaos, the signature of an otherworldly leviathan ready to consume all of reality. Captains bearing its distinctive mark upon their Shields and armor aren't commanders—they are cult leaders dedicated to incomprehensible alien masters. Their objectives are as secretive as they are disquieting, but undoubtedly demand indoctrination of more thralls to spread their master's sign and influence.

subclassFeature.name: Frenzied Strike [Maneuver]
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack using a Melee weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can expend one Battle Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to infect the target's mind. The creature has the Frenzied condition until the end of its next turn.

A creature with the Frenzied condition loses the ability to distinguish between friend and foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies. While Frenzied, the creature chooses the targets for its attacks, spells, and abilities randomly from among the creatures it can see within range, and it must make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} if any creature provokes one.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Herald
entries: Your eldritch master psychically nudges you toward its goals, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Outer Knowledge
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you gain proficiency and {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in a skill chosen by the GM. The GM can change this skill when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Enthralled
entries: You and your Cohort have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.

subclassFeature.name: Pallid Aura
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to trace the Yellow Sign in the air and create a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of psychic energy centered on yourself for 1 minute or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. Once per turn, when a creature within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can roll {@dice 1d6} and subtract it from the roll (no action required).

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you expend one Battle Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Maniacal Influence
entries: Your eldritch master's influence grows, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Frenzied Ally
entries: When a creature has the Frenzied condition of your Frenzied Strike, it regards you and your Cohort as allies while it has the condition.

entries.name: Frenzied Blitz
entries: When you use your Blitz feature, you can direct a creature that has the Frenzied condition, even if that creature isn't an ally.

entries.name: Extended Frenzy
entries: Whenever a creature that has the Frenzied condition of your Frenzied Strike ends its turn, it must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Maneuver save DC. On a failed save, the Frenzied condition doesn't end for that creature. On a success, the condition ends for that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Nightmarish Glow
entries: While the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of your Pallid Aura is active, you and your allies within the Emantion deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage when hitting an enemy with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Holy Icon
entries: {@i Champion a Divine Cause}

Captains adorned with a Holy Icon are the champions of a god or ideology, embarking on minor quests and holy crusades in furtherance of their ideals. Though not imbued with grand divine powers, they command a suite of lesser miracles to heal and strengthen their allies for the long road ahead and a surety of purpose to propel them onward.

subclassFeature.name: Theological Studies
entries: Your faith and force of personality grant you the following benefits.

entries.name: Charismatic Religion
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Religion|XPHB} skill. Additionally, you gain a bonus to Intelligence ({@skill Religion|XPHB}) checks equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Cleric spell list. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

subclassFeature.name: Minor Miracle
entries: A creature targeted by your Rally maneuver regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to two rolls of your Battle Die plus your Charisma modifier. Additionally, you can use the Rally maneuver to heal a creature that has 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
At Captain level 10, a creature targeted by your Rally maneuver regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to four rolls of your Battle Dice plus your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Zealous Fervor
entries: Your fanaticism motivates your allies, granting the following benefits.

entries.name: Strength of Spirit
entries: When you use your Blitz feature to command an ally that has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} or {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition, it can reroll its save against the effect causing that condition, ending the condition on itself on a success.

entries.name: Radiant Strike
entries: When you use your Blitz feature to command an ally to make an attack, the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} Radiant damage on a hit.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Reprieve
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can create a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you, which lasts for 1 minute or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. When you or an ally starts its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, that creature gains one of the following benefits of its choice. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you expend two Battle Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

entries.name: Temporary Hit Points
entries: The creature gains {@dice 2d8} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Resistance
entries: The creature has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to a damage type of its choice other than Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: End Condition
entries: The creature ends one condition on itself: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, or {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Raise Cohort
entries: You can cast the spell {@spell Raise Dead|XPHB} without a spell slot. If you revive a creature that was your Cohort, you also cast the spell without Material components. The creature becomes your Cohort once again, without an 8-hour initiation period.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Banner
entries: {@i Defeat Your Foes with an Arsenal of Maneuvers}

Captains under the Dragon Banner are a scourge upon the battlefield. Armed with an array of lethal maneuvers, these captains cut through lesser combatants with ease, turning the tides of battle on their own, if needed. The visage of the Dragon Banner inspires fear and loyalty in equal measure, for the carnage left in a dragon warrior's wake speaks volumes of their skill.

subclassFeature.name: Critical Focus
entries: You enter a flow state in combat, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Improved Critical
entries: Your attack rolls with weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} can score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

entries.name: Chain Critical
entries: Whenever you reduce an enemy to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} against an enemy, your {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} range increases. After the first such attack, your attacks score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 18-20 on the {@dice d20}; after the second, you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 17-20; after the third, you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 16-20. Your {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} range resets after 1 minute or when you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Rampage [Maneuver]
entries: Once on each of your turns, immediately after you reduce an enemy to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with a melee attack roll, you can expend one Battle Die to move up to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and make a melee attack (no action required). On a hit, you add the Battle Die to the attack's damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Martial Recovery
entries: You can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to regain all of your expended Battle Dice.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Bloody Spectacle
entries: Whenever you reduce an enemy to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} against an enemy, you can strike terror into nearby foes. When you do so, each creature of your choice in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Maneuver save DC. On a failed save, a creature has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} creature's turns, the creature repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you expend one Battle Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Coup de Grce [Maneuver]
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack using a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can expend two Battle Dice as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to attempt to execute the target. Add the Battle Dice to the attack's damage roll. If you reduce the target to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, this maneuver doesn't expend any Battle Dice.

subclassFeature.name: Tower Banner
entries: {@i Fortify Yourself and Your Allies}

The fortified defenses of Captains who fly the Tower Banner are legendary. Their tactics emphasize fortification and survival, as well-protected soldiers cannot only win battles, but entire wars. Thinking long term is key to any defensive strategy, as Captains of the Tower know the answer is never how they shall counterattack, but when.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Wall [Maneuver]
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one Battle Die to fortify yourself. The next time you are hit by an attack within the next minute, roll the Battle Die and add the number rolled to your AC against this attack, potentially causing it to miss. This effect ends early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. You must be wearing Heavy armor to use this maneuver.

subclassFeature.name: Siege Defense
entries: Well-versed in repelling attackers, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Defensive Tactics
entries: When you attack with a Melee weapon whose mastery property you can use, you can replace that property with the {@itemMastery Push|XPHB} or {@itemMastery Slow|XPHB} property for that attack.

entries.name: Shooting from Cover
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to ranged attack rolls while in {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} or {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Three-Quarters Cover}.

subclassFeature.name: Armored Redirection
entries: When a creature you can see hits an ally within 5 feet of you with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force the attack to target you instead. If the attack roll equals or exceeds your AC, the attack hits you instead; otherwise, it misses.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you expend one Battle Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Mettle
entries: Your determination allows you to shrug off effects that would otherwise harm you. When you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Constitution saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and only half damage if you fail. You can't use this feature if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. Your Cohort also gains the benefits of this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Retribution
entries: Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you misses you with an attack roll, you can strike them with a Shield if you're carrying one (no action required), dealing {@damage 3d6} Bludgeoning damage to the attacker.

subclassFeature.name: Siegeball Jersey
entries: {@i Cheer and Coach Your Team to Victory}

Siegeball is a beloved sport, and Captains adorned with a Siegeball Jersey live and breathe it. Such Captains view the entire world through sports metaphors and place themselves in the privileged position of the team captain or perhaps the coach. Foes are naturally the opposing team, the referees, or even a rowdy crowd. Quests are no different from a sports season, in which the team is destined to break records and bring home the cup. For Siegeball Captains, sportsmanship and rowdy competition go hand-in-hand. One can expect rousing speeches and inappropriate jeers meted out between downfield sprints and breathtaking tackles.

subclassFeature.name: Sports Fanatic
entries: Your absolute devotion to your sport of choice grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Charismatic Athletics
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Athletics|XPHB} skill. Additionally, you gain a bonus to Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) checks equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

entries.name: Number One Fan
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any ability check you make to recall information about a sport, its teams, and its players.

subclassFeature.name: Team Inspiration [Maneuver]
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to and inspire another creature within 60 feet of yourself who can see or hear you. Give that creature one of your unexpended Battle Dice. A creature can have only one Battle Die from this maneuver at a time.

Once within the next minute when the creature fails a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, the creature can roll the Battle Die and add the number rolled to the {@dice d20}, potentially turning the failure into a success. A Battle Die is expended when it's rolled.

subclassFeature.name: Game Plan
entries: When you use your Blitz feature, you can direct your Cohort or an ally within 60 feet of yourself to take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to use one of the following options.

entries.name: Defensive Tackle
entries: The chosen ally moves up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and uses the Grapple or Shove option of its {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

entries.name: Go Long
entries: The chosen ally moves up to twice its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Take Cover
entries: The chosen ally moves up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and takes the {@action Hide|XPHB} action. It has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on its Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) check.

subclassFeature.name: Athletic Constitution
entries: When you make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw, you can make a Constitution saving throw with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} instead.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you expend one Battle Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Game-Winning Play
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to delay the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition. You can immediately move up to twice your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} and take an action and a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. Taking damage causes {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB} failures as normal, and three {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB} failures can still kill you. Following this, you have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition if you still have 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Skull Banner
entries: {@i Command a Loyal Undead Cohort}

Captains who fly the Skull Banner are grim heralds of an Undead tide. Their Cohorts and followers are shambling corpses or ethereal ghosts, hellbent on consuming and corrupting the living. Necromancers by any other name, Captains of the Skull possess little of the arcane talent beyond what is necessary to command an Undead army; little else is needed to make them formidable adversaries.

subclassFeature.name: Undead Cohort
entries: Instead of initiating a Cohort, you can perform a ritual over the course of 8 hours, which can be done during a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, to animate an Undead Cohort. Choose its stat block: {@creature Corporeal Undead|ValdaCaptain} or {@creature Incorporeal Undead|ValdaCaptain}. You also choose what kind of Undead it is, such as a zombie or ghost, appropriate for the stat block.

subclassFeature.name: Horrific Strike [Maneuver]
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack using a Melee weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can expend one Battle Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to terrify the target. Add the Battle Dice to the attack's damage roll. The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Undead Horde
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, can cast {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} without a spell slot targeting the corpse of a Medium or Small Humanoid that has died within the last minute. When you cast the spell in this way, the Undead counts as your Cohort for your Captain features and uses your Charisma for its attack and damage rolls. This Undead lasts for 10 minutes, after which it crumbles into dust.

subclassFeature.name: Sacrificial Thralls
entries: Whenever you are targeted by an attack while an Undead you control is within 5 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to command it to dive in the way of the attack, causing the attack to target the Undead instead.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you expend one Battle Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Necromantic Burst
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can release a burst of negative energy in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} centered on a corpse you can see within 60 feet of yourself. Each creature you choose within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} makes a Constitution saving throw against your Maneuver save DC, taking {@damage 10d8} Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Undead you control within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half of the Necrotic damage dealt.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Demon Brand
entries: {@i Harness the Demon Within You}

Captains bearing an abyssal Demon Brand have struck the darkest of pacts: binding their soul to a demonic entity that periodically takes hold of their body. On the battlefield, they forgo the companionship of a Cohort and rely on a flickering symbiosis between themselves and their demon. The demon and Captain are two halves of the same creature, sharing a single body and parts of one soul.

subclassFeature.name: Demon Cohort
entries: A demonic entity takes up residence within your body. The demon is jealously possessive—it becomes your Cohort and you can't gain a new one. Unlike other Cohorts, the demon isn't a separate entity and doesn't take its own turn. Instead, you transform into the demon using the following rules.

entries.name: Shape-Shift
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to shape-shift into the demon or return to your normal form. While shape-shifted, your game statistics are replaced by the {@creature Demon Cohort|ValdaCaptain|Demon Cohort's} stat block, but you retain your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, class features, and feats. You choose whether your equipment merges into the demon or is worn by it.

entries.name: Temporary Hit Points
entries: When you are shape-shifted into the demon, you have {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the demon's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, which last until you return to your normal form. When you lose {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}, the demon loses an equal number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. If you no longer have {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} or the demon is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you return to your normal form and can't shape-shift into the demon until the demon regains any {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Demon in Combat
entries: Unlike other Cohorts, the demon doesn't take a separate turn in combat.

entries.name: Restoring the Demon
entries: The demon gains the benefits of taking a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} as normal. Spells and other effects that restore {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} can target you or the demon while you are shape-shifted. When the demon regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} it grants you increases by an equal number. If the demon is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it regains 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} after 1 minute, allowing you to shape-shift into it again.

subclassFeature.name: Abyssal Arcana
entries: Your demonic connection grants you the ability to expend Battle Dice to cast the following spells without a spell slot. When you cast a spell using this feature, its duration is 1 minute if it were normally longer.

entries.name: 1 Battle Die:
entries: {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB}, {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB}, {@spell Expeditious Retreat|XPHB}, {@spell Silent Image|XPHB}

entries.name: 2 Battle Dice:
entries: {@spell Alter Self|XPHB}, {@spell Darkness|XPHB}, {@spell Darkvision|XPHB}, {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB}

entries.name: 3 Battle Dice:
entries: {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB}, {@spell Nondetection|XPHB}, {@spell Tongues|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Blindsight
entries: You have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet while shape-shifted and in your normal form.

subclassFeature.name: Instinctive Transformation
entries: When you take damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to shape- shift into the demon or return to your normal form. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the triggering damage.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you expend one Battle Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Abyssal Regeneration
entries: At the start of each of your turns, the demon regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 5 plus your Charisma modifier if it is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Amorist
entries: {@i Brew Love Potions and Charm Your Foes}

The study of mind-affecting alchemy is a delicate one, practiced only by a small number of Alchemists, known as Amorists. Often called "love doctors" by their clientele, Amorists specialize in the brewing of potions that produce strong emotional responses in their drinkers. While love potions are by far their most popular product, Amorists can also craft pungent pheromone bombs that can even soften the hearts of terrible monsters.

subclassFeature.name: Charmer
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception|XPHB} and {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} skills. Additionally, when you make a Charisma check using these skills, you can make it as an Intelligence check.
When you brew potions, you can create a {@item Philter of Love|XDMG} for 1 Reagent.

subclassFeature.name: Pheromone Bomb [Formula]
entries: By adding a potent pheromone to your {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist}, you can change it into a Pheromone Bomb. This {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} deals no damage. When you use the Bomb's {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property, each creature within the explosion makes a Wisdom saving throw, instead of Dexterity. A target hit by this {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} or that fails its saving throw against it has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn or until it takes damage.

subclassFeature.name: Magnetic Personality
entries: You can take the {@action Influence|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Beguiling Perfume
entries: You wear a mind-altering perfume that endears others to you. When an enemy within 5 feet of you makes an attack roll against you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Alchemist save DC or either choose a new target or lose the attack. A creature that takes damage from you is immune to this feature for 1 hour.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemical Romance
entries: When you use your Pheromone Bomb, you can expend 1-4 Reagents to improve it. Choose a number of benefits equal to the number of Reagents expended.

entries.name: Dreamy Haze
entries: Choose one creature that has the Bomb's {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition. While {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, that creature falls into a dreamy state in which it regards every creature it sees as the condition's charmer.

entries.name: Extended Charm
entries: Choose one creature that has the Bomb's {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition. The {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition lasts for 1 minute for it or until it takes damage.

entries.name: Ignore Immunity
entries: Your Pheromone Bomb ignores {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Toxic Love
entries: A target hit by your Pheromone Bomb or that fails its saving throw against it takes Poison damage equal to {@dice 4d8} plus your Intelligence modifier. A creature takes half as much damage on a successful save. This damage doesn't end the Bomb's {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Apothecary
entries: {@i Heal the Sick and Wounded}

Many practically minded Alchemists assume the role of the Apothecary, for adventuring parties always need a healer and Clerics are often in short supply. During their downtime, such Alchemists have a marketable skill to depend upon for income and can do an indisputable amount of good with their knowledge. Apothecaries constantly study potions and herbology, preferring to learn how to mend the body, rather than destroy it.

subclassFeature.name: Physician's Studies
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Medicine|XPHB} skill. Additionally, you gain a bonus to checks using this skill equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Painkiller Bomb [Formula]
entries: You can mix your {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} contents with analgesic oil, changing it into a Painkiller Bomb. This {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} deals no damage, but instead causes the target or each creature within the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property to gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. These {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal your Alchemist level.

When you grant {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} using this Bomb, you can also expend Reagents to use Empowered Bomb. Instead of increasing the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} damage, you increase the number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} by {@dice 1d10} for each expended Reagent.
You can use this formula a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once) and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Concentrated Healing
entries: When a creature regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} as a result of drinking one of your potions, it can instead replace up to half of the die rolled with the highest possible number for each die.

subclassFeature.name: Self-Medication
entries: Whenever you drink a potion that has the effect of restoring your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} (even if you already have all of your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}), you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemical Resurrection
entries: Your medicines are potent enough to rouse the dead. By using a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to mix diamond dust worth 1,000 GP+ into a {@item Potion of Superior Healing|XDMG} or a {@item Potion of Supreme Healing|XDMG}, you create a {@item Potion of Resurrection|ValdaSpire24}. This potion doesn't become inert after 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Mutagenist
entries: {@i Mutate Yourself to Adapt to Any Situation}

The study of alchemy is fundamentally the study of transformation. All Alchemists transmute mundane materials into magical substances—potions, elixirs, and bombs—yet some take it one step further. You have discovered the secrets of the mutagen, the keystone of transmutation, which allows you to transform your very body, gaining supernatural strength or speed, sprouting additional limbs or claws, or thickening your skin into a stony aegis.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain proficiency in your choice of the {@skill Acrobatics|XPHB} or {@skill Athletics|XPHB} skill.

subclassFeature.name: Mutagens
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to inject yourself with a potent transmutative potion known as a Mutagen. You gain one of the following benefits of your choice for 1 minute, or until you take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to inject yourself with a different Mutagen.

entries.name: Strength
entries: Your Strength score increases by 3, to a maximum of 23. Additionally, you sprout claws, fangs, spines, horns, or a different natural weapon of your choice. You can use this natural weapon to make {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}. You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}. When you deal damage with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can deal damage equal to {@dice 1d8} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier instead of the strike's normal damage. The damage of this strike is Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage, as appropriate for the natural weapon.

entries.name: Dexterity
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 3, to a maximum of 23. Additionally, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet.

entries.name: Constitution
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 3, to a maximum of 23. You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} instead of increasing your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum or current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. If your Constitution modifier increases by 1, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your level. If the modifier increases by 2, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice your level. These {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} last for the duration of the ability score increase.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Mutagen
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} and expend 1 Reagent to inject an ally within 5 feet of you with a Mutagen of your choice. A creature can only be under the effect of one Mutagen at a time. Once you have injected another creature with a Mutagen, you can't do so again until the original Mutagen ends.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Mutation
entries: Whenever you inject yourself with a Mutagen, you can also gain one of the following mutations of your choice.

entries.name: Hyperelastic
entries: Your flesh takes on a rubbery quality, allowing you to bend and stretch with ease. Your reach is 5 feet greater than normal. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on checks you make to end the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition or to escape from nonmagical restraints.

entries.name: Mucilaginous
entries: Your skin secretes a thick, extremely sticky substance that helps you adhere to objects. You can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You also have a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Polybrachia
entries: You grow a pair of additional arms. These arms are fully functional and can be used to hold weapons and shields (allowing you to wield two Two-Handed weapons, or four one-handed weapons), perform Somatic components of spells, and perform other actions, though the arms themselves don't grant you any additional actions.

subclassFeature.name: Mutated Blood
entries: Choose Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution. The chosen ability score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases to 22. When a Mutagen is applied to that ability score, its maximum increases to 25. You can change this ability score increase when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Resonator
entries: {@i Use Acoustics to Shape the Battlefield}

The explosive force of an Alchemist's Bomb isn't just fire—it is a wave that can be shaped and focused. Alchemists who realize this and pursue the science of waves are deemed Resonators for their oft-revisited subject, resonant frequencies. Perhaps such frequencies are at the center of all alchemical pursuits, for with the right frequencies, a Resonator can warp explosions, concuss dragons, and vibrate steel to pieces.

subclassFeature.name: Playback Device
entries: You construct a clockwork device for recording and playing back audio. You can record anything you have heard within the last minute using this device and can store up to 8 hours of audio. Played back audio sounds identical to when it was recorded, but you can't use this device to replicate sounds loudly enough to deafen or deal damage. Additionally, you can playback audio up to three times as loud, allowing you to use the device as a megaphone. If you lose your Playback Device, you can build a new one using materials worth 100+ GP over the course of a Short or Long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Conical Bomb [Formula]
entries: By attaching a waveguide to the exterior of your {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist}, you can change it into a Conical Bomb. This Bomb deals Thunder damage instead of Fire damage. When you use the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property, the explosion is a 10-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} originating from the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} point of impact, extending in a direction you choose. Each creature within the {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} makes a Constitution saving throw, instead of Dexterity. You can extend the cone by 5 feet by expending Reagent dice as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Resonant Frequency
