entries: You have discovered that every material has a resonant frequency, a specific tone that compromises its structural integrity. As a Magic action, you can choose one type of solid material, such as wood, glass, metal, or stone, and begin playing the material's resonant frequency through your Playback Device. You can stop playing a resonant frequency on your turn (no action required).

When you take this action and at the start of each of your turns while playing the frequency, objects made of the specified material within 15 feet of you that aren't being worn or carried take Force damage equal to {@dice 1d8} plus your Intelligence modifier. Constructs or Elementals made predominantly of a single material, such as metal or stone, and components of objects, such as the metal lock of a door, can also be damaged by a resonant frequency.

subclassFeature.name: Flashbang
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can throw a concussive explosive at your feet. Each Large or smaller creature of your choice within 10 feet of you can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Reverb Explosions
entries: When you prime a {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} and use its {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property, you can spend 4 Reagents to create a reverb explosion. If the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} deals damage, all if its damage dice decrease by 1 step (d12s  d10s  d8s  d6s  d4s, to a minimum of d4s). At the start of your next turn, the explosion occurs again with the same area and damage, but its damage dice are decreased by a further 1 step.

subclassFeature.name: Venomsmith
entries: {@i Cripple Your Foes with Deadly Poisons}

For every Alchemist that devotes their life to healing the sick, another hears a darker calling. Commonly called poisoners or Venomsmiths, these Alchemists are masters in the art of crafting deadly and debilitating poisons. Whether employed by an assassin's guild or performing assassinations themselves, a Venomsmith's presence is usually accompanied by untimely death.

subclassFeature.name: Poisoner
entries: You gain the {@optfeature Alchemy of Poison|ValdaAlchemist} discovery and can ignore the prerequisite of Alchemist level 5 for brewing poisons. This discovery doesn't count against your number of discoveries known, and you can't later replace this discovery with a different one.

subclassFeature.name: Laughing Gas Bombs
entries: You gain the {@optfeature Laughing Gas Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} formula, which doesn't count against your total number of formulae known. If you already have it, gain another formula of your choice. For you, the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} is improved in the following ways.

entries.name: Improved Damage
entries: All of this {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} damage dice are d10s.

entries.name: Side-Splitter
entries: A creature that rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20} for its saving throw against the {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property of this {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemical Assassin
entries: You have a specially-designed needle ring for poisoning others. You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to deal 1 Piercing damage to a creature within 5 feet of you, subjecting the creature to contact and injury poisons on the ring. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand|XPHB} and {@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks made to conceal and use this ring.

subclassFeature.name: Mithridatism
entries: By administering small doses of poisons and toxins to yourself, you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage and the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Toxic Recompense
entries: Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to unleash a spray of poisonous vapor. The attacker must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Alchemist save DC or have the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. While it has the condition, the creature takes {@damage 1d10} Poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Xenoalchemist
entries: {@i Harvest Monsters and Attach Grafts}

A small number of renegade Alchemists elect to experiment on themselves, modifying their anatomy or even outright attaching new body parts. These experimenters are often considered unethical and dangerous, even by other Alchemists, and those that practice them are branded Xenoalchemists for their efforts. As Xenoalchemists progress in their studies, they invariably stumble upon the dangerous practice of alchemical necromancy, which allows them to imbue life upon amalgamations of body parts.

subclassFeature.name: Xenobiology
entries: You also gain proficiency in one of these skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana|XPHB}, {@skill Nature|XPHB}, or {@skill Medicine|XPHB}. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on all ability checks you make to identify or research monsters.

subclassFeature.name: Mad Scientist
entries: Your experiments in xenoalchemy grant you the following benefits.

entries.name: Two Grafts
entries: You gain two {@filter Common or Uncommon monstrous grafts|items|type=monstrous graft|rarity=common;uncommon} of your choice. {@item Beast's Hide|ValdaAlchemist} and {@item Climbing Apparatus|ValdaAlchemist} are recommended. {@filter Monstrous grafts|items|type=monstrous graft} are detailed at the end of the class description.

entries.name: Painless Attachment
entries: You don't lose Hit Dice from installing or removing grafts, and it takes you no time to recover after the attachment of a new graft.

entries.name: Intelligent Grafts
entries: You can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attacks and damage of {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} that are improved by a graft, such as {@item Bestial Weapons|ValdaAlchemist}. If a graft forces a creature to make a saving throw, it uses your Alchemist save DC.

subclassFeature.name: Sleep Bomb [Formula]
entries: By adding a tranquilizer to your {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist}, you can change it into a Sleep Bomb. This Bomb deals no damage. When you use the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property, each creature within the explosion makes a Wisdom saving throw, instead of Dexterity. A target hit by this Bomb or that fails its saving throw against it has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn at which point it must repeat the save. If the target fails the second save, the target has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. The condition ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} effect.

Creatures that don't sleep, such as elves, or that have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} condition automatically succeed on saves against this Bomb. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw against the Bomb is Immune to its conditions for 24 hours.
You can use this formula a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once) and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Surgical Strike
entries: You can take the {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine a creature as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. You learn the target's creature type and make a DC 15 Intelligence check using a skill from the Examine Specimen table, corresponding to the target's creature type. If you succeed, you learn one of the following pieces of information of your choice about the target: its AC, Immunities, Resistances, and whether it is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

Whether you succeed or fail, you can't use this feature again to target that creature or another creature of its specific kind (such as humans or unicorns) until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.caption: Examine Specimen
rows: Aberrations, Constructs, Elementals, Fey, and Monstrosities

subclassFeature.name: Necromantic Organs
entries: You've augmented your body with reanimated organs that persist after your death. If you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} but not killed outright, you can drop to a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Alchemist level.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: It's Alive!
entries: Your research into necromancy has culminated in golem stitched together from discarded body parts. This golem uses the {@creature Alchemy Golem|ValdaAlchemist} stat block.

entries.name: Creating or Replacing the Golem
entries: You can make a golem using 3 Humanoid corpses in a process that requires 8 hours of work, which can be done during a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. If you already have a golem from this feature, the old one dies when the new one is completed.

entries.name: Golem in Combat
entries: The golem is under your control and is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, it takes its turn immediately before or after your turn each round (your choice). You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mentally command the golem if it is within 500 feet of you. If you issue no commands, the golem takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and moves only to avoid harm.

entries.name: Golem Grafts
entries: You can attach up to three monstrous grafts to the golem.

entries.name: Restoring the Golem
entries: If the golem has died within the last hour, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to touch it and expend 1 Reagent. The golem returns to life with a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d10} plus your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Mad Bomber
entries: {@i Blow Things Up}

While many "Mad Bombers" aren't actually mad, it takes a special kind of crazy to devote one's life to studying explosives. Most Alchemists who specialize in this field are incorrigible pyromaniacs who take great pleasure in burning, blasting, and blowing things up. Mad Bombers are always working to improve their bombs' effectiveness.

subclassFeature.name: Blasting Specialty
entries: Your {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bombs} deal double damage to objects and structures.

subclassFeature.name: Black Powder Bomb [Formula]
entries: By adding a charge of black powder to your {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist}, you can change it into an Black Powder Bomb. All of this {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} damage dice are d12s. If a target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage, it loses that {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} for this damage roll. If it has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Fire damage, it instead has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} for this damage roll.
You can use this formula a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once) and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Timed Demolition
entries: When you prime a {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist}, you can set a duration for its detonation, which can be any number of rounds (any increment of 6 seconds) up to 10 minutes. The {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} detonates using the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property at the end of your turn after this duration. If a creature is in the area of more than one {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} explosion simultaneously, the creature is only affected by one {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Blast Shield
entries: Choose one damage type from among Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that damage type until you choose a different one with this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Overloaded Charge
entries: Whenever you expend a number of Reagents equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to empower a {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist}, you gain 2 additional Reagents which you can immediately expend to further empower the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} beyond the normal maximum of Reagents.

subclassFeature.name: Pigmentist
entries: {@i Splash Paint Everywhere to Support Your Allies}

One of the lesser-known duties of Alchemists is synthesizing new and increasingly vibrant pigments from mundane and magical materials—in many cases, creating new colors from whole cloth. Alchemists that specialize in this field are called Pigmentists. An artful and imaginative lot, they seek to brighten the world with their newly-invented hues, or failing that, simply splatter it with marvelous combinations of paint.

subclassFeature.name: Painter
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item Painter's Supplies|XPHB} and gain a bonus to checks using it equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum bonus of +1). Additionally, you can make a gallon of paint whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Paint Bombs
entries: You gain the {@optfeature Paint Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} formula, which doesn't count against your total number of formulae known. If you already have it, gain another formula of your choice. For you, the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} is improved in the following ways.

entries.name: Extended Duration
entries: Creatures remain coated in paint until the end of your next turn, instead of the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Magical Pigments
entries: When you throw a Paint Bomb, choose its color from the Magical Pigment table. Each color corresponds to a damage type. Whenever a creature coated in paint takes damage of the corresponding type, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of that type.

subclassFeature.name: Palette Portals
entries: You mix your paint with conjuration magic. Once on each of your turns, you can use 10 feet of your movement to enter any area of wet paint within 5 feet of you, emerging from another area of wet paint of the same color within 60 feet of you. Both areas of paint must be at least the same size as you and must have been coated within the last minute.

subclassFeature.name: Pigment Potions
entries: Whenever you brew a potion, you can add a pigment from the Magical Pigments table. When a creature drinks this potion, they also gain the benefits of a {@item Potion of Resistance|XDMG} of the corresponding damage type for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Splatter Bombs
entries: Your Paint Bombs are improved in the following ways:

entries.name: Rainbow Blast
entries: You can add up to three colors from the Magical Pigments table when you throw a Paint Bomb.

entries.name: Selective Splatter
entries: When you use the {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property of your Paint Bomb, you can choose for each creature within the area to automatically succeed or fail (your choice) on its saving throw against the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist}.

subclassFeature.name: Ooze Rancher
entries: {@i Brew Bottled Ooze Minions}

Unsurprisingly, Oozes, jellies, and slimes are a fascinating subject for Alchemists who wish to figure out how inanimate chemicals can form together and rise up in a moving, hungry mass. The answer to this question may very well be at the heart of alchemy itself. Alchemists who choose to research slimes in depth are called Ooze Ranchers, for they breed and keep numerous slimes upon which to experiment.

subclassFeature.name: Ooze Resilience
entries: Your experience with Oozes grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Acid Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Acid damage.

entries.name: Ooze Empathy
entries: Additionally, whenever an Ooze tries to attack you, it makes a Wisdom saving throw against your Alchemist save DC. On a failed save, the attack automatically misses you. On a successful save, the Ooze is immune to this feature for the next 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Slime Bomb [Formula]
entries: By mixing your {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} explosive contents with the remnants of an Ooze, you can change it into a Slime Bomb. This {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist} deals no damage, but instead causes the target or each creature within the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of the {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} {@itemMastery Explode|ValdaGunslinger} property to become coated in a viscous, green slime. A creature coated in slime can't take {@action Bonus Action|XPHB|Bonus Actions} or the {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, or {@action Dodge|XPHB} action. This slime lasts for 1 minute or until it or another creature takes the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to remove the slime.

subclassFeature.name: Bottled Oozes
entries: Whenever you brew potions, you can spend 2 Reagents to create a Bottled Ooze, which contains a {@creature Gray Ooze|XMM}. This item retains potency until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, after which it becomes inert.

An Ooze produced by your Bottled Oozes uses your Intelligence modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} for its attack rolls. If the Ooze forces a creature to make a saving throw, it uses your Alchemist save DC.

entries.name: Improved Bottled Oozes
entries: At higher Alchemist levels, you can distill more powerful slimes into Bottled Oozes that you create, as shown on the following table. An Ooze by your Bottled Ooze can't take the Split {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Sacrificial Slime
entries: Whenever you are targeted by an attack while an allied Ooze is within 5 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to command it to move in the way of the attack, causing the attack to target it instead.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Oozes
entries: Whenever you create a Bottled Ooze, choose Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder damage. The Ooze has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to that damage. Whenever it is subjected to that damage type, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half the damage dealt.

action.name: Leech
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Necrotic damage and the snail regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The fright can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) Necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The grep can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a whisper or chitter. A hearer can discern the sounds are imitations with a successful {@dc 10} Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) Slashing damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The jelly can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The jelly sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} in a 10-foot radius.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) Poison damage.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries: The mock adheres to anything that touches it. The mock has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against any creature adhered to it. The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can detach the mock as an action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) Piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Acid damage.

bonus.name: Shape-Shift
entries: The mock shape-shifts to resemble a Tiny object while retaining its game statistics, or it returns to its true blob form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

trait.name: Just a Rock
entries: The rock counts as an object. Additionally, it can't take actions and its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} can't be increased.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The pup has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the pup's {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} is within 5 feet of the creature and the {@variantrule Ally|XPHB} doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) Piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Cold damage.

action.name: Bayonet
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Rifle {@recharge}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 12}, one creature that the tin soldier can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Piercing damage.

monster.name: Yarn Golem
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

action.name: Poke
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Tangle {@recharge}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 12}, one creature that the golem can see within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} If the target is Medium or smaller, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 12}). While {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition.

hp.special: 5 plus five times your Witch level (the familiar has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Witch level)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The familiar two Rend attacks. When you reach Witch level 17, it makes three Rend attacks.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d8 + 4} plus your Charisma modifier Force damage.

bonus.name: Rampage
entries: Immediately after dealing damage to a creature that is already {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, the familiar moves up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and it makes one Rend attack.

monster.name: Skeleton
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 5}, range 80/320 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage.

monster.name: Spirit
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Grave Touch
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) Necrotic damage.

monster.name: Zombie
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it makes a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 5} plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. On a successful save, the zombie drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) Bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Bone Beast
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The beast has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the beast's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Piercing damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition if it is Large or smaller.

monster.name: Gorger
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 13}).

monster.name: Deadnaught

hp.special: 10 plus five times your Necromancer level (the deadnaught has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Necromancer level)

languages: understands the languages you know but can't speak

trait.name: Necromantic Bond
entries: You can only animate and control a deadnaught once you reach Necromancer level 7. While you control a deadnaught, you can't control other thralls.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The deadnaught regains 5 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deadnaught makes two attacks. It makes three attacks when you reach Necromancer level 13, and four attacks when you reach Necromancer level 17.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atkr m} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 4} Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The bloodlurk can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The bloodlurk can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Blood Splash
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 13}, each creature of the bloodlurk's choice in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} origination from the lurker. {@actSaveFail} 17 ({@damage 5d6}) Necrotic damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The slaymate can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) check.

action.name: Scratch
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) Slashing damage.

monster.name: Duskfog
languages: understands Common plus one other language but can't speak

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The duskfog can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Misty Embrace
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 14}, one creature the duskfog can see within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} 18 ({@damage 4d8}) Necrotic damage and the duskfog regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.

hp.special: 5 plus five times your Captain level (the demon has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Captain level)

trait.name: Proficiencies
entries: Simple and Martial weapons

trait.name: Level 9:
entries: Magic Resistance. The demon has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Level 13:
entries: Flight. The demon has a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet.

trait.name: Level 17:
entries: Legendary Resistance (2/Day). If the demon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The demon makes two attacks. At Captain level 11, the demon makes three attacks.

action.name: Abyssal Claw
entries: {@atkr m} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d8} plus your Charisma modifier Force damage.

action.name: Level 5:
entries: Hurl Flame (2/Day). {@actSave dex} DC equals your Cohort save DC, each creature within a 15-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point the demon can see within 120 feet. {@actSaveFail} {@damage 6d6} Fire damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. This damage increases by {@dice 2d6} at Captain level 9 ({@dice 8d6}), 13 ({@dice 10d6}), and 17 ({@dice 12d6}).

hp.special: 6 plus six times your Captain level (the ascetic has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Captain level)

trait.name: Proficiencies
entries: Simple weapons

trait.name: Level 5:
entries: Martial Excellence. The ascetic has a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at Captain level 9, and +3 at Captain level 13.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atkr m} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d6} plus your Charisma modifier Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Level 9:
entries: Multiattack. The ascetic makes two {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}.

action.name: Level 17:
entries: Stunning Strike (2/Day). {@actSave con} DC equals your Cohort save DC, one creature within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} The target's speed is halved and the next attack roll made against the target before then has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

bonus.name: Level 5:
entries: Flurry of Blows (2/Day). The ascetic makes one {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. The ascetic can take this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} once more at Captain levels 9 (3/Day), 13 (4/Day), and 17 (5/Day).

bonus.name: Focused Movement (2/Day)
entries: The ascetic takes the Dash, Disengage, or Dodge action.

reaction.name: Level 13:
entries: Deflect Attack. Trigger: The ascetic is hit by an attack roll and takes Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage from it. {@actResponse} The ascetic reduces the damage taken by your Captain level.

hp.special: 7 plus seven times your Captain level (the Berserker has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Captain level)

trait.name: Proficiencies
entries: Simple and Martial weapons; Shields

trait.name: Bloodied Frenzy
entries: While {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, the berserker has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and saving throws.

trait.name: Level 5:
entries: Martial Excellence. The berserker has a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at Captain level 9, and +3 at Captain level 13.

trait.name: Level 13:
entries: {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} Resolve. While {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, the berserker has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atkr m} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d12} plus your Charisma modifier Slashing damage.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atkr m,r} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft or range 20/60 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d6} plus your Charisma modifier Slashing damage.

bonus.name: Level 5:
entries: Adrenaline Burst. The berserker gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your Captain level.

bonus.name: Level 9:
entries: Furious Strike. The berserker deals {@damage 1d10} extra damage on a hit with a weapon. The damage is the same type dealt by the weapon.

reaction.name: Level 17:
entries: Retaliation. Trigger: A creature within 5 feet of the berserker deals damage to it. {@actResponse} The berserker makes one melee attack.

hp.special: 7 plus seven times your Captain level (the champion has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Captain level)

trait.name: Proficiencies
entries: Simple and Martial weapons; {@spell Light|XPHB}, Medium, and Heavy armor, Shields

trait.name: Level 5:
entries: Martial Excellence. The champion has a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at Captain level 9, and +3 at Captain level 13.

trait.name: Level 13:
entries: Indomitable (2/Day). The champion rerolls a failed saving throw with a bonus equal to your Captain level.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atkr m} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d8} plus your Charisma modifier Slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atkr r} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, range 30/120 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d6} plus your Charisma modifier Piercing damage.

action.name: Level 5:
entries: Flurry (1/Day). The champion makes three attacks in any combination with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}, regardless of circumstance.

action.name: Level 17:
entries: Multiattack. The champion makes two attacks in any combination.

bonus.name: Second Wind (2/Day)
entries: The champion regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Captain level.

bonus.name: Level 9:
entries: Keen Strike. The champion deals {@damage 1d8} extra damage on a hit with a weapon. The damage is the same type dealt by the weapon.

hp.special: 6 plus six times your Captain level (the construct has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Captain level)

trait.name: Construct Build
entries: The construct is Small, Medium, or Large. It gains an action corresponding to its size.

trait.name: Level 5:
entries: Construct Excellence. The construct has a +1 bonus to its AC, attack, and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at Captain level 9, and +3 at Captain level 13.

trait.name: Level 5:
entries: Death Burst. The construct explodes when it dies. {@actSave dex} DC equals your Cohort save DC, each creature in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the construct. {@actSaveFail} {@damage 6d6} Fire damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

trait.name: Level 13:
entries: Magic {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}. The construct has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Level 17:
entries: Unerring Strike (3/Day). When the construct misses with an attack, it hits instead.

action.name: Jolt (Small Only)
entries: {@atkr r} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, range 30 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d8} plus your Charisma modifier Lightning damage and the target can't make Opportunity Attacks until the start of the construct's next turn.

action.name: Slam (Medium Only)
entries: {@atkr m} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d8} plus your Charisma modifier Bludgeoning damage and the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on its next attack roll before the start of the construct's next turn.

action.name: Stomp (Large Only)
entries: {@atkr m} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d8} plus your Charisma modifier Bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

bonus.name: Level 9:
entries: Charged Strike. The construct's attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} Lightning or Thunder damage.

hp.special: 6 plus six times your Captain level (the cultist has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Captain level)

trait.name: Proficiencies
entries: Simple weapons; {@spell Light|XPHB} armor

trait.name: Level 5:
entries: Arcane Excellence. The cultist has a +1 bonus to its spell attack rolls and spell save DC. This bonus increases to +2 at Captain level 9, and +3 at Captain level 13.

trait.name: Level 5:
entries: Greater {@variantrule Curses|XPHB|Curse}. The cultist can choose the Necrotic {@variantrule Damage|XPHB} effect of its Eldritch {@variantrule Curses|XPHB|Curse} in addition to another effect. At Captain level 9, the Necrotic {@variantrule Damage|XPHB} effect deals {@dice 2d8} plus your Charisma modifier Necrotic damage.

action.name: Eldritch Curse
entries: {@actSave wis} DC equals your Cohort save DC, one creature within 60 feet. {@actSaveFail} The cultist chooses one of the following effects.

action.name: Bleeding
entries: Until the start of the cultist's next turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d4} Necrotic damage whenever it takes damage.

action.name: Evil Eye
entries: The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of the cultist's next turn.

action.name: Hobbled
entries: The target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced to 10 feet until the start of the cultist's next turn.

action.name: Necrotic Damage
entries: The target takes {@dice 1d8} plus your Charisma modifier Necrotic damage.

action.name: Level 17:
entries: {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} {@variantrule Curses|XPHB|Curse} (2/Day). {@actSave con} DC equals your Cohort save DC, one creature within 60 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to one damage type of the cultist's choice until the start of the cultist's next turn. This {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} ends early after the target takes the chosen type of damage.

reaction.name: Level 13:
entries: {@spell Hellish Rebuke|XPHB}. The cultist casts {@spell Hellish Rebuke|XPHB} in response to the spell's trigger, using your Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC equals your Cohort save DC).

hp.special: 6 plus six times your Captain level (the hunter has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Captain level)

trait.name: Proficiencies
entries: Simple and Martial weapons; {@spell Light|XPHB} and Medium armor, Shields

trait.name: Level 5:
entries: Martial Excellence. The hunter has a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at Captain level 9, and +3 at Captain level 13.

trait.name: Level 13:
entries: Elusive. Ranged attacks against the hunter have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atkr m} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d6} plus your Charisma modifier Piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atkr r} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, range 80/320 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d8} plus your Charisma modifier Piercing damage.

action.name: Level 5:
entries: Trick Shot. {@actSave dex} DC equals your Cohort save DC, one creature within range of the hunter's weapon. {@actSaveFail} The hunter chooses one of the following effects:

items.name: Pushed
entries: The target is pushed 10 feet straight away from the hunter.

items.name: Prone
entries: The target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Sapped
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on its next attack before the start of the hunter's next turn.

bonus.name: Archer's Mark
entries: When the hunter hits with a Ranged weapon, it marks the target. The hunter has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ranged attack rolls against the marked target for 1 minute or until it uses this feature again.

bonus.name: Level 9:
entries: Bullseye Strike. The hunter deals {@damage 1d10} extra damage on a hit with a Ranged weapon. The damage is the same type dealt by the weapon.

bonus.name: Level 17:
entries: Kill Shot (1/Day). The hunter deals {@damage 4d10} extra damage on a hit with a Ranged weapon. If the target has 50 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or fewer after taking damage, it dies.

hp.special: 6 plus six times your Captain level (the minstrel has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Captain level)

trait.name: Proficiencies
entries: Simple weapons; {@spell Light|XPHB} armor

trait.name: Level 5:
entries: Martial Excellence. The minstrel has a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at Captain level 9, and +3 at Captain level 13.

trait.name: Level 13:
entries: Dramatic Opening. During the first round of combat, the minstrel has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} and attacks against it have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atkr m,r} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60. {@h}{@dice 1d4} plus your Charisma modifier Piercing damage.

action.name: Encouraging Tune
entries: One creature within 60 feet of the minstrel that can see or hear it has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next attack it makes before the start of the minstrel's next turn.

action.name: Taunt
entries: One creature that can hear the minstrel within 60 feet has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on its next attack roll before the start of the minstrel's next turn.

action.name: Level 5:
entries: Multiattack. The minstrel uses Encouraging Tune or Taunt twice in any combination. It can replace one of its uses with a Dagger attack. At Captain level 13, it uses Encouraging Tune or Taunt three times in any combination.

bonus.name: Level 9:
entries: Psychic Strike. The minstrel deals an extra {@damage 1d8} Psychic damage on a hit.

bonus.name: Level 17:
entries: Inspiring Song (1/Day). The minstrel gives {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} to each creature it chooses within a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from it.

hp.special: 6 plus six times your Captain level (the scoundrel has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Captain level)

trait.name: Proficiencies
entries: Simple weapons, Martial weapons that have the Finesse or {@spell Light|XPHB} property; {@spell Light|XPHB} armor

trait.name: Level 5:
entries: Martial Excellence. The scoundrel has a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at Captain level 9, and +3 at Captain level 13.

trait.name: Level 17:
entries: Assassinate (1/Day). During the first round of combat, the scoundrel turns a hit that it makes into a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atkr m} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d6} plus your Charisma modifier Piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atkr r} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, range 80/320 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d6} plus your Charisma modifier Piercing damage.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The scoundrel takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

bonus.name: Level 5:
entries: Improved Cunning {@variantrule Action|XPHB}. The scoundrel takes the Dodge or Help action.

bonus.name: Level 9:
entries: Poison Strike. The scoundrel deals an extra {@damage 2d6} Poison damage on a hit.

reaction.name: Level 13:
entries: Uncanny Dodge. Trigger: The scoundrel is hit by an attack roll. {@actResponse} The scoundrel halves the damage (round down).

hp.special: 6 plus six times your Captain level (the templar has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Captain level)

trait.name: Proficiencies
entries: Simple and Martial weapons; {@spell Light|XPHB}, Medium, and Heavy armor, Shields

trait.name: Level 5:
entries: Martial Excellence. The templar has a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at Captain level 9, and +3 at Captain level 13.

trait.name: Level 9:
entries: Improved Smite. The Radiant damage of the templar's Smite increases by {@dice 1d8} ({@dice 3d8}) and again at level 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

trait.name: Level 13:
entries: Zealous. The templar adds your Charisma modifier to its saving throws.

trait.name: Level 17:
entries: Blessed Blade. The templar has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atkr m} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 2d6} plus your Charisma modifier Slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atkr r} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, range 30/120 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d6} plus your Charisma modifier Piercing damage.

bonus.name: Smite (2/Day)
entries: The templar deals an extra {@damage 2d8} Radiant damage on a hit. The templar can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} once more at Captain level 5 (3/Day), 9 (4/Day), 13 (5/Day), and 17 (6/Day).

reaction.name: Level 5:
entries: Parry. Trigger: The templar is hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon. {@actResponse} The templar adds your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

monster.name: Corporeal Undead

hp.special: 6 plus six times your Captain level (the undead has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Captain level)

languages: understands Common plus one other language

trait.name: Proficiencies
entries: Simple weapons; {@spell Light|XPHB} and Medium armor, Shields

trait.name: Reanimate (1/Day)
entries: If reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} but not destroyed outright, the undead revives with half of its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} after 1 minute.

trait.name: Level 5:
entries: Undead Excellence. The undead has a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at Captain level 9, and +3 at Captain level 13.

trait.name: Level 13:
entries: Regeneration. The undead regains 5 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of its turns if it is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} and has at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d8} plus your Charisma modifier Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape DC equals your Cohort save DC).

action.name: Level 17:
entries: Paralytic Bite (2/Day). {@actSave con} DC equals your Cohort save DC, one creature within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} The target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved until the start of the undead's next turn.

bonus.name: Level 9:
entries: Necrotic Strike. The undead's Slam deals an extra {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Level 5:
entries: Undead Resilience. Trigger: The undead is hit by a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. {@actResponse} The undead turns the {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} into a normal hit.

hp.special: 4 plus four times your Captain level (the undead has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Captain level)

spellcasting.name: Level 5:
headerEntries: {@spell Invisibility|XPHB} (2/Day). The undead casts {@spell Invisibility|XPHB} on itself, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The undead can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Level 5:
entries: Undead Excellence. The undead has a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at Captain level 9, and +3 at Captain level 13.

trait.name: Level 13:
entries: {@spell Resistance|XPHB}. The undead has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage types except Radiant and Force.

action.name: Death Touch
entries: {@atkr m} Bonus equals your Charisma modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d8} plus your Charisma modifier Necrotic damage.

action.name: Level 17:
entries: Life Drain (2/Day). {@actSave con} DC equals your Cohort save DC, one creature within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} {@damage 8d8} Necrotic damage and the undead regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage taken. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

bonus.name: Level 9:
entries: Necrotic Strike. The undead's Death Touch deals an extra {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage.

monster.name: Alchemy Golem

hp.special: 5 plus five times your Alchemist level (the golem has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Alchemist level)

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Alchemical Bond
entries: Add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to any ability check or saving throw the beast makes.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes one Slam and one {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} Bonus equals your Intelligence modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft.  {@h}{@dice 1d8 plus 3} plus your Intelligence modifier Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atkr m} Bonus equals your Intelligence modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d6 plus 3} plus your Intelligence modifier Bludgeoning damage.

monsterFluff.name: Death Snail
entries: A death snail is formed from a vile concoction of forest troll bone meal, giant eagle blood, and goblin fingernails, sealed up in a hollowed-out efreet horn, and capped shut with an ettercap tongue. The resulting monstrosity possesses a dull intelligence, but its only impulse is to slay all creatures other than its master.

monsterFluff.name: Flying Book
entries: Little can be said about the flying book that is not readily apparent. Though it is indistinguishable from an arcanist's spellbook while motionless, this animated arcane tome can flutter through the air at a moment's notice, using its cover as rudimentary wings. Flying books are playful, and enjoy the sensation of being written in.

monsterFluff.name: Fright
entries: Hauntings can usually be attributed to the usual spectral suspects: ghosts, specters, shadows, and poltergeists. But benign hauntings, where the restless spirit merely plays tricks on the living, is usually caused by a fright. These spirits are usually the artifacts of children or entertainers, clinging to the afterlife for company and a semblance of affection, and are as such preoccupied with fun. They never willingly harm others when they haunt a house, and will serve any master that conjures them, if only for the sake of inclusion.

monsterFluff.name: Grep
entries: A grep is an underground scavenger, known for using its keen vision, acute hearing, and silent flight to trick and steal from travelers, hoarding its possessions in well- hidden troves. Arcanists use greps as messengers and scouts, but they excel as retrievers; a grep can be given the name of an important object and sent to find it, returning a short time later with its prize.

monsterFluff.name: Mock
entries: The diminutive relative of the mimic, the mock is a tiny shapechanger that replicates small, valuable objects to lure in its victims. In the desert, a mock might take the form of a canteen of precious water, and in a dungeon, it may replicate a sizeable jewel or a spare gold piece. If an adventurer is caught by surprise, a mock is just as dangerous as its larger relatives, for can hide in far less conspicuous places.

monsterFluff.name: Moon Jelly
entries: Though incapable of surviving on land, moon jellies are favored for their bioluminescence by witches that intend to explore deep underwater.

monsterFluff.name: Pet Rock
entries: Widely considered to be the perfect familiar, requiring no food or water and possessing extremely high natural defenses, a pet rock can be conjured by most spellcasters. Though it does not act with any agility (indeed, it does not move at all), it can make a formidable weapon when thrown.

monsterFluff.name: Rag Doll
entries: Crudely constructed, but oddly endearing, rag dolls are constructs formed from children's toys, stuffed with soft material and adorned with smiling faces. Besides being generally comforting to have around, spellcasters favor rag dolls as familiars for their fairly durable construction and inconspicuous nature; nobody questions a discarded doll, after all.

monsterFluff.name: Tin Soldier
entries: Full of ticking clockwork and mechanical gizmos, tin soldiers are mechanical creations fashioned by arcanists as servants and messengers. With some patience and skill, almost anyone can build a tin soldier, but spellcasters have long devised methods to conjure them wholesale from the Plane of Law's excess energies.

monsterFluff.name: Winter Wolf Pup
entries: When fully grown, a winter wolf is an apex predator of the snow, a terror of teeth and fur, stalking the tundra in packs. But before they develop their fearsome freezing breath, winter wolf pups are far more amicable (perhaps because they have yet to realize the scope of their own might), and will dutifully follow a master that feeds them well and treats them with respect.

monsterFluff.name: Yarn Golem
entries: The greatest of golems are formed of iron, stone, and clay, but the least of them are constructed of yarn. Balled and sewn into a vaguely humanoid shape, yarn golems are among the first animated objects that arcanists learn to create, practicing with them obsessively until they master the basics and move onto more rigid materials. Yarn golems are friendly and playful, but risk foolishly unraveling themselves if they catch on sharp objects.

monsterFluff.name: Zombie
entries: A zombie is the rotting remains of the once living, held together and driven by dark magic.

monsterFluff.name: Bone Beast
entries: Constructed of haphazardly assembled humanoid bones, a bone beast looks nothing like a man. Lumbering about on four legs with great boney fangs, the beast can run as fast as a bear and strike as viciously as a lion.

monsterFluff.name: Gorger
entries: An unholy tangling of flesh, the gorger still vaguely resembles a humanoid in profile, except for the gaping, toothed maw in its chest. Its colossal teeth are little more than sharpened ribs, but its monstrous bite can easily decapitate.

monsterFluff.name: Deadnaught
entries: An Undead hulk clad in heavy armor, a deadnaught is a Necromancer's most fearsome ally.

entries.name: Proficiencies
entries: Simple and Martial weapons; Light, Medium, and Heavy armor, Shields. The monster can equip any gear for which it has proficiency or training.

monsterFluff.name: Bloodlurk
entries: An awful hybrid of Undead and Ooze, a bloodlurk is animated from the coagulated blood of the dead and bubbles with necromantic malice.

monsterFluff.name: Spirit
entries: A spirit is the scarcely tangible echo of humanoid, a soul bound to the mortal realm by necromantic magic.

monsterFluff.name: Skeleton
entries: The renanimated remains of humanoids long since dead, skeletons are puppets of bone held aloft by strings of magic.

monsterFluff.name: Ascetic
entries: An ascetic is a disciplined, nimble combatant whose fists are as deadly as weapons.

monsterFluff.name: Berserker
entries: Ruthless and fierce, the berserker tears across the battlefield in a wild frenzy, devastating their enemies with boundless rage.

monsterFluff.name: Champion
entries: A champion is a skilled, tactical fighter, just as comfortable in the saddle during military drills as armored on the field of battle.

monsterFluff.name: Construct Cohort
entries: With the help of a tinkerer or a mage, you gain the unwavering, mechanical loyalty of a golem, shield guardian, or clockwork construct. Your Construct is of a smaller variety than most golems, but can be built and repaired in far less time.

monsterFluff.name: Cultist
entries: Dogmatic and often unhinged, cultists draw upon forbidden, eldritch allies for a taste of arcane might.

monsterFluff.name: Hunter
entries: A hunter is a naturally skilled tracker and outlander, as comfortable in the depths of the woods as in a tavern or town.

monsterFluff.name: Mage
entries: A mage is a brilliant and studious spellcaster, well versed in the study of all things arcane.

monsterFluff.name: Minstrel
entries: With lute in hand, a minstrel keeps their traveling companions in high spirits and slings vicious taunts at their enemies.

monsterFluff.name: Priest
entries: A devout adherent to the faith, a priest can work minor divine miracles with the whispering of prayers and the waving of hands.

monsterFluff.name: Scoundrel
entries: Stealthy and subversive, the scoundrel is as adept an assassin as a burglar or thief.

monsterFluff.name: Shaman
entries: A shaman is an adherent to the ancient forces of nature and the spirits that suffuse all things.

monsterFluff.name: Templar
entries: A daring knight, sworn to virtue and station, a templar knows no fear in their heart and no equal in battle.

spell.name: Arcane Anomaly
entries: You create a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you that distorts magical energy. For the duration, whenever a spell is cast within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 5 or 6, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

spell.name: Accursed Act
entries: Lighting a candle, you attempt to curse a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be cursed for the duration. Until the spell ends, the creature takes Psychic damage equal to {@dice 1d8} plus your spellcasting ability modifier whenever it makes an attack roll or casts a spell. The target only takes this damage once per turn. The spell ends early if the target doesn't attack or cast a spell on its turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Candy Blast
entries: You summon a handful of hard candy—boiled sweets, mints, jelly beans, etc.—and hurl them at a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Force damage and the candy forms a pile on the ground in its space, causing a 5-foot-square area of your choice in the target's space to become {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. The candy produced by this pell is edible, but has no nutritional value, and vanishes after 1 minute, ending any {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Corruption Curse
entries: With a piercing glare and a sinister gesture, you send ribbons of dark magic toward a creature you can see within range. For the duration, the target is cursed and suffers one of the following effects of your choice.

entries.name: Dull Reflexes
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity checks and saving throws.

entries.name: Feeble Fortitude
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws and can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Weak Will
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom saving throws and spell attack rolls.

spell.name: Curse of Aging
entries: A creature you touch must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be cursed to age and wither. While cursed, the target ages at ten times the normal rate, becoming ten days older for each day that passes. Additionally, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Strength checks and saving throws.

spell.name: Curse of Binding

components.m: a body part from the intended target, such as a fingernail, a lock of hair, or a drop of blood

entries: You attempt to bind a creature or object to a location. Choose a target and a point within range that you can see. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be cursed to remain within 30 feet of the point. If the target starts its turn further than 30 feet from the point, it must succeed on a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC or be dragged 60 feet toward the point. Additionally, if the creature tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel, it must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the attempt fails and wastes the spell or effect. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Curse of Blades
entries: You attempt to drive a creature you can see within range to violence. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be cursed and have the Frenzied condition for the duration.

A creature with the Frenzied condition loses the ability to distinguish between friend and foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies. While Frenzied, the creature chooses the targets for its attacks, spells, and abilities randomly from among the creatures it can see within range, and it must make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} if any creature provokes one.
At the end of its turn, an affected creature can repeat its saving throw, ending the spell early on a success.

spell.name: Curse of Chains
entries: A black brand resembling iron shackles appears on a creature you can see within range, which must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be cursed for the duration. While cursed, the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 and can't increase. The target can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, the spell ends.

spell.name: Curse Ward
entries: You reach out your hand and touch a willing creature, raising a smoke-like barrier around it. For the duration, the target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage and can't be cursed or possessed. If the target is already under one of these effects, the effect is suppressed until the spell ends.

spell.name: Curse Object

m.text: powdered onyx worth 100+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You bestow a curse upon an object that you touch. The object must be one that isn't being worn or carried and is able to fit within a 5-foot cube. Until the spell ends, the object becomes magical (requiring attunement) and cursed. The fact that the object is cursed is revealed only when an Identify spell is cast on it or a creature attunes to it. When a creature attunes to the object, the curse extends to it for the duration. Choose the curse from the following effects.

entries.name: Bleeding
entries: The attuned creature can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Frenzied (Weapon Only)
entries: Whenever the attuned creature deals damage with the cursed weapon, it has the Frenzied condition for 1 minute. A creature with the Frenzied condition loses the ability to distinguish between friend and foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies. While Frenzied, the creature chooses the targets for its attacks, spells, and abilities randomly from among the creatures it can see within range, and it must make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} if any creature provokes one.

entries.name: Hobbled
entries: The attuned creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved and can't take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action.

entries.name: Obsessed
entries: The attuned creature is unwilling to part with the object, keeping it on its person at all times. If the cursed object is a weapon, the attuned creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls with weapons other than the cursed weapon.

entries.name: Restless
entries: Whenever the attuned creature finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or gain no benefits from the rest.

entries.name: Speechless
entries: The attuned creature can't speak.

entries.name: Unfortunate
entries: Whenever the target rolls a 20 on the {@dice d20} of a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, the roll instead becomes a 1.

entries.name: Vulnerable
entries: The attuned creature has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to one damage type (choose when you cast this spell).

spell.name: Demand

components.m: a snake's tongue and a piece of copper wire

entries: This spell projects a select Enchantment spell to a target, regardless of distance. When you cast {@spell Charm Monster|XPHB}, {@spell Charm Person|XPHB}, {@spell Command|XPHB}, {@spell Dominate Beast|XPHB}, {@spell Dominate Person|XPHB}, {@spell Geas|XPHB}, or {@spell Suggestion|XPHB}, before this spell ends, you modify its casting so that its range becomes unlimited. This spell then ends.

Choose a target with which you are familiar (whether or not you can see it) for the Enchantment spell. If the spell requires a verbal command, the creature hears the command in its mind and recognizes you as the sender if it knows you.

You can project the spell across any distance, and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a {@chance 5} chance that the Enchantment spell fails and has no effect.

spell.name: Eldritch Orb
entries: You fling a ball of eldritch energy at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Force damage and explodes in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. Each creature in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking half the amount of Force damage on a failed save, or none on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Elemental Curse
entries: A spark leaps from your finger to a creature you touch, spreading in bright cracks across its skin. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be cursed for the duration. The cursed target has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to your choice of Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage. If the creature has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the chosen damage type, it instead loses that {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}. If the target has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the chosen damage type, it instead has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that damage type.

spell.name: Exhume
entries: Choose an unoccupied 20-foot square on the ground within range. This spell causes one pile of Humanoid bones to rise out of the ground within that square. If you cast this spell within a burial place such as a graveyard, mausoleum, or barrow, {@dice 1d4} corpses or piles of bones are exhumed. The ground itself isn't disturbed by this spell; the bones simply appear out of the ground.

spell.name: Face Swap
entries: You place an {@condition invisible} sigil on a willing target you can see within range. This sigil lasts until the spell ends.

For the duration, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to project your face onto the marked creature until you dismiss the effect (no action required). When you do so, you can see, hear, and speak through the marked creature as if you occupied its space. You use your senses instead of those of the marked creature.

spell.name: Flawed Reconstruction
entries: You stitch together the wounds of a creature you touch, which regains {@dice 3d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. However, the mending is imperfect, and the target's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum is reduced by {@dice 1d6}, to a minimum of 1.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 2d6} and the reduction increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Frenzy
entries: With a gesture, you reduce a crowd to base instinct and violence. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point you choose within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature has the Frenzied condition for the duration.

A creature with the Frenzied condition loses the ability to distinguish between friend and foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies. While Frenzied, the creature chooses the targets for its attacks, spells, and abilities randomly from among the creatures it can see within range, and it must make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} if any creature provokes one.
The Frenzied condition ends after 1 minute, or when the spell ends. At the end of its turn, an affected creature can repeat its saving throw, ending the condition on itself early on a success.

spell.name: Gahoul's Scapegoat
entries: You trace a complex arcane symbol on the flesh of a willing creature you touch, marking it for sacrifice. When you are hit by an attack roll during the spell's duration and the marked creature is within 60 feet of yourself, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to teleport, swapping places with the creature and forcing it to be hit by the attack instead of you. The spell then ends.

spell.name: Hex: Abate
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hex: Apathy
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@variantrule Indifferent [Attitude]|XPHB|Indifferent} about creatures of your choice that it is {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} toward. This indifference ends if the target takes damage or is forced to make a saving throw. When the spell ends at the end of your next turn, the creature's attitude returns to normal.

spell.name: Hex: Bleeding
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, each time the target takes damage until the spell ends at the end of your next turn, it takes an extra {@damage 1d4} Necrotic damage. If the target is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage instead.

spell.name: Hex: Charm
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. It does so with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} if you or your {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} are fighting it. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. The spell ends early if you or your {@variantrule Ally|XPHB|Allies} deal damage to the target. When the spell ends, the target knows it was {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by you.

spell.name: Hex: Disorient
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target must subtract {@dice 1d4} from attack rolls it makes until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The die subtracted from attack rolls changes when you reach level 5 ({@dice 1d6}), 11 ({@dice 1d8}), and 17 ({@dice 1d10}).

spell.name: Hex: Doomward
entries: You touch a willing creature. The first time the target would drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} before the spell ends at the end of your next turn, the target instead drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}, and the spell ends. This spell has no effect if you have cast this spell on the target within the past 24 hours.

spell.name: Hex: Duplicity
entries: You create an illusory duplicate of yourself in your space. When a creature hits you with an attack before the spell ends at the end of your next turn, roll a {@dice d6}. On 4 or higher, the attack strikes the duplicate instead of you and the spell ends. The duplicate otherwise ignore all other damage and effects. A creature is unaffected by this spell if it has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition, {@sense Blindsight|XPHB}, or {@sense Truesight|XPHB}.

spell.name: Hex: Evil Eye
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hex: Fortune
entries: You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends at the end of your next turn, the target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws.

spell.name: Hex: Garble
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature can't speak coherently or cast spells with a Verbal component until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hex: Go Unseen
entries: Repeating an ancient chant, you have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. Creatures within 10 feet of yourself that can hear can detect your location for the spell's duration. The spell ends early if you make an attack roll, deal damage, or cast a spell.

spell.name: Hex: Hobble
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced to 10 feet until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. If the target is flying, it falls, unless it has the ability to hover.

spell.name: Hex: Mire
entries: You transform the ground in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you into murky swamp, which is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. This {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} doesn't cost you extra movement.

spell.name: Hex: Misfortune
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range. Until the spell ends at the end of your next turn, whenever the target rolls a 20 on the {@dice d20} of a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, the roll instead becomes a 1.

spell.name: Hex: Obfuscate
entries: You produce fog in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. The fog spreads around corners, and its area is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB}. This fog lasts until the spell ends at the end of your next turn or until a strong wind (such as one created by {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB}) disperses it, ending the spell.

spell.name: Hex: Peacebond
entries: You create a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you that locks weapons to their containers. The weapons and ammunition of each creature within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} become fixed in their sheaths, quivers, or holsters until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. A creature can take a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC, freeing an item from its container on a success.

spell.name: Hex: Pox
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hex: Ruin
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has a -2 penalty to AC until the spell ends at the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The penalty to AC increases by 1 when you reach levels 5 (-3), 11 (-4), and 17 (-5).

spell.name: Hex: Stupor
entries: One creature you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the spell ends at the end of your next turn. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell's effect. Once the spell ends on a target, it is immune to this spell for the next 24 hours.

spell.name: Hex: Tremors
entries: A miniature earthquake shakes the ground in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. Each creature on the ground in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. A creature that enters the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} or ends its turn there must also succeed on that save or fall {@condition Prone|XPHB}. This spell ends at the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Hex: Ward
entries: You touch a willing creature. Each time the target takes damage before the spell ends at the end of your next turn, the damage it takes is reduced by 2.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage reduction increases by 1 when you reach levels 5 (-3), 11 (-4) and 17 (-5).

spell.name: Hocuspocus
entries: You conjure minor paranormal phenomena and other ominous effects. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its effects active at a time.

entries.name: Grave Mists
entries: A rolling fog gathers on the ground in a 15-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} for 1 minute.

entries.name: Ominous Lights
entries: You cause all candles, torches, and other open flames to darken and flicker for 1 minute.

entries.name: Paranormal Chill
entries: You can chill or warm the air in a 10-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} by 10 degrees for 1 minute.

entries.name: Poltergeist Activity
entries: You cause small, unattended objects to rattle or levitate an inch off the ground for 1 minute.

entries.name: Spirit Orbs
entries: You create up to four fist-sized spectral, glowing orbs, which float around within range for 1 minute. The orbs don't provide light, apart from a dim glow.

entries.name: Spooky Noises
entries: You create a quiet sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as ominous whispers, the drone of insects, or the sound of crying. The sound lasts for 1 minute.

spell.name: Hollowing Curse
entries: Tendrils of vitality-draining mist extend from your fingertips. A creature you can see within range makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage and is cursed for the duration. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

On each of your subsequent turns, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to deal damage to the cursed creature. The damage equals {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage if you took the {@action Magic|XPHB} action or half as much if you took a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Identity Curse
entries: You touch a creature's temple and attempt to erase its identity. One creature you touch makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 1 hour and is cursed to forget its identity. When the target awakens, it loses all its personal memories, though it retains its general knowledge, proficiencies, and other statistics. The target doesn't realize it has any class features, feats, or magical abilities, and so doesn't willingly use them unless it rediscovers them.
